campaign.story:
Join the community on the ArcWorlde Facebook group!
ArcWorlde: Second Edition - Ourks introduces a new Faction to collect, paint and play for the narrative fantasy battle game from Warploque Miniatures.
The Ourks assemble!
ArcWorlde: Second Edition is a narrative battle game set in a whimsical fantasy world, where you play exciting story-driven scenarios on the tabletop.
Players use their wits, tactical skill and outside-of-the-box creative thinking to play fun and memorable clashes between heroes, warbands and monsters in a game that is quick, engaging and easy to learn, with beautiful hand-sculpted miniatures.
Click here!
Click here for the Ourk Faction Ruleset (Beta)!
ArcWorlde: Second Edition - Ourks brings a whole new playable Faction to the game, as well as reinforcements for the other five Factions!
Download the ArcWorlde: Second Edition Tabletop Simulator Pack Here!
 Check out the models on the Kickstarter Launch Stream!
Here are the models being made for the ArcWorlde: Second Edition - Ourks Kickstarter.




These are the available pledge levels for this Kickstarter. Watch out for Stretch Goals, as they might add free goodies on top of your core pledges!

 There are (currently) five more Factions available for ArcWorlde: Second Edition. You may choose any of these Starter Warbands for your BREWZERKER or DREAMEATER pledge. 
Click here to see the other Characters are available for the Halflings!
Click here to see the other Characters are available for the Wild Elves!
Click here to see the other Characters are available for the Beastfolk!
Click here to see the other Characters are available for the Undead Raiders!
Click here to see the other Characters are available for the Imperials!
To find out more about these Factions, and to see what other miniatures are available for them, please visit their sections on the Warploque Miniatures website - www.warploqueminiatures.com.

Adding Existing ArcWorlde products
If you would like to add existing ArcWorlde products from the webstore to your pledge, you can absolutely do so! This will be arranged via the Pledge Manager, and more information will be posted soon.
The cost of shipping is not included in your pledge, and will be added after the conclusion of the campaign through the pledge manager.
I will provide you all with full instructions when the time comes. I am still finalising the exact shipping costs, but to give you a rough idea here are a couple of preliminary estimates:
TREASURE MAP: - £0 unless used to purchase miniatures in the campaign.
BOGLIN/OURK/BREWZERKER: £4 to the UK, £12 EU (Tracked Shipping) £15 US (Tracked shipping), £15 ROW (Tracked Shipping).
DREAMEATER: £5 to the UK, £15 EU (Tracked Shipping) £20 US (Tracked shipping), £18 ROW (Tracked Shipping).
These estimates may increase if you purchase a large number of additional models on top of your core pledge. The final shipping costs are subject to change, and will be based on your location and specific rewards.
If you are backing from outside of the UK, please be aware of any import or customs fees your country will charge you. Warploque Miniatures is not a VAT registered business, and as such your country may charge you VAT on your shipment.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any undertaking of this nature is a huge commitment and a lot of work for everyone involved. Miniatures need sculpting, manufacturing, packing and eventually shipping to the backers.

It is at these hurdles that some Kickstarters have faltered in the past, so, I have given careful consideration to each part of the process to minimise potential risk. Warploque Miniatures is a family run business, so everyone involved is 100% dedicated to making this project as successful and professional as possible. My father is our resin caster, my mother is in charge of packing and shipment, and our metal caster is a tried and tested craftsman we have worked with for over five years.

Also, instead of relying purely on concept art and work-in-progress sculpts to illustrate my products all of the initial models that I am offering have already been sculpted. They've been cast, the display copies have been painted, and they are ready to go into production, so backers know exactly what they are investing in. I will be relying on Work in Progress sculpts and concept art for some of the stretch goals, but be assured that they will be completed and cast in a timely manner once the campaign has been funded.

Finally, I have set achievable delivery date estimates. I have kept the campaign small and manageable, eschewing an overly long list of stretch goals, so this project has a much higher probability of being completed and delivered on time.

This is the 10th Kickstarter that Warploque Miniatures has run, and we have a reputation amongst our community for not only delivering a high quality product, but delivering it on time. If you would like to discuss any aspect of an ArcWorlde campaign with previous Kickstarter backers, please join us on the ArcWorlde Facebook group - https://www.facebook.com/groups/arcworldeofficial.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We only use the best materials for our miniatures, which are sturdy and durable for extended gaming sessions.
Environmentally friendly factories
All Warploque Miniatures products are manufactured locally in the UK by local craftsmen.

updates.update_content:
Ho there, Arcfans!
I hope you are all well, and enjoying yourselves in the summer sun (at least in the northern hemisphere, and I hope you folks down south are enjoying your winter). 
Just thought I'd give you an update on the progress of the project. At the moment there isn't too much to report, casting is coming along at a roaring pace, and both my dad Rob (the resin caster) and Jon the metal caster are hard at work making all of the minis you unlocked.

Ho there, ArcFans!
Hope you are all keeping well, and have been enjoying yourselves over the past few weeks.
This is a little reminder that the pledge manager for the Ourks Kickstarter closes TOMORROW! After then, your orders and addresses will be locked, so if you'd like to add anything more to your pledge please do so before the 10th of May.
If you have yet to fill out your pledge manager, please please please get it done before tomorrow. We are on an extremely tight schedule, and any stragglers will have to wait until after the main batch has been sent off for their minis.

Ho there, ArcFans!

The Pledge Manager for the project has now been launched! You all should have received an email from BackerKit with a link to your own personalised form - if not, please pop me a message and I'll send one to you directly.

Ho there, ArcFans!
I hope you are well. I am delighted to announce that the pledge manager for the campaign will be launching this week! I can't give you an exact date, as I am still waiting on the final approval from BackerKit, but I will post another update when it is live. 
As with all ArcWorlde projects, we are on a very tight schedule to make sure you get all of your models as soon as possible. As such, the pledge manager will close on the 10th of May 2021. Anyone who submits their pledge manager after that date won't have their pledges shipped with the main batch, and may have to wait some time for their orders to be processed - you have been waaaaaaaarned!

Ho there, ArcFans!
WE DID IT!
A huge thank you to everyone who backed the campaign. I'm over the moon with how well it's done, and I can't wait to get cracking on all the new models we've unlocked over the past 2 weeks!
So, what happens now?

Ho there, ArcFans!
It's the final day of the campaign!
I hope you've all had as much fun as I have. And to celebrate the final day, it's time to reveal the final member of the Ourks for this Kickstarter:

Ho there, ArcFans!
It's the second to last day of the campaign, and I've save something special for last. What at least half of you have been waiting for....
The new Halfling models!

Ho there, ArcFans!
Hope you are all well, and have had a lovely weekend. It seems to have gone by so fast, but we are already approaching the final 48 hours of the campaign - madness!
Speaking of madness, we've unlocked another bloomin' stretch goal -

Ho there, ArcFans!

It's the weekend! Hope you've got lots of exciting things planned, or have a long relaxing Saturday and Sunday.
It's day 11 of the campaign, and as such another stretch goal has been unlocked! This time it's the turn of the Imperials to reinforce their Warbands...

campaign.story:
Prepare for adventure in this huge open-world gamebook series. Legendary Kingdoms is a gamebook campaign, where you lead a party of adventurers in a world that adapts to your actions. Venture into ancient ruins, pick a side and lead an army into battle, sail the high seas on your own warship, defeat tyrants or restore them to power. Along the way your party will increase in skill, wealth and renown, allowing them to take on more challenging adventures. Reach the heights of power and you may uncover a dreadful threat to the world itself and go on a mission that spans all six gamebooks in the series.
So is this a Solo Gamebook or an RPG?
The Legendary Kingdoms series has been designed to be played solo, as a choose your own adventure gamebook. However, as you lead a party of four adventurers on an epic journey in a truly sandbox world, we have had playthroughs where one person has acted as the GM (Narrator) and four friends have taken on a character each.
It works just as well being played online as it does around a table.
Playtesters and backers have commented on how good this book is for someone who would love to have a go at being a GM, but are daunted by the task. With simple combat rules and the turns already written out, where better to have your first go at being a GM, than in Legendary Kingdoms.
Follow the link below and download a free sample and give it a go.
We are raising funds to produce the second book in the series, Book Two: Crown and Tower. Book One is already in print, and you can buy it here, or get it as part of a pledge bundle when you order Book Two. You can also play a fully illustrated free sample of book one here to experience a little of the gamebook adventure.

In total, Spidermind Games is planning to produce six titles in the legendary Kingdoms series. With your help we can bring book two, 'Crown & Tower' to life and begin work on the next in the series. It is our plan to release one title a year, completing the collection in 2025.
You can explore the world of Legendary Kingdoms in any order you choose. Each book is dedicated to a particular geographic area, but you can travel between books at will by walking or sailing off the edge of the map. Each book features dozens of quests and locations with an approximate 12+ hours of content in each.
Features of Legendary Kingdoms
A world that adapts to your choices. The book ‘remembers’ the friends you make and enemies you defeat. Slain kings will stay dead, and as you grow in fame people’s reactions to you will also change.
A changing world. Depending on your choices, new avenues of adventure, or new trouble, could await you in locations you have previously explored.
A detailed world. From the lawless deserts of the Valley of Bones, to the feudal hierarchies of the Kingdom of Royce. Embrace the wild freedoms of the buccaneering Splintered Isles, or face morbid darkness in the forges of Drakehallow.  Be the first to map the unexplored Savage Lands, or dethrone a corrupt king in the ludicrously wealthy Duchy of Pendrilor. Multi-book spanning quests allow you to further your ambitions in distant courts, and make friends in foreign nations that might help you when you visit their homeland.
Party based adventures. You are not alone, but can combine the skills of up to four different characters in your party.
The game can be played solo or in a group.  It also works online with one player acting as the reader!  A good lockdown game.
Characters that are grounded in the Legendary Kingdoms world. Each party member has ties to a different book in the series, and each has unresolved issues in their homeland. Characters can seek redemption, seize power, exact revenge or fall in love with other party members.
Fast paced but tactical personal combat.
Raise an army and fight mass combat battles with thousands of soldiers on each side. Conquered one realm? Transfer troops from one book to another if you can capture city-ports with access to ships.
Sail the world on your own ship. Gather an armada and defeat powerful rulers with your own fleet of warships. Or peacefully trade goods between rich ports.
Powerful magic unlocks secrets galore! Think you’ve completely explored an area? Discover the Shadow Door spell and find hidden paths in old dungeons. Learn how to Teleport and access areas impossible to find without magic. Bypass a foe’s defences by using Teleport Circle to appear inside their fortress, allowing you to rob them blind.
Forge magic items with magical weaves. Raise armies with gold bullion. Raid vaults to find treasures that provide great wealth and power.
A globe-spanning mega plot. Concealed within the books are hints of a deadly and growing danger. When you hit the heights of power you might be able to unravel a conspiracy that threatens the very world itself.
 What are the reviewers saying...
Becca Scott from Good Time Society tells you everything you need to know about Crown & Tower.
Doug from 2+Tough takes us into the Arena at the beginning of his adventure.
 Joe, Hannah and Alex over at Roll for Review take a look at Crown & Tower and Joe is impressed...
Todd from ClassicRolePlayer did a review and playthrough of book 1 a few weeks back.
Each book in the Legendary Kingdom series covers a different geographic area on the world map. These region books each have a more detailed, zoomed-in version of the map. Every location on the map can be reached, either on foot, by sea or by magical transportation (if you possess such a power). You can go back and forth between books at will – just walk or sail off the edge of the map.
Book 1: The Valley of Bones takes place in a desert wilderness where tyrant kings oppress the teeming masses in a land strewn with ancient artefacts and ruins. But their grip on power is fragile … and the citizenry are ripe for revolution. It is a land of blood and sand, where civilisation is rare and terrible beasts roam freely.
Book 2: Crown and Tower takes place in the high-medieval realm of Longport Bay, torn apart by the struggle for power between two noble families. Baron Baldwin Dayne lies dying, and his children must grasp the mantle of power, or see their family destroyed forever. Ancient ruins await plunder and exploration, and savage armies hang on the borders, waiting for the county to weaken itself with its incessant warring. Glittering steel, the flash of long forgotten magics, and terrible monsters all wait to be found as you build your strength for the final confrontation.
Book 3: Pirates of the Splintered Isles is set in a tropical paradise, where competition for spice has the great powers of the world vying for domination.
Book 4: The Gilded Throne covers the duchy of Pendrilor, seat of the corrupt king of Royce. Wealth drips from its ports, but it is blind to an encroaching threat which could see it wiped from the globe!
Book 5: The Savage Lands is set in an untamed wilderness, unmapped by civilised realms. A terrible secret lurks in its forgotten grottos and sky-touching mountains.
Book 6: Drakehallow is a gas-powered hell of furnaces and sorcery. The population cram into over-packed, crumbling cities for fear of encountering the monstrous creations of their depraved industry. 
More Art
We are commissioning 20 more pieces of art for the book including a more detailed pictorial journey through the city of Longport Bay.
 ‘The Sonderleign Drops’
A brand new stand alone adventure.
“There is something I desire, but it is located in a place my conventional agents will not go. Deep in the woods to the northwest are the Sonderleign Drops, the ruins of a fantastic underground city. Many have attempted to excavate and explore it in the past, but even the largest expeditions have failed.”
This adventure is on top of a book, already with more that 900 references and will test your team but the rewards are well worth it.”
Yet More Art
Travelling the County of Longport Bay this art expansion creates more images of the rich and diverse land you are exploring.

‘Missing, Presumed Dead’
A second brand new adventure takes your team on a mission to find an important officer of the crown who has gone missing. This particular man is a clerk at the seigneurial office. Its role is to determine which nobles own which piece of land, which family members are permitted to inherit titles, and what legal privileges the ownership of certain noble ranks grant in tax and trade law. It is pretty dry stuff, but the decisions of the seigneurial office can ruin lesser families or provoke war between greater ones.
Where is he and why did he suddenly disappear?
Production Upgrade
Collectors Edition:-
It was suggested that we have dust covers for the collectors editions, so that these premium copies of the Legendary Kingdoms series can enjoy the same amazing cover art that the softbacks do. We loved the suggestion and so as soon as this stretch is hit we will include dust covers on all current and future current and future volumes of the LK Collectors Edition.
Softback Edition:-
Having spoken to the printers the book will now with thicker more sturdy paper but at no extra cost. This upgrade will extend the life of the book and give the pages a smoother feel and a crisper print.
‘Maw of Abraxas’
You are wandering the bleak Mawlands, an area of scrubland just north of the Salvar Rise, a chain of mountains that shields the county of Longport Bay from the Savage Lands to the south.
The area gets its name from the terrifying cave network known as the Maw of Abraxas, which plunges into the mountain foothills. It has a terrifying reputation as a place of death, although rumours persist of great treasures hidden away in its secret vaults.
Tempted?
Even More Art
Getting to know the characters more with extra art covering even more of the key moments in your adventures.
Bookmark Ribbon and a Character Sheet Upgrade
Another great suggestion from our backers is the very useful page holder ribbon and it would be our pleasure to be able to include this in every Collectors Edition copy.
We have also taken a look at the free character sheet everyone can download as a pdf and decided it need the same art upgrade as the maps. We will show off the new and improved version here on the updates when it has been complete.
A Brand New Adventure, played live on our Facebook Group.
Play Legendary Kingdoms with players across the world on Facebook!  If this target is reached, Legendary Kingdoms author Oliver Hulme will create a unique adventure that will update on Facebook every week.  Players worldwide will help in designing party members, and will jointly decide what actions to take that week via Facebook polls.
Create your own characters or choose from six adventurers with their own deep backstory in the world, each of whom have personalised quests and interactions with the plot. Your characters can gain special powers, fall in love, seek revenge, become lords and ladies and encounter friends, family and enemies from their youths. Each of the six starting characters were brought up in a different part of the world, and all have their own special quests to resolve in their homeland.
(or Nitty-gritty)
Legendary Kingdoms uses a success-based dice system for skill checks and combat. Each party-member has a skill value in each of the five main skills of the game (Fighting, Stealth, Lore, Survival and Charisma). Each skill point allows you to roll a single die. Sar Jessica Dayne, for instance, has a Fighting skill of 5, which means she can roll 5 dice whenever she makes any Fighting skill checks. Your party will either make skill-checks individually, if they are separated, or as a team if more than one person can help with a check.
Your skills can improve through experience or by finding special items. Find a steel longsword (Fighting +2) and you can improve your Fighting skill by 2, for instance. As you play, you will have to decide if you want your party-members to specialise in certain skills, or have them generally improve all their skills. Both ideas have merit. Specialisation is powerful when you are working as a team … but if your party has an argument or someone wanders off on their own, you might prefer it if everyone was equipped to handle everything. Just like real life, you won’t always be able to count on your friends being around all the time!
The game keeps track of events through the use of codes. Save an old man and his family from the city guards and you might gain the code A15. Every so often, the book will ask you if you have a code. Having the code A15 will stop you from constantly encountering old men being hassled by the city guards every time you walk down the street!
The best way to see how the game works is by playing it. You can download the Kickstarter sample here.
Free PDF Quickstart
If you have ever played Fighting Fantasy or Choose Your Own Adventure books, you have the basic idea of what a gamebook looks like. In terms of how it plays, it is quite similar structurally to Fabled Lands by Dave Morris & Jamie Thomson. That book series also featured a number of connected books that you could wander between at will. Long term, Legendary Kingdoms feels quite similar to Sorcery by Steve Jackson, in that it has a grand quest, sorcery is rare and powerful, and there is a final goal to achieve. There is also just a whiff of Way of the Tiger by Mark Smith and Jamie Thomson, mainly through Akihiro and his quest for enlightenment.
Legendary Kingdoms itself is a zero to hero narrative. You begin as penniless slaves, and end the game becoming great generals who make or break the future of the world based on your actions. The main difference with games like Sorcery or Destiny Quest is that you decide the order you want to do it. There are many ways into the main super-plot of the books, and different parties will experience different routes in. Forgive us for being cryptic … but we don’t want to ruin the plot!
That said, each book is also very self-contained. There are several dozen independent quests, one ‘book quest’ which involves the epic clash of armies, one character quest, where the history and goals of one of the pre-generated characters is explored in depth, and a number of minor party-member events. These minor events allow your party members to fall in love, become enemies, save each other’s lives, or just give each other time to shine.
"I enjoyed the preview so much that I purchased the pdf of Book 1 to keep playing!" 
- Emma

"Loving the sample book - really high quality while still retaining that ‘retro’ feel."
- Simon

"I downloaded the demo and then played it. I was hooked and quickly bought volume 1 in pdf. Thanks for the great book! I love it!" - Gerard

"I've played the sample and I love it. It reminds me the "choose your own adventure" books from my childhood, but on steroids." - Diego

This crowdfunding campaign aims to raise the funds to produce book 2 of the Legendary Kingdoms gamebook series.
The campaign will run for 30 days and as soon as the campaign closes we will begin production of Crown & Tower. By backing this project you are agreeing to have your card charged with the amount you pledge at the project end, which is Thursday 15th April.
Following the end of the campaign, usually a few weeks later, we will send you a post campaign survey where you will confirm your pledge level (and get a chance to upgrade if you wish), give us your address details and settle the postage. If you have ordered both books in the softcover form, you will be given the option of splitting the postage and being sent book 1 straight away and then book 2 when production is complete (estimated to be September).
This process will have you making two payments, the first for the pledge, a charging process handled by Kickstarter which will happen on or around 15th April, and then the second for postage and any upgrades, which is handled by the company sending you the survey. For this campaign we will be using a company called Backer Kit.
So how do I make a pledge?
At the top of the campaign page you will see the green “Back this project” button. Alternatively, you can scroll down to select a reward tier.
After selecting the tier you wish to pledge for, check the amount being pledged and select 'continue' to proceed.
You will then be taken through to the payments page where you’ll be prompted to enter your payment details. To complete your pledge, click the green “Pledge" button and you’ll be all set!
You should receive a confirmation email to confirm that you are now a backer of the project. As long as we are successfully funded, your card will be charged when the campaign ends.

Marketed & Promoted by  
This project is promoted by Green Inbox, the tech marketing company behind many successful Kickstarters. We use heavy technology to help creators maximize their projects and ROAS.
More than $50,000,000 has been raised with Sprint's support
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Spidermind Games has run several successful Kickstarter campaigns, building a product list based on quality and a community based on communication. 

This project has real potential to be massive. That being said, the bigger the project, the more links there are in the chain. With every additional link, there could be additional problems waiting to ambush the smooth planning of this project.

Whilst we hope no problems will occur, IF something was to happen, we can assure you that we will do all we can to mitigate any delay. Some difficulties, however much we might want to help, will be outside of our control. Industrial action, acts of God, fire and flood, ash clouds from volcanoes, global pandemics as well as plague and pestilence are just some of the issues and problems that might occur that we have no control over.

We have, however, already added in ‘stretch’ room, additional time for each section of the project to be completed and will keep the delivery dates and other deadlines updated on the KS page as well as through our social media channels. We will work hard to ensure all your queries are answered in a timely fashion.

We pride ourselves on being open and honest with all out Kickstarter campaigns. We have chosen a superb team to support us in this project who want this campaign to become as much a reality as we do. This being said many of our team are sub-contractors working for several clients at the same time. Sometimes this leads to parts of our production process working slower than we had planned or forecast. If this happens, we will let you, the most important people in this project, know what has happened and what we intend on doing about it.

In essence we commit to keeping our backers updated to any changes or developments when they happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The use of the word Legendary is entwined within this campaign but it equally applies to our friends at CRWN.
CRWN are currently completing the fulfillment of the Level Up. For anyone not involved in that campaign, they took over very much at the last minute when our previous company (and the one we had been working closely with for 6 months planning fulfillment) suddenly came to a grinding halt because of Covid.

A huge thank you for everyone who has completed their survey. We are currently at 81% complete.
For those who pledged for the  softback book bundle, you will have seen that you can opt for split shipping, and to receive The Valley of Bones now and Crown & Tower when it is completed. In order to begin fulfilling these orders, we are going to keep the split shipping available for the next 2 weeks and close the offer around wednesday 9th June. It will be on or around 9th that you will be charged for the split shipping and we will begin fulfillment then.
Happy Friday folks!

campaign.story:
Ricardo Delgado is a master storyteller. His Age of Reptiles graphic novels are universally acclaimed for their stunning depiction of dinosaurs and prehistory. With his work as a storyboard artist and character designer for films including Apollo 13, Avatar: The Last Airbender, The Incredibles, Men in Black, and Wall-e, Delgado is also one of Hollywood's leading conceptual designers. And his latest endeavor just might be his most ambitious creation to date.
The all-new illustrated novel DRACULA OF TRANSYLVANIA, which features an original story and more than 20 lavish illustrations, reimagines Bram Stoker’s classic vampire story like you've never seen it before.
“Ricardo Delgado's reimagining of Dracula is strange and bold and brilliantly original. I love it and WOULD be stunned by it if it wasn't coming from Ricardo. But brilliant is pretty much what I've come to expect from him. Still... He may have surpassed his usual brilliance here.”
—Mike Mignola, creator of Hellboy
In DRACULA OF TRANSYLVANIA, the year is 1899. Young Solicitor Jonathan Harker braves ghosts, demons, living skeletons, and armies of rats—all of which pale in comparison to his encounters with Dracula of Transylvania, the Son of Satan. The demonic, shapeshifting vampire imposes his wrath, malice and vengeance upon an England about to enter the Modern Era.
“Ricardo Delgado does for vampires what he has done for dinosaurs! His elegant and bloody take on Stoker's classic tale is refreshingly original and scary.”
—John Landis, Director of An American Werewolf in London and Thriller

DRACULA OF TRANSYLVANIA supports and builds upon Stoker’s classic and haunting original story, but this is most certainly not your parents' Dracula. This personification of the Nosferatu king is dark and powerful, a malevolent antagonist who suffers no fools, accepts no failure and crushes anyone in his path. Dracula is vileness incarnate, a pure thing of Hell. He’s spent the past thousand years putting sword to flesh and tearing at the tapestry of history as the son of Satan himself. Kings, Popes and armies fear Dracula. And so should you.
“Dark and disturbing but so BEAUTIFUL. I am always mesmerized by his artwork, now after this, it’ll be hard to sleep. Thanks Ricardo!”
—Genndy Tartakovsky, creator of Primal and Samurai Jack

“Ricardo Delgado breathes new life into the prince of the undead like he has done with every genre he has worked in!”
—Geof Darrow, creator of Shaolin Cowboy, conceptual designer for The Matrix films
DRACULA OF TRANSYLVANIA is footnoted throughout with historical facts from the ancient to the modern world that bring texture to the sprawling and haunting adventure. Murder among English tombstones! Daring chases through the infamous underground Paris Ossuaries! A spectacular gladiatorial battle within Rome's Colosseum during the Witching Hour! And finally, a fever-pitch chase through Europe to the most terrifying place on earth: Castle Dracula.
The DRACULA OF TRANSYLVANIA Kickstarter will have multiple tiers and rewards available for backers, including signed leather-bound hardcover copies of the book, limited edition prints, original sketches, and an exclusive clamshell/bookplate.
DRACULA OF TRANSYLVANIA is epic gothic storytelling with the pulse-pounding pace of the modern thriller, a cross between THE EXORCIST and the LORD OF THE RINGS. It is a brilliant and dark reimagining of the classic original story with a fascinating new perspective on one of literature’s most feared characters.
Signed Leather-Bound Edition

“Delgado’s work always impresses. And the illustrations for his Dracula novel are yet another example of his fantastic design sense and his absolutely horrifically messed up imagination!”
—Tim Miller, director of Deadpool and Terminator: Dark Fate

“If you thought Ricardo Delgado was a great dinosaur artist... well, you're right—he is! But with his Dracula book, Ricardo has outdone himself. He has dramatically risen to a new artistic plateau in a genre and territory previously unassociated with him. Dracula will long be remembered as a major marker in Delgado's impressive body of work as a graphic storytelling artist.”
—William Stout, author of The New Dinosaurs
“Stunning artwork and unforgettable prose. Delgado’s book is a must-have for every Horror and vampire fan.”
—Gary Rhodes, Ph.D, author of The Birth of the American Horror Film and writer/director of Lugosi: Hollywood’s Dracula

“Delgado takes us on a wild ride as he skillfully introduces  the next generation of Vampire hunters in a style reminiscent of the original Dracula novel.”
—Dacre Stoker, co-author of Dracula the Undead and Dracul and great-grand-nephew of Bram Stoker
Writer & Artist Ricardo Delgado
 The Book
*Final Art/Design May Change
Delgado's Dracula of Transylvania is presented in two hardcover versions. Both are 8" x 10" in size, with 428 pages, plus 32 pages of full color terrifying art. One cover will have 4-color printing, while the deluxe-signed edition will be leather-bound and foil-stamped.
*Final Art/Design May Change
Digital Version in PDF format
Portfolio Lithographs 
*Final Art/Design May Change
As large as this book is, it can't contain all the amazing art created by Delgado that brings the nightmarish characters to life. These images are included in selected tiers or as an add-on when checking out. Lithographs are either 4" x 10" or 8" x 10" and printed in full color.

Original Sketch Art
*Sample Images* Subject of Art at Discretion of Artist
For only twenty-five backers, there is an ultimate-deluxe edition that includes a ONE-OF-A-KIND piece of art drawn by creator Ricardo Delgado. Each original art piece is sketched on 8" x 10" art paper. Ready for framing to frighten your family and guests as they gaze upon the grimy imagery flowing from Delgado's mind.

Special Deluxe Edition Box 
*Final Art/Design May Change
The two Deluxe Tiers include a hand-crafted box, bound in leather with foil stamping on cover and spine. This special edition box will house the signed book, ten portfolio lithographs, and the original art (on the Original Art Tier). 



The Creator 
Ricardo Delgado is an American-born artist/writer of Costa Rican descent. He was born in Los Angeles, California in 1964. Ricardo is a graduate of the prestigious Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, where he presently teaches.
As a film Illustrator, Ricardo has helped design such live-action films as Apollo 13, Men in Black, Star Trek: First Contact, Jurassic Park 3, The Matrix Reloaded and Revolution. In Animation, Ricardo has designed for animated features like Disney’s Atlantis- The Lost Empire, Emperor’s New Groove, Pixar’s The Incredibles, Wall-e, Dreamworks’ How to Train your Pet Dragon as well as TV shows like Nickelodeon’s Avatar- The Last Airbender and Disney’s Tron- Uprising.
Ricardo has worked with directors such as Steven Spielberg, Ron Howard, James Cameron, John Landis, Ron Clements and John Musker as well as the Wachowski siblings. Among Ricardo’s career titles are Comic Book Creator, Novelist, Director, Production Designer, Art Director, Concept Artist, Background Designer, Prop designer, Character Designer and Storyboard Artist.
Ricardo’s dinosaur comic book series, Age of Reptiles, for Dark Horse Comics, has been published all over the world for a quarter of a century. His first two novels are the children’s novella Sam Specter and the Book of Spells and the hard-boiled science fiction noir Warhead. He is a family man who enjoys a quiet life, the outdoors, ancient architecture, old libraries, monster movies, sports, people who speak other languages and a well-done cheeseburger.

We have successfully funded four Kickstarter campaigns. The book is written and illustrated by Ricardo. Our highest risk is delay on delivery. We are projecting shipping in June 2021. We print in Korea, shipped to US by boat, and shipped to you, mainly, by the US Post Office. Some forces may be out of our control, but we strive to meet our shipping schedule of June 2021

campaign.story:
Join the Digital Workshop community on Facebook! 
Warploque Miniatures' Digital Workshop is a range of digitally sculpted miniatures perfect for RPG and tabletop games. I am also a traditional sculptor, who pushes putty to create pieces for my tabletop fantasy game ArcWorlde: Second Edition, and my driving goal is to recreate the same hand-made, characterful feel with my digitally sculpted miniatures too!
For the first Digital Workshop: Printed Kickstarter, I am providing high quality 3D prints of the first 6 months of my digitally sculpted work - Goblins, Dwarves and Bullywugs.
Rather than being cast in resin or metal like other Warploque Miniatures releases, each Digital Workshop: Printed miniature is 3D printed.  These highly detailed resin prints are perfect for painting and table top gaming, as they are strong, flexible and take to paint wonderfully.


An example of our unpainted 3D printed miniatures
An example of one of our unpainted 3D printed miniatures
The cost of shipping is not included in your pledge, and will be added after the conclusion of the campaign through the pledge manager.
I will provide you all with full instructions when the time comes. I am still finalising the exact shipping costs, but to give you a rough idea here are a couple of preliminary estimates:
UK - £4
Germany - £5
Rest of EU - £10
US/Canada - £10
Australia - £10
ROW - £10
These estimates may increase if you purchase a large number of additional models on top of your core pledge. The final shipping costs are subject to change, and will be based on your location and specific rewards.
If you would like to combine your shipping with friends to save on postage, please get in touch and we will be happy to arrange something for you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any undertaking of this nature is a huge commitment and a lot of work for everyone involved. Miniatures need printing, packing and eventually shipping to the backers.

It is at these hurdles that some Kickstarters have faltered in the past, so, I have given careful consideration to each part of the process to minimize potential risk. Warploque Miniatures is a family run business, so everyone involved is 100% dedicated to making this project as successful and professional as possible. 

This is our first 3D printed Kickstarter, and as such there will be a lot to learn. I am working with experienced and extremely talented 3D printing specialists across the world to fulfil this project, with back-up options if there are unexpected delays

Also, instead of relying purely on concept art and work-in-progress sculpts to illustrate my products, all of the models that I am offering have already been sculpted. They've been printed, the display copies have been painted, and they are ready to go into production, so backers know exactly what they are investing in. 

Finally, I have set achievable delivery date estimates. I have kept the campaign small and manageable, eschewing an overly long list of stretch goals, so this project has a much higher probability of being completed and delivered on time.

This is the 9th Kickstarter that Warploque Miniatures has run, and we have a reputation amongst our community for not only delivering a high quality product, but delivering it on time. If you would like to discuss any aspect of this campaign with previous Kickstarter backers, please join us on the ArcWorlde Facebook group - https://www.facebook.com/groups/arcworldeofficial/.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We only use the best materials for our miniatures, which are sturdy and durable for extended gaming sessions.

updates.update_content:
Hey folks!
Hope you are all well. Just thought I'd do an update to let you know what's going on with the project!
For those in the UK, I have been informed by the printers that your orders are all printed, prepped and boxed. I'm hoping that they will be shipped to you all in the next week, but I will inform you of any further delays.

Hey folks!
Hope you are all well.
I bring excellent news for you all - over the past few weeks our 3D printing partners have been hard at work making all of your minis, and I am delighted to announce that, due to their efforts, we are well ahead of schedule!
I have been informed that the parcels will start to be shipped at the start of May. This is across the board, so no matter where you are in the world you can expect your models to be posted before our original target date in June.

Hey, folks!
Thank you all for getting your pledge managers back to me so quickly, there's still a few days to go, so if you have yet to fill it out you have until the 1st of April 2021!
Any filled out after that date will not be shipped with the Kickstarter, and you will have to wait until our printers have a next available slot.

Hey folks!
Hope you are all well, and thank you once again for backing the campaign!
I am pleased to announce that the Pledge Manager has been sent. BackerKit has now sent an email out to everyone with a link to their own personalised BackerKit pledge manager.
The deadline for you all to fill out your pledge managers will be the 1st of April 2021. We are on a tight schedule to get everything shipped on time, so please do not dilly-dally with getting those back to me!

campaign.story:
$100,000 Stretch Goal: Backers Receive Additional Free GhosTiny Set On Eligible Pledges!!!!!!! 
                                GhosTiny 
 - Ultra Fine Detail Paintbrush Set For Miniatures- 
Ultra Fine Detail Paint Brush Set
In 2019, we set out to create the most affordable set of paint brushes perfect for miniature painters! In 2020, together we released dry brushes that helped new and advanced painters take their gaming miniatures to the next level! The combined 4,644 BACKERS most frequently asked question is "Do you make smaller sizes?" Well, NOW I DO. If you're ready to join the army of painters, hobbyists, gamers, crafters, terrain builders and artists you found the campaign you were looking for.
GhosTiny Ultra Fine Detail Paint Brush Set is the answer to the question "will you make a size #000?" Instead of a single new brush added to the mega popular Ghost Brush line I wanted to create a set that will be your go to when you need to conquer the smallest of details packed into the wonderful miniatures and models we paint today! You probably already know the feeling of using wonderful new paint brushes but I invite you to join the #GhostBrush community and crush your hobby painting goals!
 "Art is never finished, only abandoned."  Leonardo da Vinci

My name is Jeff Beyer. We met the last two years when 4,644 Backers gave me their trust and support in helping bring the Ghost Miniature Paintbrushes to life! With online sales, retail shops, and the last two Kickstarter campaigns, thousands of people are painting with these brushes! You can find me on Youtube under the name RedBeardBoss and on Instagram @Sleepwalkair_brush and I love painting. These past years we showed the bigger companies we wanted quality miniature painting supplies at a fair price. I'm not interested in charging you to cover the bill so I can hire big name studio painters in an attempt to convince you these brushes will bring you 1st place golden trophies. I could send every hobby channel on Youtube a free set and pay them to tell you how great these are but I'm not going to do that either. All you have to do is read the comments from the last TWO campaigns and feel proud knowing you are helping build a community of painters and hobbyists who simply love putting paint on little plastic figures.
Precision
With your support, we will help thousands of new artists fall in love with miniature painting.
Thank you for taking the time to check out my Kickstarter and happy painting!
I would like to introduce you to the GhosTiny Ultra Fine Detail Miniature Paint Brush Set.

This new set of 9 ultra fine detail brushes includes 7 rounds, a flat, and a chisel shaped brush. These not only cover you for the smallest of miniature details but imagine the confidence in being able to choose the perfect shape and size for the task! This set is made with the same beloved white nylon hair of the other Ghost Paint Brushes. The birch wood handles of the new GhosTiny range are thicker and more comfortable to hold when you're focused on getting those tiny highlights in those hard to reach spaces.
Accuracy
Ultra Fine Point
Don't forget the original Ghost Brush Set
Original 8 round Ghost Brushes and 2 Ghost Dry Brushes
If you need a set or two of the original Ghost Brushes I have included pledges just for you! I set out to design the Ghost Brush specifically to help people paint miniatures and people love them! The wide range of sizes were chosen to give you the flexibility to paint the tiniest buckle on your favorite character’s shoe to the massive wings of a terrifying dragon! The white nylon hair holds a nice point compared to most synthetic brushes and is soft enough to achieve smooth blends. Finally, the birch wood handle gives you the feel of being an artist right in your hand. I want you to improve as a painter by having access to quality brushes that get the job done and don't break the bank!
Let's Make The GHOST Dry Brush Size #0D!

The new Ghost Dry Brush #0D has already been designed, tested, and I can include once we reach $50,000. This goal may sound high but the last campaign was over triple this amount! This brush is small but packs quite a punch! It has has a thinner handle than the #1D and #2D in this range and is exactly what you asked for. A smaller Ghost Dry Brush! When the stretch goal of $50,000 is obliterated all eligible pledges will have this brush included!!!! The only 2 pledges not eligible will be the Classic Pledges.
#2D, #1D, #0D
Some minis are worth spilling paint for! But we won't be spilling any today!
Designer @polymorph_miniatures used his ungodly skill to help bring my concept for this amazing new add-on to life! The Necro Paint Pot Holder is the most entrancing way to hold your washes and paints during use to prevent accidentally spilling them. This diabolic creation is resin and will look truly wicked on your paint table. This is a perfect project for your new Ghost Dry Brushes and I can't wait to see how you all paint them to display in your hobby area
Necro Paint Pot Holder
Fun to paint!
Do you own a game store?

Do you own a commission paint studio?

Do you need a ton of paintbrushes?
Retailer Display Rack
The retail pledge is for you! You will receive 5 GhosTiny Sets and a 100 Ghost Brushes and a display rack to entice customers! The display rack has 96 holes and I will include some signs with the rack! This pledge is also open for everyone who needs a lot of paintbrushes! If you own a retail store and your customers love these brushes I will be able to fulfill orders right away to keep your display rack full! Don't forget the retail pledges also receive stretch goals earned during the campaign!
Care for your Ghost Brush
The Ghost white nylon hair not only looks great but will help you create better painting habits. Always remember to load the brush with paint only about half way to avoid getting paint in your ferrule. Getting paint inside the ferrule is the fastest way to ruin your brush.

Clean your brushes frequently with water and use brush soap after painting to make sure no paint residue is left inside the bristles. The white nylon hair will change color from use but it is good practice when cleaning your brushes to try and get them as clean as possible.
All paint brushes are designed to pull paint and this one is no different; however, as miniature painters, we tend to use a stabbing motion with our brushes to push paint into small details. This push motion causes the tip of your synthetic brushes to curl over time. To reduce this, use a pulling motion with your brushes as much as possible and if you absolutely need to push paint into a small area, make sure you use very gentle pressure.
NEVER leave your Ghost Brush or any paintbrush sitting submerged in water! This will not only destroy your wonderful sharp tip, it will cause the wood handle to swell and ruin your whole brush. Seriously, stop dropping your brushes hair-down inside a water cup. Instead, swish the brush back and forth in the water to remove paint, then wipe on a towel to make sure no paint is left within the bristles.
These tips will help your new favorite paintbrush enjoy a longer life.
Ghost Brush Family Photo
Ghost Brush Classic Pledge
If you missed out on the first two campaigns these pledges are for YOU. These pledges are for the painter who wants the original sets of Ghost brushes but doesn't want the new GhosTiny set. An advantage of this pledge is the brushes are at a great price, ready to be shipped and will be sent out right away! These pledges are not eligible for the stretch goals of this campaign.
Ghost Brush Classic Set (8 Round original Ghost Brushes,  one of each size #1D and#2D Ghost Dry Brushes) 10 brushes total
Ghost Double Classic Set (16 Round original Ghost Brushes, 2 size #1D and 2 size #2D Ghost Dry Brushes) 20 brushes total
---Necro Paint Pot Holder Add On---
Add $12 to your pledge level (not including Thank You Pledge) and receive an additional Necro Paint Pot Holder! If you want 2 extra Necro Paint Pot Holders add $24! If you need more just add $12 for every Necro Paint Pot Holder you wish to add!
---Classic Ghost Brush Set Add On---
If you wish to have an addition set of the sought-after original Ghost paint brushes add $25 to your pledge! This will be an additional 8 Ghost round brushes sizes #00-#6 and the Ghost Dry Brush #1D and #2D. If you need more add $25 for each additional set!

----Stretch Goals----
 $25,000=  A GHOST DRY BRUSH #2D INCLUDED IN YOUR PLEDGE
$50,000= The NEW GHOST DRY BRUSH SIZE #0D CREATED AND INCLUDED IN YOUR PLEDGE
$75,000= A GHOST DRY BRUSH #1D INCLUDED IN YOUR PLEDGE
$100,000= A FULL ADDITIONAL GHOSTINY SET INCLUDED IN YOUR PLEDGE
$125,000 An ADDITIONAL GHOST DRY BRUSH SIZE #0D INCLUDED IN YOUR PLEDGE
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have ran 2 very successful Kickstarters in 2019 and 2020. I have accounted for Chinese New Year falling in February, this should not affect delivery. This project has almost no risk because I am willing to fully fund the manufacturer to get these brushes made. This is what allows me to keep the goal much lower than total cost of the project. To help ensure a better product and experience to all of my backers, I will double check quality control from the factory. Assuming everything goes smooth, I can begin shipping your orders in July. My last campaign was estimated to finish in October and even with a global pandemic I finished shipping in December so I plan to beat that time this year!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
With proper brush care these will last you a very long time
Something else
Paint brushes that do not meet the quality standard of the target customer are donated to Phoenix Children's Hospital, programs for artists with disabilities and schools. Not simply thrown away

project_data.project_name: GhosTiny Fine Detail Paint Brush Set For Miniatures

campaign.story:
Our campaign has gone better than we dared to imagine. Thanks to your overwhelming generosity,  Pine is funded and we met a few stretch goals, ensuring we'll be able to give this story the treatment it deserves! 
The last 30 days have been amazing. So much so we ran out of superlatives a while ago! Tom and I are truly grateful to be backed by all of you.
Thank you again,
Tom & Najati
Pine is a story-driven game about loss and letting go, told from the perspective of a grieving woodworker. A blend of illustration, animation, music, and sound, Pine tells its story wordlessly through interactions that pull you into the woodworker's experience as he struggles to hold on to his past. 
The woodworker came to illustrator Tom Booth in a moment of deep isolation following a tragic loss. Initially wary of sharing such a personal work, Tom was overwhelmed by the outpouring of support from friends and fans after he posted the first image of the woodworker. Their own stories of loss let Tom know that he wasn't alone in grieving.
We created this campaign so we could tell the woodworker's story with the hope that it can be a reminder to anyone dealing with their own grief that they are not alone.
PLAY

We come to Kickstarter to ask for your help in creating something truly meaningful and heartfelt. Thanks to your support, we get to tell the woodworker's story! Help us spread the word so we can make Pine even better by meeting some of our stretch goals! Thank you to all our backers that got us here, and thank you to everyone stopping by for getting us even further!

Not quite a video game and not quite a graphic novel, Pine blends mediums to pull you into the woodworker's world.
Interactive moments let you share the woodworker's struggles, turning Pine's animated scenes into personal experiences. 
The sounds of the world and an original score will combine with Pine's visual and interactive moments to bring you deeper into the woodworker's journey. 
Northwest Soundscapes (Skywalker Sound, Sucker Punch Productions) is helping with sound design, and the score will be written alongside the game. 
Here's a list of the updates that can't be reflected in the reward descriptions, as they get locked after someone chooses them.
Because you all met the early funding challenge, all backers will get the bonus landscape of the woodworker's valley as a high-res wallpaper for desktop and mobile!
Everyone who was part of the first 80k will get the exclusive soundscape, too.
There will be a total of seven prints to choose from: five of Tom's classic illustrations of the woodworker and two new images exclusive to the Kickstarter. Check out Update #4 to see the five that have been revealed!
There are add-ons for print bundles, carving mini figures, and the STL of the woodworkers.
See the designs for the carving mini figures in Update #7.
Check out past updates to see what's been going on with the campaign. Help us make Pine even better by spreading the word and sharing Pine with friends and fans of graphic novels and games!
Tom drew the first illustration of the woodworker over a long night late in the winter of 2019. It was the most personal thing he'd ever drawn, and Tom almost didn't share the image. 
Original sketch of woodworker. February 2019
When he did, the response was overwhelming. Despite being born from an extremely personal experience, the woodworker resonated deeply with Tom's audience.
There was an outpouring of support from his fans, many of them thanking him for sharing the image. Some were so inspired that they created truly spectacular 3D models, fan drawings, and actual wood carvings—a few even got tattoos!  
As Tom posted more images, the woodworker found his way around the internet. From the front page of Reddit to My Modern Met, everywhere the woodworker went, people wanted to know more about him. It was clear that Tom had found a story that needed to be told.
In the spring of 2019 we started brainstorming how to tell this story in a special way. Inspired by titles like Florence and, later, If Found..., we thought a story-driven game would be perfect for Pine.  
Sample of thumbnail storyboards.
Since then we've fleshed out the rest of the story, storyboarded it, built a few prototypes, worked up enough courage to quit our day jobs, founded a company, and made a lovely version of FreeCell to get some practice publishing mobile games. It's been a busy couple of years!
Prototyping one of Pine's interactive scenes
Even with all that done, the work is really just beginning. We think there's a little over a year of work left on Pine, full of drawing, animating, programming, composing music, putting it all together, and testing.
That's what the funding from this campaign will allow us to do.

At our lowest funding goal, Pine will be released on iOS and Android. Release on Steam and Switch are stretch goals. All backers that pledge $5 or more will be able to play Pine on the platform of their choice.
We don't want to be presumptuous about how this campaign will go, but we do want to make sure that whatever we raise past our goal will go towards making Pine even better. For more info on the project budget, see the section after the rewards.
* See the note in "Risks and challenges" below about publishing to the Switch.
We hope the rewards convey how much your support means to us. Every pledge receives our deepest appreciation and we tried to make each reward a meaningful new way to experience Pine. 
Look below the reward tree for details on the limited rewards.
The Backer Forest is our way to say a special thank you to those who play a big role in bringing Pine to life. After finishing Pine, you'll be able to explore the forest and maybe find your name there, along with everyone else who made a sizable contribution to the campaign.
We've also added a few add-ons since launching the campaign! The second and third are only available with reward tiers that already have a physical component.
 Woodworker carving STL file: This is the 3D model of the woodworker by Ismael Nieto. We had a couple requests for this add-on so that backers with their own 3D printers could print their own woodworker. For personal use only, of course!
 Additional prints and print bundles: If you've been reading the updates you know that there are now going to be a total of 7 images to select from. These add-ons let you get all the prints you want with your pledge! 
 Additional carving mini figures: Our backers in the US can also add an additional carving mini figure to their pledge.
These handsome prints will be equally at home in your game room or museum room. Choose from the seven print options or let us know if there's a different image you have in mind and we'll see what we can do!
These prints will be signed by Tom and include a personal thank you note from him and Najati. You'll also get thanked in the credits after the story.
You're right, that woodworker figure isn't painted ... yet! When we were initially brainstorming ideas for this Kickstarter, the one thing we knew right away was that this amazing figure by Ismael Nieto (@ismaflcl) had to be one of the rewards.
We decided to take it one step further by having Tom paint them, making it a truly exceptional keepsake. Like the signed print, you'll get a personal thank you note from Tom and Najati and thanked in the credits after the story.
Tom's artistic talents aren't limited to the tablet. On special occasions he takes brush to canvas and putting Pine on Kickstarter is a very special occasion, indeed!
Those able to support at this level will get one of five original paintings of a scene exclusive to this reward. These will be gouache on cold pressed paper and will ship ready for display or framing as you see fit!
Of course, these include a thank you note from Tom and Najati and your name in the credits after the story. And yes, Tom has a lot of painting in store if we get funded!
Anyone able to contribute at this level will be key to making Pine a reality! Your name will appear alongside the team at the beginning of the story, either as an individual or as a group. 
In addition to getting one of every print and mini figure, you'll also get to choose one of the other limited rewards, and will of course get a thank you note from Tom and Najati. 
We'd also like to say thank you directly and learn about why supporting Pine meant so much to you. So, if you're interested, we'll arrange a time for a video call with you.
The 8.5x11" prints will ship worldwide through Fulfillrite, with tracking where possible, and delivered with duties paid where possible. If you live outside the list of countries where that service is available, you will be responsible for additional costs such as taxes and duties. Please check the FAQ to see which countries include duties paid.
The rest of the rewards are things we'll be making or packing ourselves and are limited in number. Since we're a small team, they'll only be available for shipping to the United States, with the exception of the Associate Producer rewards, which we'll ship worldwide.
We already have partners set up for making the physical rewards. Because some of those rewards depend on art that hasn't been created yet (e.g. the exclusive images for the wallpaper pack and Art of Pine PDF), we'll be developing those pieces first so we can get reward production and delivery started as soon as possible. 
Soon after funding, we'll publish an anticipated delivery schedule for the rewards. We're hoping the 8.5x11" prints will ship over the summer and we're targeting shipping everything else before the holidays season of 2021.
In the spirit of transparency and community, we want to give potential backers some insight into our approach to funding and budgeting. There aren't any lovely images in this section but it's important to us that those pledging understand how we're using their money to develop Pine.
First and foremost, our primary goal is to develop a high-quality, engaging, meaningful story-driven game so that you can experience the woodworker's story.
While we'd love to just work on Pine and release it when it's ready without worrying about money, Pine is too big of a project to whittle away at in the evening and on weekends.
We think we've got about 15 months of work to do and we need to hire some outside help. The Kickstarter funding goes primarily towards hiring that help and enabling us to spend the time doing the work.
Here's how the basic budget breaks down. These are estimates, but should be close to how the money gets spent.
 Kickstarter fees: 8% - We wouldn't be here without them!
 Rewards and shipping: 10% - Making and shipping the rewards 
 Legal, accounting, etc: 2% - All companies need a little of this stuff
 Taxes: 15% - An estimate, and perhaps a conservative one
 Sound and music: 15% - Producing SFX and the score
 Art and programming: 50% - Most of what Pine needs is time for Tom and Najati to work on it!
If we're lucky enough to achieve any of our stretch goals, funding them comes out of the art and programming portion of the budget.
At our lowest goal of $80k, this is a shoestring budget even for a small team. However, everyone is committed to the project and we think that's just enough money to make a great game. For anyone curious, the project needs to reach about $300,000 before Tom and Najati aren't spending their savings to develop Pine. Any money beyond that would be invested back into Made Up Games so we can make more games!
So that's how your pledges will help us make Pine and, again, we're grateful for every one. If you made it this far, thanks for sticking around through this really boring section about money!

Made Up Games is Tom Booth and Najati Imam. We're both lifelong gamers and longtime friends. After some practice publishing games with Freecell Fable—and with your help—we're ready to take on Pine!
Tom’s been drawing since childhood and has been a professional illustrator for about 10 years, including stints at Nickelodeon and Scholastic. He's illustrated and authored a number of children’s books including Don't Blink! and This is Christmas. His Instagram audience and its love for the woodworker is a large part of what inspired us to start this campaign!

Najati’s been programming since he was a kid and has been doing so professionally for over 20 years. His experience runs the gamut from web front end, to embedded systems programming, to directing engineering departments. He’s also been tinkering with game dev for as long as he’s been able to type. 

Andy's an industry vet who records forests for fun. He's the perfect person to weave the sounds of the woodworker's valley into the storytelling. Owner of Northwest Soundscapes, he's done sound design work for Lucasfilm and Sucker Punch Productions, among others.

Adam is one part programmer, one part actor, and one part team coach. He and Najati used to work together so when it was time to blend technology, feelings, and art we pulled him into the team to keep us focused and keep the quality high.

Two parting notes ...
We expect it's clear from the tone of the campaign that Pine attempts to explore a fairly serious topic. While we want it to be a story that most anyone will be able to relate to, and maybe even feel enriched by, it's not intended to be a children's story. Because there won't be anything graphic or violent in it, Pine may end up with an E rating. We added this note to make sure that parents don't mistakenly take that to mean that Pine is intended for children.
Also, Made Up Games does not condone carving things into trees—please don't do that! In a lot of places it's illegal, but even more importantly it can be really bad for the tree. The woodworker's story is a fictional one and he would definitely take forest conservation very seriously if he were real.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk we foresee is whether we've estimated for enough time to live up to the high expectations we have for this project. We're confident in our ability to deliver, and we did our best to be reasonable with our estimates, but game development is a wily beast! We have contingency plans, but it would be naïve to assume there won't be a few surprises along the way.

Speaking of surprises, there shouldn't be many for our backers as we're committed to being very transparent throughout the development of Pine. The dev updates will include progress on all fronts, from making and shipping the rewards to setbacks and successes during the development of Pine.

Regarding publishing to the Switch: The barriers of entry to developing for the Nintendo Switch can be fairly high, with Nintendo controlling access to it tightly. If the project reaches that level of funding, we'll have resources available to tackle those challenges. Still, working with Nintendo is a considerable external dependency that we don't have complete control over.

Our experience in fulfillment of physical goods is somewhat limited, but we've done our homework and think we've covered our bases there. We're confident in the partners we've selected to work with to produce the rewards and working with Fulfillrite removes all the risk around the shipping of the prints.

We're excited to bring Pine into the world. We're happy with the story we've written, our approach to telling it, and keen on our ability to execute. Risks exist, but we're ready to take on the challenges we face to make Pine a reality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
Where possible, shipping materials will be recycled and/or recyclable.
Something else
For all tiers above $25, we’ll plant a tree for every backer that supports the project. We’re still figuring out which partner to work with, but we’ll make sure it’s a reputable project.

We'll also purchase carbon offsets for shipping.

campaign.story:
In the depths of Agaldurs Keep, where the deep roots of the ancient Dwarven king's mines break into the natural homeland of the Gnomes, the magicks of the Darkewood begin to take hold. In the years after the Dwarves had left these lands the Gnomes took up residence in the lower sections of the Keep finding it infinitely more comfortable than their underground holes. Moving here exposed the Gnomes to new creatures, new tools and of course the magick that weaves through the Darkewood. Over time Gnomish society changed and began revolving around frogs and fairies instead of just dirt.


More Gnomes? is this just an excuse for Bad puns?
No of course not,  but when opportunity knocks it would be rude not to open the door eh?  We originally launched the 'Gnome More MR. Nice Guys' miniatures in 2018 and had always hoped to explore deeper into the history of these strange creatures. Where did they come from, What are they wearing and Why do they get so angry?  With your help in funding this project not only will we be able to answer some of these burning questions but we will also be able to bring a whole heap of brand new Northumbrian Tin Minis into production for general release next year. 
We spent a fair amount of time considering how these gnomes fit into the world along with the rest of the Nightfolk and the Denizens of the Wood and so to help you bring a little bit more of that world to life they also come equipped with a small free digital adventure. Rumor has it that our author Ken became so engaged with the characters and lore that he built a whole campaign around it, which he may or may not have committed to paper - we shall have to see!
We have 8 Gnomes and 5 Toads as well as an epic Toad mounted Deathstealer, Several stretch goals which include Additional free Minis!

What do you get out of this? Well, you can get all of those fantastic miniatures we just mentioned and some addons with a fantastic discount on the usual retail price and perhaps bag yourself some free stretch goals on top!  You also get to lend us a hand in shaping these characters and the lore that surrounds them. All Miniatures and Bases are supplied unpainted.


There are Three straightforward pledges to choose from an you can upgrade your pledge at any time:
 Surface Dweller - Pick out what you want from the Addons and then pledge the amount, you will be able to finalise your choices in the pledge manager.
 Gnomeward Bound - Get everything from the Gnomes and Toads packs along with the EPIC Death Stealer Gnome mounted on a Stygian Toad, a Northumbrian Tin presentation box and all unlocked stretch goals! 
 There's no place like Gnome - Get two sets of the toad pack, The Gnome pack, The EPIC Death Stealer Gnome and Mount, The Gnome More MR Nice Guys Addon, a pack of Toadshrooms, a Northumbrian Tin presentation box and all unlocked stretch goals!
If you took part in our last project on Kickstarter you will already know how committed we are to delivering an outstanding product that exceeds your expectations, if you missed our last project and are joining in on this one, prepare to be pleasantly surprised!

We have prepared a number of stretch goals which if hit will be included for free in any of the qualifying pledges. The first of these Goals are listed below and we have some more planned that will be added as we progress. All Stretch Goal Miniatures and Bases are supplied unpainted.


Want to add some great value extras on to your pledge? or if you only want to order a few parts of the 'Gnomes of Agaldurs Keep' Kickstarter just pick what you like from the Add-ons section below and increase your pledge by that amount. All Add-on Miniatures and Bases are supplied unpainted. 

Relax with a spot of Gnome Jousting, its not at all bloodthirsty. Contains 1 x Gnome jouster and Lance (Toad is supplied separately)
An Extra Warty Toad, Comes with a free saddle as part of the kickstarter. A perfect mount for the Gnome Jouster Contains 1 x Warty Toad and Base , 1 x Small saddle
These Toads mean everything to the Gnomes, Transportation and companionship to name but a few. To the Toads the Gnomes mean lunch, one way or another,... Contains 1 x Overburdened Pack Toad, 1 x Warty Toad, 1x Hungry Toad, 2 x Toadlings , 3 x 50mm bases and 2 x 30mm bases - Supplied Unpainted
Contains 1 x Tracker, 1 x Juggergnome, 1 x Gnome Leader, 1 x Gnight, 1 x Gnome Alchemist, 1 x Gnome Elder & Nutkins, 1 x Shrew Tamer, 1 x Fairy Catcher. 6 x 30mm Bases, 2 x 50mm Base - Supplied Unpainted
The third Toadsman of the 'Gnomepocalypse' The Deathstealer Gnome riding a Stygian Toad. Contains 1 x Deathstealer Gnome, 1 x Stygian Toad mount, 1 x Resin display base - Supplied Unpainted
These Gnomes are ANGRY!! not sure if anyone has really asked why? 4 x White Metal Figures and bases - Supplied Unpainted
These Gnomes may have come a long way culturally but some traditions have not been lost, you'll commonly find them perched atop a sturdy Toadshroom. Contains 4 x Toadsroom sprues and 4 x 30mm bases - Supplied Unpainted
Impale yourself on a D4 in style with these sharp edged dice sets, A choice of colours Blue Crystalised Mana or Grey Medusas Gaze.
This epic monument is made up of 5 premium quality resin sections and comes with loads of accessories including floors, stairs and platforms. The perfect place to stage a battle! - Supplied Unpainted
We have had the pleasure of working with some wonderfully talented individuals in bringing you this project.
Sculptors  - Martin Buck and Ristul's Creations. Martin is our resident sculptor extraordinaire we have worked with him for a long time and he is responsible for some of our best selling Miniatures. Ristul makes the most ambitious terrain pieces and some of the cutest critters!
Painters - The miniatures were painted to an impeccable standard by Andrew Taylor.
Writers - We have Kenneth Fenn to thank for digging deeper into gnome life than anyone could have ever expected. Ken is a fanatic for all things tabletop and D&D .
And then of course there's us, David and Simon - Northumbrian Tin Soldier
 As an established E-commerce business with a successful web store, we arrange delivery of packages all over the world. So we can assure you that your parcels are in good hands and will reach you safely. We are committed to 100% customer satisfaction so if anything does go wrong we will always do our best to make it right.
Shipping will be added after the Kickstarter in the pledge manager and will be calculated based on the weight of your pledge and your location. We will endeavour to charge a flat rate and have made efforts to ensure the weight of the package still ships at a reasonable Price. Depending on volumes we may be able to negotiate even better rates.
Approximate postage costs
• United Kingdom: £5
• Europe: £8 - £10
• USA and Canada : £15 - £20
• Australia and New Zealand: £6-£12
• The rest of the World £13-£25
We regret that we will be unable to ship any pledges to Russia or Iran. Northumbrian Tinsoldier are not responsible for any additional shipping or handling charges
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of the miniatures included in the pledges have been sculpted, mastered and are ready to put into production. As soon as the Kickstarter funds are received the Miniatures can be put straight into production and then shipped shortly after the pledge manager is completed. Northumbrian Tin Soldier is already a successful manufacturer and online retailer of miniatures, we have many years of experience of designing, producing and shipping models all over the world. 

Impacts of Covid-19 on Production and Shipping - We were recently impacted quite heavily by the Coronavirus restrictions imposed in the UK earlier in the year. This led to unforseen delays in the fulfillment of our recent successful Kickstarter project "The Curious Case of the Cats of Crumptown" , however we adapted our delivery plans and learned a great deal about how to operate under very adverse conditions. Postal issues were solved by using Courier services at no additional costs to our backers , Stock was collected via our own transport and fullfillment was only delayed by a matter of weeks . As before all Miniatures will be produced in the UK which will mitigate any international production risks. We have extended the project delivery timescale by 2 months over what our estimates are of what is needed to allow for any unforseen changes in UK operations.

In the case of any delays caused by factors outside of our control you can expect to receive transparent and honest updates from us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Metal miniatures can be used, re-used then used some more. There are miniatures that were produced in the 1970's that still see active use today. We expect a rather long lifespan for these miniatures and what's more the materials used can be easily recycled into other products or even more miniatures!
Reusability and recyclability
The blister packs used to hold our miniatures are made from 90% recycled plastic, mainly coming from plastic bottles. They are also 100% recyclable. The presentation boxes are made from recyclable paper and card. They are designed to provide a safe home for these miniatures or any other miniature for that matter for many years to come.
Environmentally friendly factories
From raw materials through to end product all of our partners have robust policies to limit impact to the environment and actively recycle and reclaim materials to minimise waste.
Sustainable Distribution
All of our miniatures are produced in the UK, limiting the number of miles they travel before reaching their ultimate destination.
Something else
As a company we are committed to being climate positive and do so by supporting a variety of activities including reforestation and clean energy charities.
