updates.update_userinfo: Done and Dusty! - Shipping completed and a brief summary of what is next!
updates.update_content:
Thats a wrap!
The last of the Kickstarter pledges went out yesterday evening so it will not be long until they arrive at their forever homes, so if you are still waiting for yours to land it will not be long now.  I'm looking forward to seeing some epic paintjobs you know where to send them (Simon@northumbriantinsoldier.com, @northumbriantin on twitter or Northumbrian Tin Soldier | Facebook) I'm thinking poison dart frog, Cane toad, Tree frog!
Would like to add a huge thankyou to everyone who participated in this Kickstarter for your support in releasing another product successfully and also for the multitude of brilliant ideas.
Some photos of the Chaos

Hey Everyone,

Thanks for passing us your updated addresses! Everything is keyed into the carriers system now and the first parcels leave on Monday. Things have been hectic over here getting everything ready we've had some rather large and exciting changes to our production chain - more on this later.

updates.update_userinfo: March progress update - Important - Action required
updates.update_content:
Good Morning everyone!

A few things to update you on 

Production moulds have for the most part been completed, a single miniature needs a small rework before being moulded again, the sculpting work to do this is done we are working on getting a new mould made at present.

Good morning everyone!
Well, its been a rather uneventful month in the good sense that nothing has gone wrong. We are quietly working away over here preparing the consumables and packaging ready to go for when the stock arrives. The last project "the Curious Case of the Cats of Crumptown" was a big job, the miniatures were heavier than your standard 28mm and packing 20,000 of them was a lot of work. So considering that I'm rather looking forward to this one.

updates.update_userinfo: A Gnights Tale - The Jousting Gnome
updates.update_content:
The day of the Grande Tourney!
The day has arrived, you exit the stalls upon your noble steed and proceed towards the tourney field gripping tightly to the reigns to avoid sliding backwards from the toad into the mud. Bessie makes a distinct squelching sound as she waddles forward leaving furrows in the in the mud which swiftly fill with rainwater from the night before. Your squire hands you the lance and tightens the straps of your plate, a steadfast companion by your side since the most humble of beginnings.

Hey everyone!
Just a quick update to let you know how things are going.

In the UK we have once again been locked down. However, this was not unexpected and has been planned for, we do not foresee any major delays at this time.
Thinking of you all this Christmas 🎄

Around 65% of people have checked out in the pledge manager and made their final selections, some of you even picked up some extras from the shop! (for which we are incredibly grateful)

campaign.story:
''They're coming Tulsa, back to back position if we are to stand a chance. These renegade bio-bots stop for nothing so be sure to aim for their heads, it's where their operating systems are located'' Hartigan said to his partner. ''Any other logical advice you can spare Hartigan?!'' Tulsa said sarcastically... '' I got plenty of bullets and know exactly where to put them...!'' 

Welcome everyone to the Kickstarter campaign for Cyber City. This campaign will focus on two brand new 75mm miniatures in the form of Tulsa and Hartigan and a 1/10th bust called Katana. Making an appearance also are the Slugger and Gunslinger busts and their 75mm miniatures versions. We also have their STL files available in one big pack! 
All the figures in this campaign have been expertly sculpted by my good friend Daniel Ciorba and give off that cyberpunk feel we love. We hope you like what you see and help us get these into production.

Katana
First up is Katana, a 1/10th bust (roughly 85mm). She is an expert swordfighter who is just about unsheath her blade and do some serious damage! Below you see the box art painted by Sylvain Aubut and the first cast by Aurélien Diot of Deep Space Factory Productions.
Tulsa & Hartigan
Then we have the two 75mm miniatures. Experienced detectives who are the law and order of Cyber City! When I designed these two with Daniel I had them planned to be great on their own but also as a duo. You can place them back to back, loyal partners to the end. I think Daniel nailed it and they make a fine couple!
Hartigan
Tulsa
Add-ons
Also making a feature this campaign are the busts and 75mm miniatures versions of Slugger and Gunslinger. The busts have been out for a while now and the 75mm miniatures made a little appearance in the Studio X Kickstarter that ran earlier this year. They fit perfectly in this campaign though and haven't had much spotlight just yet so hence our decision to include them.
All sculpts by my good friend Daniel Ciorba! :D
Below are just the front angles of the miniatures and busts. Follow this link to see more angles;
 Gunslinger & Slugger gallery 
Gunslinger bust painted by Sylvain Aubut
Slugger aka Lt. Jones painted by Artem Romanov
Gunslinger 75mm
Slugger 75mm
 ADD-ONS
Supports will be done by Atlas 3D Support Solutions

Katana render showing the plinth that will come with all Katana pledges! (resin & STL)
Tulsa & Hartigan render showing the base(s) that will come with all pledges containing them! (resin & STL)
Sylvain Aubut will create a little article on how he paints cyberpunk style!
Shipping will be charged during the Kickstarter. For all pledges it is €10,- which includes tracking & and insurance.
We have set the delivery date for March 2021 but depending on the number of casts we need, it might be sooner. Casting will begin once the campaign is over and only if we have funded.
The company who handles our shipping proved numerous times already that they do a good job. We have every faith we can deliver on time as we have become quite good at organizing and packing. We don't think there will be a delay in packages going out to backers but would just like to add that delays can happen. Once the shipping company has your parcels, it is out of our control. However we will do everything possible again to fulfill this Kickstarter on time.
Packages can take anywhere from 4-28 (or sometimes even longer!) days to arrive. So please give it some time when we have announced that the packages have been shipped. Especially with the Covid-19, shipping times can be bit longer than usual. We ask for your understanding if this causes any delays.
Please note that we are not responsible for any customs or other fees that might occur. We do not ship to P.O. boxes!
Miniatures come unpainted and need assembly and some cleaning. They are not toys and might take some expertise to put together.
Brexit
As you may or may not know, The UK will leave the EU soon. As of yet, a deal for trade and import/export hasn't been made yet. We have no clue about what will happen but we will make sure we have some channels set up to aid us in delivering packages to our backers in the UK. Obviously we will keep you informed at all times. One thing is sure, you will get your pledges!!!
STL files
The STL files will be send out once the period for processing funds by Kickstarter is over and funds have been received in our bank account. This normally takes two to three weeks and we estimate that the files will be delivered early January at the latest.
As always there are a few people we would like to thank. The following people who's help and hard work have made it possible to do this campaign
- Daniel Ciorba
- Deep Space Factory (printing & casting)
- Sylvain Aubut
- Yessik Ziiq /Atlas 3D Support Solutions
- Sir Castalot (casting of the Gunslinger and Slugger busts and miniatures)
- Kyle Cruickshank aka Mr Lee's Minis
Atlas 3D Support Solutions

 https://www.atlas3dss.com/ 
If you want to help us fund this campaign then it is very important to take a moment to share the project all around the web. You can do this by sharing the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Reddit, Pinterest, your blog, forums and on any other social media you might know!

Risks and challenges
The Cyber City bust and miniatures have already been sculpted and printed. The master moulds have also been made and have been test cast. Production moulds will be made as soon as the campaign is successfully funded.

Once we receive the casts, we will process them and make everything ready for sending them on their way. Out of experience packaging doesn't take us very take long. We have a reliable shipping company who does the distribution and therefor we have good confidence that we will be able to deliver on time.

Please note though that the estimated delivery time is based upon a certain number of expected backers. In case of a highly successful campaign, the delivery could take a bit longer.

We have done a number of successful campaigns with almost all delivered on time. There was only one campaign being delivered late due to unforeseen circumstances. All others were shipped on time or even ahead of the estimated delivery times. Our current caster is a true professional and a man of his word. He has delivered on time and provided great quality a great number of times so we know he will get the job done!

We have great confidence that we can deliver yet another project successfully and on time and deliver you some fine outstanding products!

As with all other campaigns happening right now we have to say a bit about Covid-19. Things have returned just a little bit back to normal in regards to shipping. The world itself is very much still a mess! We have the delivery for the physical miniatures scheduled for March 2021. We hope there won't be delays for us, but cannot guarantee there won't be any delays! In the case of delays due to the Corona virus, we kindly ask for your understanding.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to the latest kickstarter for Anyaral: The World of Twilight!
This will be the seventh kickstarter I've run for Anyaral and it is always exciting to start a new project! Anyaral is the setting for the fantasy skirmish game of Twilight, which I have been working on for over 20 years now. In this world, the diminutive Fubarnii have pulled themselves out of slavery and carved an Empire that spans the continent of Anyaral. That Empire is now threatened by their Delgon cousins, who have descended from their mountain strongholds led by their gods, the Enarii. 
I'll admit that I hadn't planned to launch this campaign until recently, but this year has been anything but predictable... Over the last few months (and years) I've been working on a large project to unleash the new Kedashi force on the world of Anyaral, but with everything that has been going on this year, it didn't feel like quite the right time to run such a big endeavour. However, alongside all the Kedashi planning I had a few little fun sculpting projects on the side. These were models I really wanted to sculpt, but I didn't quite have a plan for, so I've decided to take the opportunity to release those as a little pre-Christmas kickstarter!
Let me introduce the three subjects of this little campaign, each of which has been given their own pledge level. You can of course add on extras if you don't want just one model.
Alaim is one of the powerful Enarii who the Delgon invaders have embraced as their gods. Alaim however shunned godhood and instead became an outcast and fled to the southern lands of the Casanii. 
Alaim has chosen to follow the migratory life of the Casanii, renouncing claims of leadership and seeking to learn from these spiritual warriors. The Casanii tribes were unsure at first of this intruding giant, but the shamans communed with their spirits and saw the openness of Alaim's heart and the strength that might be added to their tribes. 
Alaim is cast in resin and provided unpainted with a 50mm plastic base.
Under the watchful eye of NuraSen Plutom, the Delgon have embraced the mechanical wonders that were once just toys for the engineers of the Empire. The KalMalog have become a regular sight in the ongoing war, but the larger designs have proven more difficult to mass produce. Only recently has this new variant been seen. These monstrosities wield a pair of derakar, using the might of the heavy engine to power both the mechanical legs and the guns. 
The Heavy KalMalog is cast in resin and provided unpainted with a 50mm plastic base.
The skerrats make their homes throughout the continent of Anyaral. The Dhogu tribes train them, but they are seen as a nuisance across the rest of the Empire, raiding food supplies and damaging property. However, that doesn't stop the rare broodmothers from being highly sought after. Nearly all species of skerrat continue to grow throughout the sempa stage of their lifecycle, only slowing once they mature into kopa. It is rare, but some skerrats will live for many decades as sempa, raising vast broods of skerrats. These skerrat broodmothers are almost impossible to raise in captivity, but are highly valued creatures. Hunters from across Anyaral make their fortunes braving the most dangerous territories in the hope of capturing one of these creatures alive.
The Skerrat Broodmother is cast in resin and provided unpainted with a 50mm plastic base.
 This is the pledge if you just have to have all three models! You can of course add more if you really need to (Alaim may be unique in the world, but I'd recommend at least a couple of Heavy KalMalog to terrify your opponents!).
Kickstarter have just introduced the option to add extra items directly with your pledge. I've not fully tested this out yet so I'd be interested to hear if you do use it! 
There is no additional postage for the extra models.
Alaim - £20
Skerrat Broodmother - £15
Heavy KalMalog - £13
Delgon Mechanic - £5 (or 3 for £10)
Skerrats - £5 for 2 (or 6 for £10)
Festive Giftwrapping (and card) - £5

I've given myself a very tight deadline for production this time, but I've been talking to the caster and I'm confident I should be able to get your toys sent out in time for Christmas! 
If there are any issues with getting everything ready I'll prioritise European orders and anybody who asks nicely, but I'm confident we can get it delivered on time!
This does mean I'll be keeping this campaign short and thoroughly pared down, but I might be able to sneak in a couple of little stretch goals if things are going well...
Given the time of year (and other minor details of 2020) I'll be sending all international orders tracked, so I can at least check what is going on if any parcels take longer than hoped.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Everything is sculpted and mastered and I'm using one of my standard casters so a lot of the risks are already retired. The only risk is the short timescale I'm setting myself so I can get things shipped before Christmas (and Brexit). 
I've got good experience with every stage of production and shipping and I'm keeping everything simple to minimise that risk!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
I'm hoping the models end up being painted an dplayed with for many years to come.

updates.update_content:
Greetings all!

I'm pleased to announce that nearly all of the pledge rewards have now been despatched*! Delivery over Christmas is likely to be a little sluggish, but hopefully you'll be receiving your goodies soon if you haven't already :)

Evening all!
As you may have already seen, I've just sent out all the surveys. They are very quick and easy as I mainly just need your address.
If you would like to add any extras that you missed during the campaign, want to change anything, or are placing an order through the store for other stuff and would like me to combine them then please just let me know in the 'comments' question.
We are planning to get started on packing next weekend, so the earlier you can fill in your survey the better!
Thank you all for backing! It's been another fun campaign, even if I am itching to run the full Kedashi campaign now (with proper stretch goals and extra craziness)... Roll on spring 2021!

We are rapidly approaching the final 24 hours of the campaign! 
It's been short and sweet and very different to prior campaigns, but I hope you've enjoyed it. I was very pleasantly surprised by the support you guys have shown once again and I hope you'll have fun testing out these new models.

I've spent a couple of updates rambling on about the Heavy KalMalog, but poor old Alaim and the Skerrat Broodmother haven't had much attention yet!

updates.update_userinfo: Developing rules for the Heavy KalMalog
updates.update_content:
It's Friday night after a long week, so now seems like a perfect time to talk about Rules development...
I've already told you all about the creation of the Heavy KalMalog, but I didn't include the final stages of the process; designing the rules so you can use this poor little fella to unleash hell on your opponents.
Whenever I'm designing rules I start by trying to think what I want the model to do and where it fits in the game. For some models this is easy (grishak - charge quickly and eat things), others are more tricky (how should the random engineers work?), but the key detail is trying to work out that essence.

These short campaigns always fly by so quickly!
I've been a bit slack coming up with stretch goals this time as I want to make sure that whatever I add doesn't lead to any delays! I am talking to the caster though, so maybe tomorrow.
Instead, I'm start with a silly little extra option: Festive gift wrapping.

Thanks everybody for a great first day of the campaign! We are funded and I've been warning John (my caster) that he's going to be busy.

It seems like a good time to tell you a little about John and about how the Heavy KalMalog came to life... John is a good friend and generally talented chap who runs Gydran Miniatures. He's responsible for doing all the casting this time around, but also takes a lot of the credit for the Heavy KalMalog.

Thanks everybody for getting this going so fast! I’m always nervous when starting a new campaign, so genuinely appreciate the support.
This will be a simple campaign (I’m aware of how fast Christmas is approaching and I want to make that deadline!), but I’ve got a few little ideas in the works to keep things interesting...
Do feel free to make suggestions though!

campaign.story:
Darkest Dungeon is a critically acclaimed video game developed by Red Hook Studios and released in January 2016. After having sold more that 4 million copies of the base game and over 8 million copies including DLCs, the time has come for Darkest Dungeon to move from the screens to your table. Welcome to Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game! 
Click to see the update!
Click to see the detailed update!

Click to see the gallery!
Click to see the gallery!
Click to see the gallery!
Click to see the gallery!
Click to see the gallery!
Please note minis come unpainted.
Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game is a fully cooperative dungeon crawler game in which players take on the role of adventurers. Although brave and determined, adventurers are only human! They are prone to the madness and pain the twisted dwellers of the dungeons will inflict upon them. Death can occur, but is not the worst fate: heroes can be driven mad and beyond help!
Please note minis come unpainted.
The game is played in campaigns of 11 missions. To reach the Darkest Dungeon itself, players will undertake 3 missions per threat level and vanquish the boss. Then, they will be strong enough to face the horrors of the Darkest Dungeon! They may emerge victorious... if they dispatch the source of evil that plagues the land.
Please note minis come unpainted.
For each hero, select 3 skills out of 7 before heading into your mission (and level the heroes up to gain access to more skills). In each room, pick the most suitable stance to best resolve the conflict! Then, on each turn, a player chooses two of the available actions of moving, interacting with the environment, changing their stance or using a skill (if eligible for their current stance). Triumph over encounters, resist rampant madness and emerge victorious before throwing yourself into another battle. Between missions, spend your time in the hamlet, visiting various buildings to find relief from the physical and mental trauma you’ve just endured. Restore the hamlet to its former glory and it will reward you and help you to fulfill the ultimate goal.
RPG-like heroes  – A robust level up system with a ton of customization for unique playable characters.
Stressful Affliction System – Heroes' personalities are paramount! Contend with paranoia, abusiveness, fear, irrationality, and a host of gameplay-meaningful quirks.
Town meta-game – Help your Hamlet growth, and tend to your heroes’ wounds, both corporeal and cerebral.
Loot! Gold, consumable supplies, and mystical trinkets.
Classic roguelike features  transferred to your table, including permadeath & procedural dungeons.
High Replay-ability – One tile, infinite dungeons.
Tough tactical choices - Light tracking, perma death… The combat system pits you against a host of diabolical monsters.
But remember this is a ...
Please note minis come unpainted.
The USA, European Union, Canada, Australia, and UK will be “Shipping Friendly”. Backers from these countries will not pay import taxes.
Shipping is not charged as part of this Kickstarter campaign but is instead done so on the pledge manager after the campaign ends. The shipping price you will pay is based on the weight of your pledge and the country to which it is to be shipped.
The above is a list of rough estimates for shipping. These estimates are based on the costs for our previous campaigns and an estimated final weight of the Core pledge at 5kg. Keep in mind that adding optional buys or additional pledge levels will raise the weight of your pledge and may also then raise the final shipping price.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
General

This is our tenth Kickstarter and we’ve learned a lot from our previous nine. Producing thousands of products and coordinating their delivery to homes across the planet is a complex business, and there are many things which could go wrong. This is why we build in as much time for the unforeseen as possible. We want to ensure that we have the space to deal with any unexpected setbacks and still get your game to you before the estimated delivery date.

To give you a frame of reference for exactly when you will get your game, Mythic Battles: Pantheon, Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1 and Reichbusters: Projekt Vril have been delivered. Super Fantasy Brawl is going to complete fulfillment by the end of the month. Solomon Kane, a big scope project, is at the printer and will be delivered in two waves. In specific wave 1 is in mass production now and the wave 2 moulds are also now being produced. Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1.5 is on track and the first elements will be soon sent to production. Enchanters: East Quest has been printed and is going to ship this month. Steamwatchers is on track and will go to production soon, to make the March fulfilment. HEL: The Last Saga is currently in development.

For all our games, we communicate with our backers with regular updates on Kickstarter and on Gamefound (for our late pledgers) You can also find us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Discord, learn our news and project updates through our weekly Newscast and ask all your questions in our Q&A with Leo on YouTube every Wednesday evening.

Please note that the components, component counts, quality and rules, are all work in progress and subject to change.

Delivery

Our experience in our previous KS has shown us that there can be variances in terms of timing and remaining in schedule when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays
At the same time there are also the unpredictable factors; recently it was the Coronavirus outbreak, but there can be others such as weather conditions, strikes and others.
The estimated delivery date for this project is October 2021, but please bear in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

Shipping

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project.
If you do not finalise your pledge and pay for shipping by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the pledge manager has closed.
If you confirm your pledge by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that outside of countries specifically listed as being “friendly” (above) you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes or APO addresses.
All backers that have selected “No Reward” on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for this campaign, must make sure to confirm their order by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed.

KSE

As KSE, or Kickstarter Exclusives, are marked the products that will not be available to retail. Mythic Games retains the right to continue to sell those in the Pledge Manager, the Mythic Games website, as well as conventions.

Refunds

We have a no-questions-asked refund policy.
All pledges can be refunded in full up to 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign. In addition, if any part of your order cannot be delivered, then we will reimburse you the full cost of this component regardless of the date.
If you apply for a refund more than 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter then we will only be able to refund 85% of it. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order.
Once we have started to process and pack your order, refunds will no longer be available.
Refunds within the first 14 days are reversed via Stripe to the credit card you used to pledge originally. Any refunds requested after the 14 day period may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe or your credit card. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will also be in USD.
If these terms are not acceptable to you, then we suggest that you do not participate in this crowdfunding campaign. Thank you for your understanding.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Kingdoms of Dünnmere
Long ago the forests were ruled by the great boars and sows of Westerwood. They lived in huge sounders and held council with the other forest tribes. Now they are but a shadow of what they were, finding work where they can as bodyguards, pit-fighters and mercenaries.
Dünnmere is an original fantasy setting inspired by dark folklore. It is filled with all manner of odd critters and characters, and with this Kickstarter I wanted to shed some light on a few of its inhabitants.
The Miniatures
My miniatures are sculpted digitally, then 3d printed and cast in high quality resin. The five main figures (Glömm the Collector, Gruntlac Gatecrusher, Gorgrot, Porgroth the Gluttonous and Olaug) come with 40mm round bases. 
Maggot and Rollo are available as add-ons and come with 25mm round bases.  To add them to your pledge simply add £8 for each one you'd like and at the end of the Kickstarter you will be asked which add-ons you would like.
The three pigs each come with an alternative bare-head.
The miniatures are 28mm scale and are made to be compatible with ranges like Dungeons and Dragons, Age of Sigmar, Frostgrave and any other 28mm miniature based games.
Rollo the Masterful painted
Every miniature comes with an illustrated card, with some backstory about the character and signed by the artist.
One of the original ink drawings available in the Artisan Band tiers.
Shipping & Delivery
Once you have chosen your pledge, you will be asked to add on costs for shipping. Any pledge above Hermit will be tracked shipping and so will cost a bit extra. 
Delivery will be completed by March 2021 or possibly sooner.
Why back the Kickstarter?
You'll be helping me to develop and grow the dark folklore-inspired setting of Dünnmere further.
 You'll receive the miniatures at a reduced price (if you order any pledge higher than Hermit). 
Own miniatures from the first casting. Each figure from the first casting is limited to 200 or 300 copies and the illustrated card will show which number from the casting that you have.
You'll receive the miniatures several months before they become available elsewhere.
You'll be supporting my tiny independent miniatures studio, and helping it to take its first steps.
About
Hi, I’m Jack Good and Monkstone Miniatures is my own little creation. I design, sculpt and illustrate each character, and am writing and developing the setting too.  As a child, I loved stories and films about fantasy worlds like Willow and the Dark Crystal, and they massively influenced my own drawings and stories. I collected Citadel miniatures too, and was always drawn to the smaller games like Mordheim and Warhammer Quest. 
I graduated from the Computer Visualisation and Animation degree at Bournemouth University in 2009 and have been lucky enough to have had an almost ten year career in the video game industry making art. Highlights of this include being on the four-person team that created the Bafta nominated ‘Surgeon Simulator 2013’ and leading the art on 'Worlds Adrift'.
Last year I found myself once again being drawn back to painting minis, and realised I also wanted to sculpt my own characters and to create a world inspired by my loves of folklore, fantasy and history. My aim is to expand the setting of Dünnmere, and to eventually develop stories, games and rulesets to enable you to explore these lands for yourselves.
My focus right now though is on developing the highest quality 28mm resin miniatures for you to use in whatever fantasy setting you choose.
This is my first Kickstarter, and with your support it will hopefully be the first step in our journey together. I am hugely passionate about this project and have big plans for its future.
I really appreciate your support
Thank you
- Jack


Acknowledgements
Massive thanks to Eddie Fisher and the team at Zealot Miniatures for helping to bring my miniatures to life in such amazing detail. Jonathan Betts for the incredible illustration at the beginning of the trailer. Dan from Atlantis Miniatures for his guidance and help. Darren Curtis for the music in the trailer and my amazing fiancé Reena for supporting me throughout. x
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As this is our first Kickstarter project we wanted to minimise the risks as much as possible. So we have had all of the miniatures 3D printed and had a batch of each figure cast in resin. This means that we can guarantee the high level of quality, and just have to focus on producing more, and getting them out to you
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Let me know if your miniatures haven't arrived yet!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers
I have started shipping out the miniatures. Half were sent out yesterday, and I'll be sending the other half out in the week.  They should be with you all soon! 
Jack

Hey backers, 
I hope this update finds you well, and that you managed to have a good Christmas and New Years. 
I  got some time over the Christmas break to sculpt up some new creatures to inhabit Dünnmere, and my caster has been busy creating the Kickstarter minis themselves. They are making really good progress, but I will let you know more when I have more information.

updates.update_userinfo: Almost ready to ship! (double check your address is correct)
updates.update_content: Thanks again! I am massively grateful to all your support and messages along the way.  It has been a fantastic journey and I can't wait to get these minis in to your hands.

With not long left of the campaign, I just wanted to say another massive thankyou for supporting the project and helping me to get this far. 
It's been a busy and exciting few weeks but I managed to grab some time this week to paint up another figure. It's Olaug!

Gruntlac holds a special place in my heart as he is the first miniature that I ever sculpted. I got to the stage of breaking him into parts for mould making and decided to shelve him and work on a simpler miniature, which ended up being Rollo.  
I've always loved the idea of pig-based minotaurs and I tried converting my own (with little success) when I used to collect beastman as a kid. Here is my rendition of Gruntlac painted up!

Olaug was one of my favourite miniatures to sculpt as she has so many interesting details. These include a sickle, a mandrake root, a toad (escaping from a bag), a shield fashioned from a window shutter, and plenty of skulls. She is a member of the Bittlehole coven, and they are a group that I would really like to explore further with future miniatures.
Here is a closer look at Olaug.

campaign.story:
“The old woman fussed and busied about her home. At her feet, three cloth kittens scampered and played as she swept the floor, stoked the fire and straightened the furniture. They were to have visitors. Bundled out of the cottage by the old woman, the kittens darted through the rain and across the clearing to the shelter of the woodshed. A low mournful moan slid through the slatted wood of the shed. The kittens looked at each other, then bolted straight back to the house. Small pebble eyes watched them go.”
Left at the Bottom of the Garden Chapter Two is a project to fund the production of nine high quality, lead-free metal miniatures, each depicting a lost toy. Following on from my previous Kickstarter, our intrepid lost toys have met a new group of toys deep in the forest: the old woman who lives in the woods, her various cloth cats, a toy robin and whatever it is she keeps in the woodshed. 
As the owner and sculptor of Statuesque Miniatures, I've produced many miniatures over the years. However, the Left at the Bottom of the Garden toys are something quite different in style and purpose from my usual work and that's why I've again come to Kickstarter to help reach as many people as possible.  The first Left at the Bottom of the Garden Kickstarter (which I now call 'Chapter One') was successful and fulfilled on time. With your help, I can get production started and continue the tale of Olive, Clementine and Little Puss, and all the other toys they meet in the woods.
The Miniatures
Measuring approximately 13mm to 31mm tall, the Left at the Bottom of the Garden Chapter Two miniatures represent the household of the old woman who lives in the woods - mostly cloth cats. I sculpted the miniatures with tabletop gaming, painting and collecting in mind. In particular, I wanted them to be nice little objects in themselves, needing no glue, no assembly beyond normal casting clean-up, and no plastic bases. They have bold, chunky details meaning they can be easily painted or finished however you wish.
All photos show production castings of the miniatures (either painted or prepped and given a wash of oil paint to bring out the details), so if the Kickstarter is successful I'll be ready to start casting your miniatures immediately. There won't be any stretch goals or additional items added during the course of the campaign - I don't want anything to delay fulfilment.
Please note, due to their small size the Left at the Bottom of the Garden miniatures are not intended for small children.
The Pledges
Below you can see each of the pledge levels available. All miniatures are supplied in a bare metal state.
Choose any set or sets of miniatures from the Add On list below. Simply pledge the total for those sets. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign.
The complete set of nine Left at the Bottom of the Garden Chapter Two miniatures, cast in high quality, lead-free metal.
Additional sets of miniatures can also be chosen from the Add On list below. Simply add the total cost for those sets to the pledge level. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign.
All nine miniatures from 'Chapter One' (from the first Kickstarter) and all nine miniatures from 'Chapter Two', and a FREE 'lone toy hoodie crow', all cast in high quality, lead-free metal.
Additional sets of miniatures can be chosen from the Add On list bellow. Simply add the total cost for those sets to the pledge level. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign.
Add Ons
The following items can be added to any pledge for the amount indicated. All Add On items are supplied in a bare metal state.
You can add the old woman to your pledge for £5.
The toy troll can be added to your pledge for £5.
Add the three cloth cats to your pledge for £7.
You can add the three cloth kittens to your pledge for £5.
The toy robin can be added to your pledge for £2.
Another set of Chapter Two toys can be added to your pledge for £22.
You can add all the Chapter One toys to your pledge for £22. This set is also included in the "Both Chapters' Toys" pledge level.
Chapter One's Olive, Clementine and Little Puss can be added to your pledge for £8.
Add the three singing rats from Chapter One to your pledge for £3.
You can add the Penguin from Chapter One to your pledge for £5.
Chapter One's two hoodie crows can be added to your pledge for £7,
Little Puss the beanbag cat from Chapter One can be added to your pledge for £2.
A lone toy hoodie crow can be added to your pledge for £3.50, and comes free with the "Both Chapters' Toys" pledge level.
Shipping Costs
Shipping costs will be collected after the Kickstarter ends - do not include shipping costs in your pledge amount.
The shipping costs will follow the usual Statuesque Miniatures Flat Rate shipping costs based on the Royal Mail's World Zones. Full details of the shipping costs can be seen HERE on the Statuesque website but below is a summary:
 United Kingdom - £2.70
 Europe - £4.30 standard mail or £10.85 tracked
 World Zone 1 - £5.50 standard mail or £10.65 tracked
 World Zone 2 (including Aus and NZ) - £6.30 standard mail or £11.45 tracked
 World Zone 3 (USA only) - £5.55 standard mail or £10.75 tracked
Pledges over £50 will be sent by tracked mail (where available) for the standard mail shipping cost.
Please note, experience has taught me that it is best to send orders to certain counties only by International Tracked services (or if unavailable, International Signed) to ensure prompt delivery. All rewards sent to Russia (Europe shipping), Brazil and Canada (World Zone 1) will be sent by International Tracked mail only and charged appropriately, while rewards sent to Mexico (World Zone 1) will be sent by International Signed mail only and charged appropriately. No criticism of these countries is implied; I just want you to get your rewards as quickly as possible and I've found this to be the best way.
Shipping costs will be collected after the Kickstarter through the Statuesque Miniatures webshop: you will receive a discount coupon to the value of your pledge amount, you will then place an order for your chosen rewards, and upon entering your discount coupon code you will only pay for the shipping costs (and any additional items you may wish to purchase).
It is very important that you check your Kickstarter messages as that is where I will send your discount coupons and information regarding the payment of shipping costs. Please be sure that your Kickstarter account is linked to an email account you check regularly and turn on notifications for Kickstarter messages.
Shipping to the European Union
Please note that while the United Kingdom left the EU on the 31st of January 2020, during the Transition Period it remains in the EU Customs Union and the Single Market.
The Transition Period runs until the 31st of December 2020. As this Kickstarter will be fulfilled during the Transition Period, EU backers' rewards will not be subject to VAT, customs charges or handling fees on import into the EU. As such, this project is EU Friendly.
I'll be posting more photos of the painted toys during the campaign, along with a tutorial on how I painted them. Basically - lots of splatter!
Statuesque Miniatures Social Media
Please do check out the various Statuesque Miniatures social media accounts. All likes, comments and shares are much appreciated!
Statuesque Facebook page
 Left at the Bottom of the Garden Facebook group: check out Michael Thorp's WIP Left at the Bottom of the Garden game!
Statuesque Twitter
 Andrew's Instagram: #leftatthebottomofthegarden for lots of toys!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Statuesque Miniatures' second Kickstarter, with the first having been successful and fulfilled on time. I have been running Statuesque Miniatures for over 9 years now and have a reputation for good quality and good service, something I am not willing to sacrifice.

As such, the preparation for this project is already complete - the 3d prints have been printed and moulded, the master castings cast and the production moulds made and tested. All that needs to be done now is the production casting to complete your rewards.

With regards to Covid-19, I've reduced the number of Post Office trips I do each week to minimise my risk of exposure during the pandemic, as well as taking the usual precautions . I also live in an area with a low prevalence of the virus and don't go to the pub or do other high risk activities. All orders/rewards will of course be packed in a hygienic manner.

Should any delay occur due to unforeseen circumstances, I will keep you all updated.

Thanks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Pretty much! I've posted all rewards for which I've received Shipping Invoice payment. With a fair wind behind the mail planes and post vans, hopefully most of you will receive your rewards before the end of the month. Can I call this project fulfilled on time? I hope so.
You should have all received a dispatch email from Paypal, including a tracking number if you chose Tracked Shipping.
Dispatch emails are sent to the email address that was used to make the invoice payment. For example, if the invoice was sent to joeblogs@geocities.com, but you paid using a Paypal account linked to joeblogs@askjeeves.com, the dispatch email will go to joeblogs@askjeeves.com.

Hello again, and apologies for posting a second update in one evening. There are a couple of things I want to clear up that I should have mentioned in the previous update.

Firstly:
All rewards are dispatched to the address given in the Kickstarter Survey. However, your Paypal address may be different, and the dispatch email will list the Paypal address, not the Survey address. I can't change this unfortunately, but if I notice the Survey address and Paypal address don't match, I include a note to say the package has been sent to the Survey address.

Hi everyone,
I just thought I'd write a quick update on how shipping is going.
So far, I've packed and posted 176 of 320 packages. I'm packing in backer-number order, with the exception of EU-destined rewards which are packed as and when I receive shipping payment.

Hello!
All backers should now have received their Kickstarter Surveys. As it says in the survey, these will tell me what shipping service you want, to which email address I will send your Shipping Invoice, and if you pledged for any Add On items.
Please note, this process is different from the Pledge Manager process described on the Kickstarter campaign page. For the reasons why, check the previous update.

Hi everyone! Do you want the good news or the not-so-good news?
Whaaaaaaaat?
Better get the not-so-good news out of the way first. As I said in the last update, I had hoped to have opened the webshop-based Pledge Manager for EU backers by now. It's all ready to go, discount coupons ready to send, but on Sunday night I checked the process one last time with a test order... and the coupons are causing an error. Specifically, if the coupon reduces the basket value to £0 (which is the intention), with only the shipping costs to be paid by the backer, the shop system says no and has a little meltdown.

Hi folks.
I said in last week's update I'd follow up with the situation a week on and, unfortunately, I've not been able to rectify the problem remoulding the old woman. I've tried various methods, even going as far as using a honking great 30 tonne jack in place of the 15 tonne jack my vulcanizer was supplied with. Although I got closer to a fully formed mould, still the deepest recesses where the old woman's skirt meets the base aren't filling with rubber completely.

Hi everyone!
So it's three weeks since the end of the Kickstarter and as I'd previously said, I'd hoped to have the Pledge Manager up and running by now.
What's happened?

Hi everyone!
It's a couple of days since the Kickstarter ended but I haven't been slacking. I spent all day yesterday casting more toys and it won't take long to get everything required cast and ready to go.
Here's how I plan to proceed:
Firstly...

campaign.story:
In Die of the Dead, players play as friendly spirits, helping guide souls back to the land of the living to celebrate Dia de Muertos. The first player to have one of their souls reach the land of the living wins!
Welcome to the journey from the world of the dead to the land of the living... 
We have worked with a cultural consultant and a Mexican artist to really help bring Dia de Muertos to the table and embed the beauty and culture within the game. This has resulted in amazing components, such as our four gorgeous Dia de Muertos caskets, and the 3D nine-step staircase, showing the levels the souls travel on from the World of the Dead to the Land of the Living; as well as papel picado player boards, ofrenda tokens and custom calavera dice. All of these will be used by players as they add souls to the caskets, move the caskets towards the steps, and ascend the steps to the land of the living. Die of the Dead is fully playtested and print ready, so we will be able to get it in people's hands by Dia de Muertos 2021! 
For full rules please check out our current rulebook here: Rules (prototype) . For a full overview please check out this fantastic Chits and Giggles video here
The goal for each player is to get a soul (represented by the dice) to the land of the living. Players do this by adding souls to the caskets, moving the caskets, and then transferring the souls from the casket to the steps.
On a player's turn they choose one of the four caskets. Each casket will do two things, depending upon its location. One will benefit the current player, the other will depend upon the shake of the casket, and could be good, or bad, for all players around the table. Some of the things the caskets allow players to do are:
Players need to consider carefully which caskets they have souls in when deciding which action they wish to do that round, and how they can manoeuvre the caskets to help them win!
In addition, players can gain tokens representing the items from an ofrenda to help them. 
Ofrenda tokens
These will give the player who uses them an edge, or let them change the rules in some way. 
Everything you see here
We're keeping things simple this Kickstarter- everyone who backs the game gets the best version of the game. No different tiers or having to buy expansions before trying out the game. 
In order to make sure this game reaches people before Dia de Muertos 2021 we have chosen realistic stretch goals which won't need any additional playtesting, or add any cost to the shipping of the game.
Unlocked: At £9000 we will upgrade the box art so it looks even better by adding UV spot printing.
Unlocked: At £12000 we will upgrade from screen-printed custom dice to engraved custom dice.
And that's it! Only two stretch goals might seem a small number, but the game is complete, and the last thing we want to do is unbalance it, or make it more expensive to ship. If we do end up far exceeding these then we will put any savings towards subsidising shipping rates even further.
At Radical 8 Games we understand that shipping can be a barrier to backing a game, especially considering the uncertainty around the world at the moment. Therefore we make this guarantee that, no matter what, for UK and US backers the cost of the game & shipping will be less than the MSRP. We would love to be able to offer this to everybody, but we cant guarantee this to be the case with the fees involved in other countries, although we will be offering as cost effective shipping as possible, including a subsidy from us to keep costs down.
All shipping will be charged in the pledge manager after the campaign has ended. All UK, European, American, Canadian and Australian shipping will be done from within that region for friendly shipping.
Update 1st September: We have a new fulfilment partner for customers in China and some other  regions. We can now offer estimated shipping to China for $9, and Japan,  South Korea, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Taiwan,  Thailand & Vietnam for $18.
*Excluding Alaska and Hawaii.
**For more information please just send us a message. 
For Mexico we have chosen to take the steps to subsidise shipping further, we estimate this to be around £13. Please see our most recent update for more on this.
Please check out some videos and thoughts on the game from other people!
For Chits & Giggles have a superb overview here: 
Card and Pixel have an excellent write up here: https://cardandpixel.tumblr.com/post/626960669850451969/die-of-the-dead-a-kickstarter-preview
The Dice Tower have a great in-depth overview here: 
Tantrum House have done a wonderful preview in their own inimitable style (don't forget to check out their outtakes):  
 Board, Deck and Dice have a nice quick overview here: 
Here's an interview we did for Kicking Tables, discussing the game, from conception to production:  
 Update 10th September:
Another great preview, this time from the Hairy Game Lords:
Finally Richard from We're Not Wizards has another excellent written preview:
https://werenotwizards.blogspot.com/2020/09/die-of-dead-radical-8-games-kickstarter.html 
Here's a playthrough we recorded, we've edited out the setup and rules introduction, but hopefully it gives you a sense of how fun the game is (thanks to Nate and Angel for volunteering to be recorded playing)
In addition, if you're interested in reading about how the game was designed, and the thought that went into each part, you can check out our designer diaries on BoardGameGeek or our Website.
A massive Thank You to everybody above for their efforts!
One thing we'd like to do is include all our backers in the choice of new colours for the Casket Boards. The current colours introduce the misconception that they are related to the token boards, because the colours match. To avoid this, and make the game even more colourful, we will be using four different colours for the casket boards. This is where you come in. Below we've got some examples of possible colours we could use for the casket boards: 
If any of these strike your fancy, or if there are other colours you'd like to see, please let us know, either in the comments, or in our online poll! At the end of the campaign we will choose the four most popular contrasting colours. So just tell us your favourites, and together we'll make sure the game looks even more beautiful.
In addition, you can join us on Twitter or Facebook, using the buttons below:
Radical 8 Games is an independent publisher based in York, UK. Our last Kickstarted game, Forks, was funded, manufactured and fulfilled all ahead of schedule in August 2019. Radical 8 Games is run by Mark, who pre-lockdown spent most his time at Beyond Monopoly! boardgame club playing Agricola when he wasn't playtesting Die of the Dead. Designer James Allen runs Leeds Playtesting with Playtest UK, and has worked hard not only on his own games, but improving games for all designers in the group. Rusembell is an exceptional artist from Mexico, and you can check out more of her amazing artwork here: https://www.deviantart.com/rusembell.
Thanks to the following: all our playtesters, everyone who supports Playtest UK, everyone at Beyond Monopoly (especially those who had to put up with Mark forcing people to play some of those early builds), the HGS boardgame club, Angel for the bread, Jason, Will & Sean for 'Wellbeing Wednesdays' and everyone who stopped by for a chat at Airecon or Virtual UKGE.
And you, for supporting us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Whilst this is our second Kickstarter, and we successfully fulfilled our first quickly and efficiently, there are two things which may crop up as challenges regarding this project, and it would be foolish to not acknowledge them: Brexit and Covid-19.

If a second wave of Covid-19 hits there will be two possible results. Either delays in manufacturing, or increased costs to shipping. What we can do about delays in manufacturing is very limited, and although we hope we have built in enough spare time to still meet the deadline of Dia de Muertos 2021, if there are delays we promise to keep everyone updated at least once every two weeks regarding them.
If there is an increased cost to shipping we will look to bear that burden ourselves. Again, all backers will be kept updated with anything that might happen regarding a second wave of Covid-19.

Brexit is only of concern to UK backers- we will be using fulfilment centres in all parts of the world including the EU, so only UK backers would be affected by this. As we are expecting a significant number of backers to come from the UK, this shouldn't actually affect anybody too badly, as making sure games get here will be a priority. We are working with fulfilment centres in the UK, and will keep on talking to them about Brexit, especially as more is known. Again, the main issues will be increased shipping costs and possible delays, but as Radical 8 Games is based in the UK, we will be working overtime to make sure the games get here with minimum delays and will bear any additional costs.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Something else
We won't be using a plastic tray in Die of the Dead. The caskets, box and steps have been designed so they fit snugly in the box, with dice in the caskets and tokens under the steps, all to reduce the amount of plastic required!

updates.update_content: Hi everyone, after much waiting I'm happy to announce that I have been told by ShipQuest that EU deliveries will be commencing from monday, and been told by people here that they've actually alread started!

Hi everyone, I've received a number of questions form EU backers, and seen a number of comments, so here's a quick update for EU backers. 
On Wednesday I received an email from shipquest that the games were out for delivery that day. I assume that's delivery to the warehouse in Germany, but have emailed to ask for clarification. I've also asked if there's an estimated date for shipping from that warehouse (the UK fulfillment centre took a few weeks to get to delivering Die of the Dead in the UK, so I'm expecting a similar timeframe in the EU).

Hi everyone, before I begin this update properly, I just want to say to our EU backers that I have emailed Shipquest about the status of the EU orders and will update you all when I get more information. You haven't been forgotten about, the games have been shipped and we've been invoiced (and paid that invoice), so I think things are just going very slowly.

updates.update_userinfo: Final thanks, and an update about moving forward
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, fantastic to see UK games are being received. I want to update everyone on the UK, Canada, Mexico and EU shipping situation. But first, two things.
1. If you've already got a game in and enjoyed it then please visit  Boardgamegeek and give us a review, as well as spread the word as much as you can. It's not just a nice thing that makes us happy, but it also really helps the company.
2. I've seen a couple of photos of people playing the game with the caskets upside down :o Please make sure you play the game looking at the lovely calaveras! The bases are shallow so that when the caskets are opened everyone can see the results without having to peer inside. Here's an old photo for reference:

updates.update_userinfo: UK Collection, Shipping Update and Casket Orientation guide!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, just a quick update regarding UK postage as our games are currently being dispatched in the UK (yay!). There's a plague of scam text messages and phone calls in the UK at the moment, telling people that they owe a fee for postage. If you receive a message asking for postage fees to be paid, that is a scam text and should be ignored. There are no postage fees for anybody (beyond those already paid through Gamefound). If we need to contact anybody for any reason we will do so through email or Kickstarter, and not via text.
There's some more information here:  https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-56496203

Hi everyone, just a quick shipping update regarding the UK, EU, Mexico, Canada and Rest of World.

UK and Rest of World- the games are currently in the fulfillment centre and shipping will commence next week. As soon as the games are sent to York for local collection I'll let people who chose that option know and make arrangements for collection.

Hi everyone, two things today- a quick shipping update, and a guide on how to pack the game back in the box.
First, thank you to everyone who has been posting comments or messages showing their delight in receiving Die of the Dead, it makes us incredibly happy to read that people have the game and are enjoying it, and hopeully that will be all backers very soon.
All games to US backers have now been despatched, and hopefully everyone has either received their game or the emila confirming depsatch. If you haven't then please get in touch, as there were a number of backers who we have contacted due to errors in either payment or addresses but haven't got back to us.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, just another short shipping update. First, it's fantastic that a number of people are already receiving the game! If you're in Australia or Asia the games have been sent out, so if you haven't received it by the end of the next week please send us an email: mark@radical8games.com.

In the USA the games have finally passed through customs, and Fulfillrite received them today. They have been fantastic with processing this and have already begun to ship the games out. They should finish shipping them all by the end of next week, hopefully even earlier.

Hi everyone, just another quick shipping update- as you may have seen in the comments some games have already started to arrive with backers in Asia! Thanks to Joachim from So Many Games, So Little Time, for posting an unboxing video here . 
Additionally, today we were told that the games have arrived in Australia. All shipping details will be sent over today for backers in Australia and New Zealand, so hopefully backers in those countries should receive the game soon as well.

campaign.story:
Join the community on the ArcWorlde Facebook group!
ArcWorlde: Second Edition - The Imperials introduces a new Faction to collect, paint and play for the narrative fantasy battle game from Warploque Miniatures.
ArcWorlde: Second Edition is a narrative battle game set in a whimsical fantasy world, where you play exciting story-driven scenarios on the tabletop.
The Giantess
Players use their wits, tactical skill and outside-of-the-box creative thinking to play fun and memorable clashes between heroes, warbands and monsters in a game that is quick, engaging and easy to learn, with beautiful hand-sculpted miniatures.
Click here!
ArcWorlde: Second Edition - The Imperials brings a whole new playable Faction to the game. 
 Here are the models being made for the ArcWorlde: Second Edition - The Imperials Kickstarter.
Download the rules here
Click to download the rules!
Rules coming soon!
Unicorn Mount Work in Progress


These are the available pledge levels for this Kickstarter. Watch out for Stretch Goals, as they might add free goodies on top of your core pledges!
There are (currently) four more Factions available for ArcWorlde: Second Edition. You may choose any of these Starter Warbands for your COHORT or BRIGADE pledge.
To find out more about these Factions, and to see what other miniatures are available, please visit their sections on the Warploque Miniatures website - www.warploqueminiatures.com.
Click here to see what other Characters are available for the Halflings
Click here to see what other Characters are available for the Wild Elves
Click here to see what other Characters are available for the Beastfolk
Click here to see what other Characters are available for the Undead Raiders
 Adding Existing ArcWorlde products
If you would like to add existing ArcWorlde products from the webstore to your pledge, you can absolutely do so! This will be arranged via the Pledge Manager, and more information will be posted soon.
The cost of shipping is not included in your pledge, and will be added after the conclusion of the campaign through the pledge manager.
I will provide you all with full instructions when the time comes. I am still finalising the exact shipping costs, but to give you a rough idea here are a couple of preliminary estimates:
TREASURE MAP: - £0 unless used to purchase miniatures in the campaign.
TROOPER/PLATOON/COHORT: £4 to the UK, £12 US, £10 ROW.
BRIGADE/GIANTESS: £5 to the UK, £15 US, £12 ROW.
These estimates may increase if you purchase a large number of additional models on top of your core pledge. The final shipping costs are subject to change, and will be based on your location and specific rewards.
For those of you in the EU - as with everyone else, we have no idea what the outcome of Brexit will be on shipping costs, including any potential tariffs. We will keep you all updated as we find out more.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any undertaking of this nature is a huge commitment and a lot of work for everyone involved. Miniatures need sculpting, manufacturing, packing and eventually shipping to the backers.

It is at these hurdles that some Kickstarters have faltered in the past, so, I have given careful consideration to each part of the process to minimise potential risk. Warploque Miniatures is a family run business, so everyone involved is 100% dedicated to making this project as successful and professional as possible. My father is our resin caster, my mother is in charge of packing and shipment, and our metal caster is a tried and tested craftsman we have worked with for over four years.

Also, instead of relying purely on concept art and work-in-progress sculpts to illustrate my products, all of the initial models that I am offering have already been sculpted. They've been cast, the display copies have been painted, and they are ready to go into production, so backers know exactly what they are investing in. I will be relying on Work in Progress sculpts and concept art for some of the stretch goals, but be assured that they will be completed and cast in a timely manner once the campaign has been funded.

Finally, I have set achievable delivery date estimates. I have kept the campaign small and manageable, eschewing an overly long list of stretch goals, so this project has a much higher probability of being completed and delivered on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We only use the best materials for our miniatures, which are sturdy and durable for extended gaming sessions.
Environmentally friendly factories
All Warploque Miniatures products are manufactured locally in the UK by local craftsmen.
Something else
All Warploque Miniatures products are manufactured locally by local craftsmen.

The start of your adventures into ArcWorlde, or maybe a new path...
Just fancy a particular model? Jump in the campaign and purchase any of the add-ons made available!

support.descp:

Get the Imperial Starter Warband, and enjoy a seriously satisfied grin for grabbing a bargain. All miniatures cast in white metal, and supplied with plastic bases.
(Shipping charged separately, see campaign for details.)
INCLUDES:

updates.update_content:
Ho there, ArcFans!
It's Lockdown 2 in the UK - and to celebrate come and hangout with me tomorrow night as I paint some ArcWorlde models!

updates.update_userinfo: Bayourks - The next ArcWorlde Kickstarter! Going live on the 18th of November 2020
updates.update_content:
Ho there, ArcFans!
I hope you are well, and keeping safe. Little birds are telling me that Kickstarter pledges have started to arrive in Europe, and I'm looking forward to hearing from you folks in even further places when your boxes of goodies arrive!
As such, I'm super excited to tell you all about the next ArcWorlde Kickstarter - the Bayourks!

updates.update_userinfo: ALL PACKED - The Kickstarter is fulfilled!
updates.update_content:
Ho there, ArcFans!
I am delighted to announce that all of the parcels for the ArcWorlde: Second Edition - The Imperials Kickstarter have been packed! My mum and dad (Rob and Dawn) have done an incredible job getting everything packed on time, and they will be driving to the Post Office tomorrow to drop everything off. If you got your pledge manager to me on time, you'll be getting your miniatures very soon.

updates.update_userinfo: NON-UK BACKERS - Tomorrow deadline for tracked shipping!
updates.update_content:
Ho there, ArcFans!
Hope you are all well, and enjoying the spooky season!
Just reminder after Update #25 that tomorrow (31st of October) is the final deadline to arrange tracked shipping for your Kickstarter parcels .
If you are not in the UK, and you would like to arrange tracked shipping for your pledge, please get in contact with us either on Kickstarter, or on our contact email () before the 31st of October. Unfortunately, as we are a small family business we cannot afford to replace missing parcels, so if you would like to be super duper safe, please consider this option.

Ho there, ArcFans!
I am delighted to announce that (bar a few stragglers) the UK Backers  have had their parcels shipped!

updates.update_userinfo: NON-UK BACKERS - Last chance to arranged tracked shipping!
updates.update_content:
Ho there, ArcFans!
Hope you are all well. Thank you for your understanding, kindness and support on the previous update. My parents and I are extremely grateful for your concern, and I can only thank you from the bottom of my heart!
Right, now that the soppy stuff is over, I have an announcement for all of the international (non UK) backers. The pandemic is still going on, and with the last Kickstarter quite a number of parcels went missing (especially those going to France, for some reason).

Ho there, Arcfans!
Hope you are doing well, and keeping safe.
A quick update today. I am pleased to announce that all of the casting has been completed for the Imperials Kickstarter! Both the metal and resin miniatures have been lovingly prepared, and the packing of the first parcels is due to begin in the next few days.

Ho there, ArcFans!
Hope you are all well. A very quick update tonight, but just to let you know we are still on track for an October shipment of the campaign!
Rob (my Dad) the resin caster is hard at work, as is Jon, our trusty metal caster. If all things continue to go well, we'll be shipping off the first of you lucky folks' parcels in the coming weeks.

updates.update_userinfo: Wild Elven Centaur revealed - 3 DAYS LEFT OF PLEDGE MANAGER!
updates.update_content:
Ho there, ArcFans!
Hope you are all well. I've just put the finishing touches on yet another model, this time the Wild Elven Centaur:

Ho there, ArcFans!
Hope you are all well. I've just put the finishing touches on the Arclancer for the Imperials -
(For some reason Kickstarter isn't uploading the photo, so you can find it HERE.)
He's a little different from the initial concept art, but I hope you like him as much as I liked sculpting him.

campaign.story:
Minos is the new  miniature for my range: SIMONMINIATURES , 90 mm of brutality in the service of the Barbarian clan. After the success of my first ks "The Saga of Belius the black",  I launch "The Legend of Minos". For those who do not know me, I sculpt miniatures in Fimo in a traditional way, for more than 20 years. Before for Rackham for 9 years, then for different freelance company, notably Mierce Miniatures, Monolith with Conan, Mythic Battles and Claustrophobia, successes on Kickstarter. 
Minos, 90 mm and Lothart, 35 mm
Minos, 90 mm
 Kickstarter is the ideal platform to develop personal work for my range: SIMONMINIATURES . It allows me to create the molds for my sculptures and thus satisfied all the fans of my work. Jérémie Dès is my caster, he was the wonderful caster of Rackham. Minos is accompanied by Beowulf, barbarian champion, he will command Angus and Branag on the battlefields without weakening. Lothart is a combat druid, skilled at the sword, he guesses the signs sent by the gods and whispers in the ears of the creatures of the Elebore forest.
The Goals (Stretch Goals / SG ) of the campaign are the sums to be reached to unlock miniatures. These amounts are listed on the left side of the photo.For unlocked a miniature you can add the price of this miniature to the amount of your pledge, (indicat at the bottom right of the card if you want to receive this miniature). So you can build your pledge the way you want.
                                               Same goes for Addons, they are optional, increase your pledge by the price of the miniature of your choice.
                                               If you want the same miniature in several copies, increase your pledge by the same amount (example if you want Beowulf in 2 copies increase your pledge by 2X14 = 28 €)
                                               The miniatures are not assembled (a tube of cyano glue is enough, the resin sticks very well) unpainted and without bases.
FRENCH VERSION:
Minos est la nouvelle figurine sculpté pour ma gamme SIMONMINIATURES, 90 mm de brutalité au service du clan Barbare. Après le succès de la Saga de Bélius le noir, et j'en remercie tout les fans de mon travail, je lance la Légende de Minos. Pour ceux qui ne me connaissent pas, je sculpte des figurines en Fimo de manière traditionnelle, depuis plus de 20 ans. Avant pour Rackham pendant 9 ans, puis pour différentes marques en freelance, notemment Mierce Miniatures, Monolith avec Conan, Mythic Battles et Claustrophobia, des succès sur Kickstarter.
 Kickstarter est la plateforme idéal pour développer des travaux personnels comme ma gamme SIMONMINIATURES. Elle me permet de créer les moules pour tirer mes sculptures en résines et ainsi contenté tout les fans de mon travail.
Minos est accompagné de Beowulf, champion barbare, il commandera Angus et Branag sur les champs de bataille sans faiblir. Lothart est un druide de combat, habile à l'épée, il devine les signes envoyés par les dieux et chuchote à l'oreilles des créatures de la forêt Elebore.
Lothart, barbarian druid, 35 mm
Les Objectifs(Stretch Goals/SG en anglais) de la campagne sont les sommes à atteindre pour débloquer des figurines. Ces sommes sont inscrites sur le côté gauche de la photo. Pour débloquer une figurine vous pouvez ajouter, au montant de votre pledge le prix de la figurine,indiqué sur la carte(en bas à droite)  si vous voulez recevoir cette figurine. Ainsi vous construisez votre pledge comme vous le souhaitez. Même chose pour les Ajouts (addons en anglais), ils sont optionnels, augmentez votre pledge du prix de la figurine de votre choix.
Beowulf, barbarian champion 35 mm
Si vous voulez la même figurine en plusieurs exemplaires, augmentez d'autant votre pledge (exemple si vous voulez Beowulf en 2 exemplaires augmentez votre pledge de 2X14=28€)
Les figurines ne sont pas assemblées (un tube de colle cyano suffit, la résine colle très bien) non peintes et sans socles.
 Add the prices of the miniatures to your pledge to unlocked them!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
C'est mon deuxième projet, le premier à été financé et livré avec succès. Un projet peut avoir du retard c'est pourquoi j'ai augmenté la date de création des moules et la livraison à 4 mois après la fin du ks.

This is my second project, the first has been funded and successfully delivered. A project can be delayed that is why I increased the date of creation of the molds and the delivery to 4 months after the end of the ks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
