campaign.story:
Join us for our final Closing Stream on Friday March 6th, starting at 8am PST/11am EST, and count down the end of the campaign with us! Click here to join the stream.
日本の皆さんはこちら↓↓
https://www.platinumgames.co.jp/kickstarter
                              ※キックスターターページの内容を翻訳したプラチナゲームズのサイトです。
                              ※ご支援については、キックスターターページ（英語）からお願いいたします。
The Wonderful 101 is a “Unite Action” action-adventure game developed by PlatinumGames Inc., directed by action game luminary Hideki Kamiya, and originally released on the Nintendo Wii U. 
In this game, players take control of the Wonderful Ones, heroes from all over the world chosen to defend the Earth from all manner extraterrestrial threats! When the peaceful Blossom City comes under attack by alien invaders, Wonder-Red, Wonder-Blue, and the rest of the Wonderful Ones suit up and unite to save the world!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered will be released on Nintendo Switch, with versions for other platforms becoming available via stretch goals. We also plan to add a host of amazing extras as stretch goals are met, with the goal of making The Wonderful 101: Remastered the definitive depiction of our heroes’ exploits!
#ALLFOR101
Physical copies of The Wonderful 101: Remastered distributed as backer rewards will include a Special Backers Only Kickstarter-exclusive cover! Additionally, backers will receive DLC unlocked via stretch goals for FREE!
Unite with fellow backers and participate in this live Social Media Challenge to unlock even more rewards!
#ALLFOR101
Blossom City Reward Unlocks:
Mission 1: COMPLETE: Sticker Set increased by 31!
Mission 2: COMPLETE: Acrylic Standee size increased from iPhone size to iPad size!
Mission 3: COMPLETE: Add 20 pages to the artbook!
Mission 4: COMPLETE: Sticker Set increased by 31!
Mission 5: COMPLETE: Papercraft Face Mask (in PDF form!)
Mission 6: COMPLETE: A secret look at Kamiya's desk
Mission 7: 3290 Retweets: Membership reward upgrade from paper to plastic!
Mission 8: COMPLETE: Sticker increased by 31 for a total of 101!
Mission 9: COMPLETE: The softcover physical artbook becomes hardcover!
Mission 10: COMPLETE: Membership reward upgrade from paper to plastic!
Mission 11: COMPLETE: Additional Collaborators will be added to the Remix album
Mission 12: COMPLETE: Kamiya unblocks everyone!

What is The Defense of Blossom City?
The Defense of Blossom City is a Social Media Challenge for all backers to play during the Kickstarter campaign. The game will start with a single Wonderful One traveling through Blossom City on the Virgin Victory, protecting the city from invaders.
The size of the Wonderful Team will grow by 1 member every 500 backers.
Each new member on the team will raise your Wonder Power. The more Wonder Power gained throughout the campaign, the easier it will become to clear social goals, and unlock awesome new rewards for all backers to enjoy!
Get Blocked by Kamiya
 Not everyone has had the privilege of being blocked on Twitter by the illustrious Hideki Kamiya, but that’s all about to change. At a very special Kickstarter tier, Kamiya himself will tweet directed to you, and then will block you forever!
NOTE: This is an optional reward! You do not have to be blocked by Kamiya if you do not want to be!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered Digital Version
Right on! A Digital Key for TW101, straight from P-Star to you!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered Digital Double Pack
A double dose of The Wonderful 101: Remastered Digital Version. Get each one on the platform of your choice! Keep them both, or give one to a friend. The choice is yours!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered Physical Version
Looking for something more... physical? This is the physical edition of The Wonderful 101: Remastered, with backer exclusive box art!
Double/Physical Combo
A double punch of The Wonderful 101: Remastered goodness, this tier includes both a physical and a digital copy of the game, so you can keep one for your collection, and one for quick access on-the-go!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered Physical Double Pack
A double dose of The Wonderful 101: Remastered, in a box! Get each one on the platform of your choice! Whether you want it on two different platforms, or want to gift one to a friend, this might just be for you.

101 Keychain
Hold on to a little piece of the W101 wherever you go! This is a gold keychain emblazed with the burning red justice of the W101!
Wonderful Sticker Set
UV coated 2" vinyl stickers of the main cast of heroes, perfect for indoor or outdoor use.
Centinels Identification Card
Show your allegiance to the CENTINELS with this Wonderful 101 card, a recreation of the membership badge  card each Wonderful One gets upon joining the cause.
Wonder-Pendant
While not actually equipped with a Psychic Switch, this recreation of the Wonder-Pendant owned by every Wonderful One will show the world that you're ready to save the world at the first sign of trouble!
Wonderful T-shirt
Represent The Wonderful 101! This tee signifies your support of the W101, and your hidden power to help them defeat evil!
The Wonderful 101 Digital Comic
Follow the adventures of the Wonderful Ones in a brand new Kickstarter exclusive comic book, in digital PDF form!
The Wonderful 101 Physical Comic
Follow the adventures of the Wonderful Ones in a brand new Kickstarter exclusive comic book, in classic paperback form!
Wonderful Acrylic Diorama
 The Wonderful Ones strike iconic poses on their own, but together, they can’t be beat! This acrylic diarama features three layers of Blossom City’s greatest heroes, and their iconic logo.
Wonderful Artbook
A soft cover art book that contains the artistic creation of the game from the team at Platiunum Games!
Abridged Digital Soundtrack
Jam out to The Wonderful 101 with a digital download of The Wonderful 101's Abridged Soundtrack, a selection of music tracks from the game's full soundtrack!
Abridged CD Soundtrack
Want to pump yourself up with some super jams? This is the physical edition of the Abridged soundtrack, perfect for your car stereo!
The FULL Soundtrack
Need even more music? This 5 disc CD set contains all the songs from The Wonderful 101: Remastered, plus a free digital download!
Vinyl Record
Get it on Wax! For the first time ever, we're offering a Platinum selection of songs from The Wonderful 101: Remastered on 12" vinyl!
Wonderful Keshi Figures
Individually they’re great, but together, they’re Wonderful! Each of these Wonderful One toys is ready to handle evil on its own, but together, they make for an adorable, multicolored army! No one will be able to stop them!
Custom Controllers
Want a little more flair in your gaming? These custom hand painted controllers are made one of a kind for you!
Artbook "Thank You"
Have your name honored in the art book! You'll get a credit for helping make the game possible!
Super Platinum Trophy
It’s a really special feeling when you complete a level in The Wonderful 101: Remastered with the highest score and receive that beautiful platinum trophy. Well, now you can bring that feeling to life with the limited edition physical platinum trophy, full size and ready to sit on your shelf.
Wonder-Mask
When fighting the forces of evil, it’s best to keep your identity secret, and there’s no better way to do it than with an authentic replica of the Wonder-Mask, painstakingly created to be worn!
Wonder-Red Jacket
If you’re going to save the world, you need to do it in style. That’s why we’re offering a limited number of leather jackets, styled after Wonderful 100’s illustrious team strategist, Will Wedgewood, better known as Wonder-Red.
Framed Button Display
An 18" x 24" framed display of all the badges from The Wonderful 101: Remastered! Perfect for the button or justice enthusiast!
12" Wonder-Red Figure
A custom made 12" figure of Wonder-Red! Let them stand vigilant over and always be on the lookout for evil! Mock-ups and more detailed info on this Wonderful reward will come in a future update!
PlatinumGames Studio Tour
Join The Wonderful 101: Remastered team for a full tour of the office, and experience the chance to be a director for a day. You're the head honcho now! What will you do with all that power?
NOTE: Transportation and hotel fees during time spent in Osaka are the responsibility of the rewardee.
*This tour may include parts that cannot be photographed and must be kept confidential.


The young leader of the Wonderful 100. Having just joined the Wonderful Ones after finishing a year of comprehensive training, Earth Defense War III is his first experience in combat.
Though technically still a rookie, he is extremely gifted, achieving a record score in both the written and field sections of the CENTINEL tactical examinations. Brimming with passion for justice, he takes a firm stance against those who threaten peace, but his by the books attitude and serious personality can occasionally rub people the wrong way. Sometimes Red's seriousness crosses the realm of reason, and those around him find getting through to him almost impossible. The opposite is rarer, though, as Red has an incredible memory, and never forgets something after being told.
His deep crimson CENTINEL-Suit boasts balance in all levels of performance, demonstrating diverse aptitude in any mission. The Vulcan Knuckles equipped to both his arms are capable of intense blows and machine-like accuracy, which can be even further increased in power via the "Unite Hand" Unite Morph technique.

A Wonderful One whose cover occupation is as a detective for the Los Angeles Police Department. Though young, he has gained experience and success in a variety of missions: taking down warring mafia families, counter-terrorism, and even taking part in military operations.
Having a strong sense of identity, and a stronger dislike for authority, Blue is not the easiest Wonderful One to deal with in the organization; however, his ability to act quickly and make decisions in the blink of an eye has led to a chain of successful missions. Yet, despite these successes, his hot-headed personality has makes Blue prone lose himself in anger, peppering his record with a significant number of failures.
Blue insists on making a scene for everyone to see, so in combat he acts arrogant, taunting the enemy, and is prone to posturing into different poses that might look "cool." Unfortunately, reactions to his antics are conspicuous in their absence.
Poor at teamwork and preferring to work alone, Blue does not actively try seek meaningful relationships with others. Instead, he accepts only those who are able to prove their skills, but this acceptance leads to a deep respect.
His weapon, the Valiantium Blade, is said to become sharper with every slice, forged with a special alloy able to cut through anything in the galaxy. His Unite Sword can deal lethal blows to even battleships.
Chose to be a Wonderful One due to his incredible skill with firearms and other ranged weapons, Wonder-Green is currently a mere middle school student. Yet, despite his youth, it is said that he can shoot through the hole of a donut a 100 kilometers away, while eating a donut himself.
Possibly due to his privileged upbringing, he often seems to feel like the world revolves around him and is prone to ignoring the reality of his surroundings. He also unwittingly rude, leading to occasional clashes with Blue and Pink; clashes Green himself seems unbothered by. In fact, at least with Pink, he almost seems to enjoy being scolded.
Even during the tensest of missions, he possesses a completely carefree nature; that is until something goes south, then he instantly breaks into panic. Far clumsier than most would ever suspect for a Wonderful One, the world prays that the care with which Green uses his rapid-fire proton gun Christine Daaé is another, more careful, side of him that holds great pride in his position. (Or so the world hopes...)
He has developed a close friendship with Black, as both are similar in age and love video games, comics, cartoons, and general mischief-making. This mischief-making extends to his love of junk food, a forbidden fruit under his parents, but a near constant indulgence as Green partakes in missions far beyond their strict reach.

Chosen to go to the Olympics in gymnastics while still in high school, Wonder-Pink is by far the most flexible and agile of any Wonderful One. She matches this with an advanced proficiency in melee weaponry, specifically with her Beautiful Whip, knit from a next-gen stay-press alloy "Belmont alloy," for which she is unrivaled.
Pink is known for her "laissez-faire" personality, behaving carefree and sunny during even the most severe missions, as if her duties were just another after school club; however, it is that relaxed attitude that, more often than not, spells disaster for the team. Exceedingly sensitive towards trends, she has decorated her issued weapon with a variety of accessories, and her tendency to prioritize fashion over the mission can occasionally give her superiors headaches. Nevertheless, Pink's excellent physical aptitude and peerless acrobatics have led the team to countless victories.
Extremely emotional, she sometimes reveals her terrifying true colors when angered. Pink is especially sensitive to anything said by Green, and she will gladly turn her tormentor into her whipping boy when set off.
Plus many many more heroes!
In The Wonderful 101: Remastered, you don’t just control a single superhero. You control a whole team, united to face off against the forces of evil. As you travel around the city, you’ll rescue civilians, who will then join your cause, bolstering your ranks.
The Wonderful Ones have more than just numbers on their side. To solve puzzles and smash evil, the Wonderful Ones can perform a “Unite Morph”, combining together to create fists, swords, bridges and other incredible constructs.
Together with Wonder Red, Wonder Blue, and the rest of the Wonderful Ones, it’s time to save Blossom City, and the rest of the world!
The most powerful tool for the Wonderful Ones is the incredible Unite Morph. By combining together, the Wonderful Ones can turn into a variety of awesome shapes, from whips to swords to giant fists.
In-game, players draw specific shapes on the battlefield with the control stick, and the Unite Morph initiates!
Unite Morphing isn’t just for combat, though! The Wonderful Ones can use their powers for traversal as well, whether it’s a faraway ladder or a precarious rope bridge, there’s nowhere The Wonderful 100 can’t reach!
Unite Hand
PLAY

The famous fist of justice used by Wonder Red, Unite Hand is the Wonderful Ones’ most basic Unite Morph. Used to pummel, smash and brutalize foes, the Unite Hand can also be used to rotate cogs and empty gacha monsters of their contents.
Unite Sword
PLAY

While not as strong as the Unite Hand, the Unite Sword has a longer reach, and is sharp enough to cut through chains. As an added bonus, the Unite Sword’s pristine broad side can also reflect lasers back at enemies.
Unite Gun
PLAY

While the Unite Gun isn’t one of the strongest Unite Morphs in the Wonderful Ones' arsenal, it really shines in long distance situations. The gun can hit both enemies and environmental objects, allowing the Wonderful Ones to defeat distant foes or solve otherwise inaccessible puzzles. 
Unite Whip
PLAY

The Unite Whip is a Unite Morph created from combining with a flexible, thorned whip. Not only can it attack enemies from afar, it can also tie them up, making it perfect for dealing with armored foes, spiked walls, and other prickly surfaces. It can also be used to latch onto certain surfaces to swing the whole team over gaps.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there are always risks during the development and porting process, we are confident that with our talented staff, we can deliver quality content on par with what you've come to expect from PlatinumGames, and in a timely fashion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Foreword
For over 35 years Kevin Adams has been producing original and high-quality miniature fantasy figures, building up an amazing following and reputation especially around goblins.
In recent times Kevin has helped friends and compatriots establish businesses all around the world using his reputation and design skills; however this has sometimes come at a price. This price is that Kevin has been commissioned to produce figures as described by others, as opposed to being totally creative in terms of originality. 
Goblinmaster Limited has been created to be dedicated to return Kevin’s creative modelling to the original ethos of high-quality products that have humorous and quirky elements, that are true to the fantasy gaming community. Kevin is a major shareholder of the new business and may eventually become Kevin’s sole vehicle for conceptualising, designing and delivering his artwork. Keep an eye out for the Goblinmaster copyright as this will now become Kevin’s unadulterated brand, where quality and originality can be safeguarded.
Over the coming year the wish is to produce 16 ranges/sets of products (most directly from the Goblinmaster website), all with the original, and somewhat ‘old school’ style; the very first model pack will be the Treadmill of Hubris, where Kevin has used his own ideas to produce a set-piece wagon, artifacts, characters, and narrative.  To achieve this we need initial support, both in terms of kick-start funding, plus a guide as to what ideas work and what doesn't.
This ‘kick-start’ is to bring Kevin’s imaginary world once again alive, and to launch his unique artwork for the fantasy world.  Kevin would like to set up a fully-fledged website (goblinmaster.online)  where his work can be seen and purchased without the need for 'kick-starts'.  He can then merrily take requests from supporters as to product lines and ideas, or he can work on his pet-projects and the beloved Goblin families and the situations they find themselves in, that have made his life such fun!
 Please note that the current range are created from scratch; no characters have been adapted from existing models (and no goblins were harmed in the process).
Treadmill of Hubris
As we all know, Dwarfs love their ale; and in this, they have a weakness, and often come a cropper.  The treadmill of hubris is a true demonstration of this.
The backdrop is that the goblins (in this case, Boglets, a small variant of goblin, that takes delight in trickery, cunning, and humiliation of their foe), having discovered a couple of Dwarfs drunk next to their barrel of ale, captures and enslaves them.  It is normal for Boglets to use the Dwarfs own barrel of beer as the cornerstone of their enslavement, and they do this with great mirth and delight in what the Boglets have coined, the Treadmill of Hubris.
It is a simple story; upon capture, the Dwarfs plead for their live, and seemingly being magnanimous the Boglets agree on the basis that they will commit to being slaves until their barrel of ale has become exhausted and the Dwarfs have fully sobered up.  The Boglets then use the barrel as the treadmill and lash the Dwarfs to a control bar to support them as they ‘tread’.
Unbeknownst to the Dwarfs, the Boglets urinate in the barrel to keep it topped up (apparently 5 Boglets can produce sufficient urine so as to perpetually feed the Dwarfs – there is some science behind this, but that is another story). The Boglets add some strange fungi to the brew and produce a slightly hallucinogenic and intoxicating liquid that fool the Dwarfs into believing it is their ale.
The Boglets have no intention of ever letting their foe go….. Over the following weeks and sometimes months, the Boglets pimp-up their Treadmill wagon, and in this case it has a grinder and smasher; the team of Boglets are using snappers to encourage the Dwarfs when moving at ‘battle-speed’, and some other Boglets use a dung-barrel to dump onto their foe in battle.
We don’t know what happens to the Dwarfs, they usually only last a couple of months; the Boglets either capture a new brace of Dwarfs, or dump the wagon.  Given the stature of the Dwarfs in this image, they are clearly new to the treadmill, cursing each other for not pulling their weight and for snoozing whilst drinking ale, thus causing their capture.  The Hubris bit is so the Boglets can have another laugh at the expense of the Dwarfs … Dutch courage an’ all.  Dwarfs are way-too-proud and over-confident to be left without a Boglet ribbing.
Treadmill Casting
Treadmill Front
Treadmill Back
Treadmill Side
Closer view of the Boglet crew (only 6 pieces shown)
The Treadmill of Hubris Boglet Crew is available to be pledged separately, however it is specifically designed to be used with the war wagon, and therefore does not have a base-insert. 
(Boglets have thin pegs so that there is freedom to drill holes anywhere in the base or roof thus allowing kustomisation of individual waggons and you could add that and soon we will have more Boglets that can be added or used as replacements for the Krew allowing for further individual kustomisation)
PAINTED PICTURES COMING SOON!
Baleful Boglet Bounders
Boglets usually group in squads of between 6 and 10 beings; lead by a peer who has the greatest reputation for combining spite and irony.  The ability to think up and create new demeaning treatment of their friends and foe alike determines the success of each squad. Boglets if anything, are adaptive and experimental, using whatever is at hand to be their weapon of choice.
In this set, they use a variety of 'tools' to exercise their malice and malevolence, some designed to incapacitate their foe, others designed to purely humiliate.  Boglets, their height usually no more than an adult man's leg, will use attacks that are either high-level, or play to their strengths at lower levels; snappers with Boglet lancers are part of the 'and' world, the lance targets the enemy's upper-torso, and the snapper targets the lower;  one bight can easily sever a leg from a man, however they are often trained to attack softer regions.  Snappers have powerful legs, and can be trained to jump, sometimes Boglets have been known to use them a bit like bouncing-sticks and bouncing balls, riding them with glee.
Word is that some Boglet Baddasses are being created later this year;  these are irksome creatures who care very little for any form of public decency and honour.  They are the most-ignoblest of life-forms, with their sole aim to humiliate others, and to be repulsive.  Kevin will rue the day these beggars were spawned on his workbench ....
All 8 Bounders
Wily Waggeries
A little known fact of wizards is that their pointed hats are very precious to them; besides their quarterstaff, a wizard's hat is considered what defines the person who wears it.  And boy, don’t the goblins all know this !!!  As part of inciting and goading wizards, Boglets will try, often to their demise, to target the wizards hat in an attack.  If they ever get hold of it, they will often urinate in the bearded-ones favourite clothing.  Wizards are not as liberal as one may believe, and will become incensed by this act and will often go berserk, killing the Boglets in an instance.  However the Boglets don’t really care, the humour and insult are well worth the consequence; their names often become legendary and part of Boglet folklore.
Don't get me started on what Boglets would do to a Wizard's Spell Book ...!!!
As for the wizard who has the misfortune of losing their hat, their peers sometime offer great support in dealing with the emotional upset, but their reputation can be irreparably tarnished. 
Pesky Boglets!
NEWSFLASH ....... NEWSFLASH .....  Kev has just given an update on the Wily Waggeries ....
The Boglets have majorly overlooked an important tool of the Wizard..... the Wizard Bertram Baptiste Bap has a very powerful wand tucked away up his sleeve. The wizard, partly out of anger, and partly out of exasperation, launches a spell using the wand ..... a spell incorrectly spoken as the spell book had been defiled, with a broken and emotional voice.  BANG !!!  The incantations were to direct the wand to turn these pesky goblins into fungus.  But no.  What was actually uttered by Baptiste turned these Boglets into a new and terrifying breed of goblin.  May the Great Goblin God forgive us ... for Baptiste has sinned ....
For those folk who pledged the £135 or more will be getting *** FREE OF CHARGE *** one of these new lines of Goblin as part of the package
Look out for these new creatures on the website after this Kickstarter !!!!
The Oddgoblin
This new model is 20mm tall, so fits in with the existing scale of the Boglets.  Wizards can be good creatures, but sometimes they can be foolish - these creatures will come to haunt and plague the other beings in the world .... what have you done, Baptiste !!!?

The Goblinmaster (limited edition)
Kevin designed a 'punk' goblin many years ago - purely for personal consumption, never manufactured or displayed anywhere other than amongst family.  As part of this kickstart release, Goblinmaster will create a limited edition EXCLUSIVELY for those who support this funding initiative (for example, if 200 people request a copy on KIckstarter, then only 200 will be produced).
But beware, The Goblinmaster is the Manneken Pis of the Goblin World !!
Will be available for pledges at £10 if the stretch goal is met!
The old punk goblin (Kev will make a new one)
The new Goblin Master

What else is included?
- Custom Packaging
- Guarantees for damaged goods
- Directly supporting the artist!

 DISCLAIMER : ALL MODELS WILL BE SOLD AS CAST METAL (zero lead)
NOTE:   POSTAL / DELIVERY CHARGES ARE NOT INCLUDED, WE WILL CONTACT YOU WITH COSTS DEPENDING ON THE WEIGHT OF YOUR ORDER AND WHAT COUNTRY YOU ARE IN.
                BASES NOT INCLUDED
£8000   - At least one limited edition character made available (maximum production run of the number who pledge as part of this initiative )
£10,000   - Launch Boglet Baddasses,  Hoboglets, and Space Orc sets by August 2020
£15,000   - A further 8 sets launched by December 2020
All Future Work will be Sold on : GoblinMaster.Online
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At this point in the development cycle, the key risks are that we are trying to use recyclable materials, low- or zero-lead metals, and other environmentally friendly approaches. This means that there are no plastics, and therefore many packaging techniques are new and fresh, especially for this market. We are employing a specialist packaging company to support us.
This is Goblinmaster's first kickstarter - we think we have most risks covered, but as the Goblin entrepreneur Slippery-Boar has a habit of saying, "I can only promise you as much troll dung as you can eat". We will make mistakes, but you and other backers shouldn't suffer as a consequence.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
With the success of our previous AUS30K Event Models, the Knight House Envoy and Engineer, we are continuing the tradition into 2020. This time however we have decided to change direction in the theme of the model itself and we will be creating a Privateer character; Gabrielle Kalothetos, the captain of a powerful interstellar ship exploring the fringes of Imperial space.
Like our 2019 model, Gabrielle will come in two poses, a standard release pose which will be available for general sale and an exclusive event variant which is intended to be used by Event Organisers as prize support or event swag. This is to try and maintain some exclusivity for the Event models but still give people an opportunity to buy a variant of the model if they don't think they will attend an event which will have it available. The model itself was designed by Nuclear Shrimp Studios and the artwork of Gabrielle was done by Simartian, Siman Vlaisavljević (https://www.artstation.com/simartian).
Privateer Gabrielle Kalothetos
Something new which we are introducing with this project is the inclusion of the exclusive Pledge Coins. In the past whenever planning our project we have always tried to find something to show our appreciation to the backers and thank them for supporting the projects at this stage, during the Kickstarter. This is something we hope will fill that niche for both this project and future ones. The Pledge Coins themselves are 40mm metal coins with the AUS30K logo on one side and a unique design on the reverse face representing the project they are linked to. Each backer who supports the project with a pledge that has a physical reward will receive a coin with their pledge when it arrives. The design for this project is the iconic Corinthian helm which Gabrielle own helmet is modeled off.
The Pledge Coin for the Privateer Gabriel Kalothetos 2020 Event Model Kickstarter
Like the previous event model project we have already completed the 3D design of the model itself and will be starting to create the masters for the mold making process. It is hopeful that we will get images of both the masters before the project completes to give you, the backer an opportunity to see a physical model, not just a render.
PLAY

General Sale version above
PLAY

Event Exclusive version above
INDIVIDUAL PLEDGES
The current range of models available to the Individual pledges are shown below and include;
Privateer Gabrielle Kalothetos (2020 Event model, general sale only)
Knight House Engineer (2019 Event model, general sale only)
Knight House Envoy (2018 Event model)
Maggot Men (all three variants available, each counts as one model)
Now unlocked and only available at this price as part of the Kickstarter!
Puppet Master 
Puppet Master Portal - Human Male 
Puppet Master Portal - Human Female
Puppet Master Portal - Marine
Any combination of these models may be selected in your pledge, but only pledges which contain a Privateer will qualify for a Pledge Coin.
Puppet Master (Unlocked via Stretch Goals)
Puppet Master Portal - Human Male WIP (Unlocked via Stretch Goals)


EVENT SUPPORT PLEDGES
Event Support pledges have access to all of the above models in addition to the Event Exclusive variant of the Privateer model, at least half of the models in an Event Support Pledge must be the Privateer. Only a single Pledge Coin is supplied.
The event exclusive version, only available through the Event Pledge
ADD ONS
To accompany this model all backer can also access products from our previous Unarmoured Marine project to add onto their pledges. 
Unarmoured Marines
These were the second models we produced and funded through Kickstarter in late 2017. They comprise of 5 uniquely posed models without powered armour, intended to represent prisoners of war stripped of their protection. They come in two sizes, regular and extra large, the latter is in line with the Primaris sized models.
            Individuals can add a set of these to their pledge for $44 for the regular size or $49 for the extra large (normally $49/$54 respectively).
            Event Organisers can add individual models (a minimum of ten) to their pledges for $7.50 each or $8 each for the extra large size. These pledges will contain an even (as much as possible) distribution of the five different poses.
STRETCH GOALS
In the event that the project funds over and above the goal we have some Stretch Goals planned;
UNLOCKED - Unit Reference Card
Each Privateer model (Individual and Event pledges), will be accompanied by a unit reference card containing the Gabrielle's custom rules and statistics.
UNLOCKED $2,000 - Floating Puppet Master Model
This model will be made available as an add ons for all pledges and will also include a unit reference card. For the Kickstarter only this model, if unlocked, will be the same price as a regular infantry model!! $15 (or $13 if you are an early bird) to add or simply counts as a single model in a multi model pledge!
UNLOCKED $3,000 - Puppet Master Portal (Human Male) Model 
UNLOCKED $3,500 - Puppet Master Portal (Human Female) Model 
UNLOCKED $4,000 - Puppet Master Portal (Marine) Model 
All three of these models will be made available as an add ons for all pledges and will also include a unit reference card. For the Kickstarter only this model, will be the same price as a regular infantry model!! $15 (or $13 if you are an early bird) to add or simply counts as a single model in a multi model pledge!
 $5,000 Puppet Master Portal Upgrade LOCKED
The Pupper Master Portal will be upgraded with the option to attach an emerging Puppet Master.
$6000 LOCKED TBC

Pickup @ Adepticon 2020!
For Backers who will be attending Adepticon 2020, we will be there and can offer an option to pickup your pledges from our Trade stand. More details on that will be provided closer to the date of the event.
Postage
Like many projects before us we have been stung by the price rises of international postage. Because of this we have had to move the shipping cost component to the pledge manager stage shortly before fulfillment. Currently the costs post to international destinations are listed below, with luck this will not change between now and the fulfillment stage. These prices are based on bulk mail out orders, if individuals need their pledge sent separately, the cost may be higher then what is listed here.

            New Zealand 
            Up to 500g: $15  (around two dozen models)
North America, Western Europe, Asia and the Pacific
            Up to 250g: $15  (around a dozen models)
            Up to 500g: $20  (around two dozen models)
Rest of the world
            Up to 250g: $15 (around a dozen models)
            Up to 500g: $25 (around two dozen models)

            *: unless requested, we will attempt to pack as many models into blisters as possible. If you request a 1:1 ratio of model per blister, this may result in a higher shipping cost.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our fifth project creating a model along with the trials and tribulations of production and distribution. We have worked closely with both 3rd parties involved in this particular project and are confident that we have ironed out any teething problems from the previous experiences.
The model itself has been fully designed already and as the project goes live the master has been printed and is in preparation for the mold creation. This will significantly speed up the production time, although it did require a lot more up front investment.
The major hiccup which we encountered on the last Kickstarter project was the international distribution. This came about from relying on a courier who had assured us that they would have rolled out international pickup to our location in time for our fulfillment. This did not happen and so were forced to instead ship the individual parcels in a single bulk lot to a secondary pickup location from where they were then dispatched. This caused some delays in the 2nd and 3rd wave for international backers.
We have taken steps to prevent this from occurring again with alternative courier contracts and other methods for distribution.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Ok, so first packing bottleneck update. 
I have packed all pledges up to pledge number #81 plus all of the Early Bird pledges. At this stage I have now run out of parts for the Emerging Enslaver which was a bonus add on for the Enslaver Portals.
IF you have a pledge higher then #81 and is NOT an Early Bird pledge AND it includes one or more Enslaver Portals, I cannot currently pack you order UNLESS you contact me and let me know that you do not want the bonus emerging Enslaver.

Hey everyone, 
Just wanted to touch base with you all and let you know that the next in the series of annual AUS30K model has launched for 2021, this time around it is an Enforcer. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/aus30k/28m-sci-fi-enforcement-officer-aus30k-2021-event-model
Like last years project for Gabrielle Kalothetos which you all helped bring to the tabletop, the Enforcer will have two poses, one for general sale and one reserved for event. This year, however, we have not created a third pose and instead invested the stretch goals into alternative arms to be included in the general pose. Currently all of these have already been unlocked and we are well on our way to unlocking an Enforcer mounted on a Bike.

Hi all,
Apart from 6 pledges who have requested combined shipping and 4 backers who havent completed their survey/paid their invoices, all pledges have now been posted. This has certainly been the longest fulfillment in our projects and for that I apologise, it has certainly been a trying year but steps have been taken to try and mitigate the production and dispatch times for future projects because of it.

The anticipated parcel containing the replacement models has arrived. I have just unpacked it and they look in excellent condition. Over the coming weekend and early next week I will pack the last of the outstanding pledges and marry then up to any combined pledges from the most recent Terminator armour kickstarter and put them aside. The rest will get grouped up and posted as quickly as possible.
My apologies for the extended delays with this project, and thank you for your continued understanding, its been a tough year for everyone but hopefully things are starting to smooth out a little.

Just touching base that the first of the International pledges from Wave 1 should be starting to arrive in the coming week or two. There is a pretty wide expected delivery window which is understandable considering the state of things atm. However overall they normally get through without much a problem. 
I can confirm that the replacement models for Wave 2 are now in transit to me and, if they follow the pattern from last time, should arrive in a couple of weeks. For those of you in Wave 2 who are also pledging in the most recent project for Savage Pattern armour sets, I can combine postage if you want me to as most of the models should be arriving around the same time. If this is something you would like to do just get in touch with me and I will mark it on your entry in the fulfillment spreadsheet I use.

Just a very quick notice to those international backers in the first wave, the parcels have just been picked up by the courier and will begin their journey to you from Australia. Most of the anticipated delivery dates are ranging from 19th of August to 7th of September, as always these will be quite fluid based on the isolation restrictions in the respective countries at the time the parcels hit their shores.
Cheers

Hi all,
I'm quit a bit relieved to let you know that the replacement models from the damage/lost shipment are nearly completed by the caster and will be shipped to me in the very near future. As soon as they arrive I will take some time off my regular work and get the last of the pledges packaged up and ready for distribution.
The international portion of the first large wave is just waiting for the international courier to pickup and begin distribution of those. It was supposed to happen Monday, however Melbourne is in the midst of a large scale lock down at the moment and courier pickups are getting impacted city wide. As soon as they are picked up from the distribution point I will let you know.

well after the excitement of getting the first shipment and commencing packing i was doubly excited to get a delivery notification of the second package with the rest of the models to complete fulfilment.... until i got home to see the package.

Hi all,
Packing is progressing, I anticipate that I should have as many pledges packed as I have models to fulfill them with by the end of the week. I will let you all know what pledge number I got up to before I ran out of the first shipment, second one is already on its way but again, it could take a month or more to get through postage I'm afraid.
As a bit of compensation for the extended delay, I will be including a free booster pack of the AUS30K collector cards in each pledge. These are packs of 12 random cards from a collection of 100 which feature fan art of the Warhammer 30K/40K universe. The artwork is shown on the front of the card along with a short bio on the reverse along with the artists credit and their website for you to check out more of their work.

Well finally some good news! This weekend I will be going through and sorting the models into packing clusters and trying to get ready for the shipping of everyone's goodies. I would anticipate that I am still at least a week or two away from getting the first lot into the post, but once that happens it will be a relatively straight forward process.
For Australian domestic backers, your parcels will be sent directly to you from Canberra.
For international backers, your parcels will be sent via a bulk courier run, which is how we were able to keep the postage costs low. They will be packaged up and then sent to the dispatch point where the onforwarding courier will collect and begin distribution. Normally this process takes between 7-10 days.

campaign.story:
OUR KICKSTARTER IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN EVER!!!
PLAY

Due to COPPA regulations and the FTC we may be demonetized by 2020.  We are not for kids but feature music, animation, and are incredibly  colorful. We do not know where this leaves us in this matter. Please educate yourself with the links below! As well as support our  Kickstarter to ensure we can  create more content!!! Also make sure to  follow us on facebook and instagram to get notifications.
Please sign the petition and stand with youtube creators: https://www.change.org/p/youtubers-an...
Here are relevant articles videos and links:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pd604...
https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/13/2...
https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/how-to-...
Studio Killers is an internet phenomenon of vibrant animation and music amassing over a 120M views on YouTube! This secretive audio visual group is comprised of 4 individuals (1 visual artist and 3 musicians). But to the general public they are known as the virtual characters that represent them: femme boss and front woman Cherry, keytarist Goldie Foxx and DJ Dyna Mink.
Join us on this adventure by following us on: YOUTUBE, INSTAGRAM, FACEBOOK, TUMBLR!
Not attached to any major label or conglomerate to date, Studio Killers is made through the hard work and dedication of the 4 people behind the band. The crew all have side gigs to make ends meet. The main visual artist creates the majority of all the visual work by herself, scaling up with a small crew for music videos and bigger events like this Kickstarter! Studio Killers has been a passion project fuelled by love, family, friends and fans.
This animated Studio Killers 404 pilot/special will be a parody on the classic magical girl trope. Kind of a crossbreed between Sailor Moon and Rick and Morty. It will feature a brand new song and a full soundtrack!
Introducing new characters for you to love!
Thrown into cyberspace and left fending for their very existence, Cherry and the Studio Killers are building an army of LGBTQ+ positive, misfits and outliers, on a quest to overthrow the Evil Algorithm, a deep state like organization that is destroying the internet and erasing all it’s weird wonders. Style battles, a war between cats and porn, a whole planet dedicated to taco memes - there's so much to explore and save! Cherry’s using her unique power of style to bring the ‘love’ back! 
Cherry and the Studio Killers' big dream is to create an animated series to push this project to the next level and to deliver the kind of amazing jaw dropping content they’re known for, but with much healthier business structure! Getting an animated series signed with a Network or VOD would drive all our other content, ensuring the project's future! There has been a lot of interest from partners and networks, but ultimately development, pitching, and negotiations often take several years with the additional added 1.5-3 years of production before the fans get to see anything at all, if ever. We’d really prefer not to keep you in the dark THAT long.
With this Kickstarter we can share with you the process and the journey of creating an amazing animated special that doubles as a pilot for the series! With you the backers getting to see it as soon as it’s done regardless of future deals in the making. While at the same time being able to create some amazing rewards for you to get your hands on! 
Visually stunning animated mayhem!
You can help by backing this campaign which you will be rewarded for with amazing swag! If you can't back this Kickstarter for whatever reason, you can still help by sharing this project with friends and family far and wide. Share it with anyone you think would love seeing a crazy action comedy magical girl concept with stunning art and great music! 
The Writers for the Pilot
For the special Cherry will be working with Alison Norrington of storycentral.com, a storyteller who has worked across theme parks, film, television, crowdfunding and gaming. She will make sure that the Studio Killers 404 special and series concept is as uncompromising and fearless as Cherry herself.
The Writers for the series
For the series we’re putting together a kick-ass team of diverse and inclusive talent handpicked throughout the industry to represent all the values that Studio Killers is founded on while being the kind of funny crazy super nerds with the experience of pulling off a hit series. We aim to walk the walk.
The Animation
Cherry (the visual artist) has a long history of running and building productions. With her knowledge, skills and contacts she has the tools to build an ace team to produce the special. We believe in creator driven properties and that is what this will be, with the reigns securely in the hands of the creator herself. We have many ties to production companies and talent, so we're ready to scale as needed!
Majority of the money will be used for animation production. In fact our current goal is quite tight! So we plan to put in lots of our own resources and time to make this happen. Which is how we Studio Killers get things done.

NEW STRETCH GOAL 220,000£!!! 
AMAZING! THIS IS GONNA BE HUGE! We reached our goal in under 48 hours!!! Our new goal is to double the fun! By doubling the length of the pilot from our planned 11 minutes to a robust 22 minutes! So we can really get into the story! As a new reward we're also offering the story of Episode 2 as an additional comic book! 😃
AND SHOULD WE SURPASS THAT and reach 300,000£ we'll make 3 X 11 min episode MINI SERIES! 💥Having a brand new song for each episode!💥 Spread the word far and wide if you want EVEN more Studio Killers content! 

Each time we hit a new goal, because of your awesome contributions, we'll share our new crowdfunding  goal with you here! This will unlock all new amazing rewards, while we celebrate the occasion on our social media with art and more! So remember to follow us! YOUTUBE, INSTAGRAM, FACEBOOK, TUMBLR!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Animation takes a long time to produce, and this goal will get us most of the way for the pilot but we will still need to put in our own time and money to complete the project. With our current goal we aim to have the pilot done by the end of summer 2020. Some time will also go to the development process, which we call 'baking' the project. Once we get into the series, episodes take less time to produce.

Delivery of most rewards is set for august 2020. In the case of signed items, the reward delivery is set for December 2020. We need this time to make sure all the products meet our standards of quality and to create the pilot which is part of every reward tier! 

Even if we make and deliver the pilot, there is no guarantee that we will land a deal for an animated series. This unfortunately is just a fact. We will be going to every network, event, and person we know in the industry and putting it down before them in the hopes of getting this baby off the ground! Should for some reason, luck not be in our favor, we will let everyone know what our next steps will be.

Whatever happens you will definitely see what we ever have made with the money, even if that should be an unfinished pilot!

Thank you for your support and understanding!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you as ever for your patience. You're probably bored of hearing me say we're well under way with production, but we are! The majority of rewards have arrived into our top secret depot, so I am spending this week making sure all addresses are up-to-date. Assuming we can find a willing pony/pigeon to start delivering your wares, they will be on their way very soon.

In other news, the pilot itself is at a very serious stage of production. We have chosen voice actors for their roles (recording in the next couple of weeks), appointed a 2nd animation studio to help with the colouring and found a World-class composer who is assisting us with the score. So all in all, you won't have to wait much longer and your pledge is making this possible. Yours, as ever, Goldie Foxx & the rest of the gang

Well, we're in the final stages of reward procurement and manufacture! With this in mind, we're going to set a cutoff date for address changes as the 28th February. Please send any address changes to rewards@studiokillers.com before this date. Mailouts of rewards will be starting in March.
Also, if you pledged for a reward where your name is being featured or we are recording your voice and have yet to hear from us, please also email us at rewards@studiokillers.com to make sure we have your details right!
Yours, as ever, Studio Killers

Best (2021) wishes from Cherry, Dyna Mink and Goldie Foxx
We wanted to let you know that we are getting into serious production of rewards now and will be able to give you a timeline next week of when the rewards are actually going to be delivered! In the meantime, we'll be asking for some extra details if you have pledged for a reward where we require more information.

updates.update_userinfo: We've Been Super Busy Working on the Pilot!
updates.update_content:
IMPORTANT: We are closing in on the last date to complete the Kickstarter survey, Friday 1st of May! Redeem your rewards on CrowdOx by clicking on this link. Once it's 1st of May, we will lock the survey and orders to start the fulfillment. Estimated times for the fulfillment can be found for each item on Crowdox. Be sure to complete the survey on CrowdOx beforehand so you can receive your rewards!
Thank you for your support on our Kickstarter! So much has happened since we ran our campaign. The pilot script has been written, the storyboard is done and ready, and we’ve pulled it all together in an animatic. We are now in full production mode!

Goldie Foxx: Just a quick update on what has been a torturously-long wait for the surveys to be sent out. Thank you for your patience! We are literally waiting for one single ID verification to be accepted and then we will send out the surveys. We were actually ready last week, but without this ID, we can't go live. It is amazing how hard it is to find a utility bill, dated within 6 months, with all the right info on it. Not very rock'n'roll, but I thought you deserved a factual explanation of the hold-up! Nearly there.

Hello - we're back from a little knees-up over the festive period and thought it was high time for an update.
We have teamed up with the kind people over at CrowdOx to send you an extremely simple survey in order to collect the info we need to fulfil your rewards. You should expect to receive the invitation within the next week or so. The entire process should only take a couple of minutes to complete.

The invitation will be sent directly to the email address linked to your Kickstarter account. Be sure to check your spam folder in case it was captured there!

It is important to submit the completed survey as quickly as possible in order for us to commence fulfilment.


CrowdOx gives you the opportunity to verify your reward, make your selections (i.e. choose a color, size, etc.) as well as verify and validate your shipping address. On top of all that, you can also upgrade your pledge level or add additional items to your existing pledge!

You do not need to make a login and password in order to access your survey as you will receive an email with a unique link. If you want to go back to review your info, simply click on the link in your email again.
PLAY

updates.update_userinfo: Our Kickstarter is more important than ever!!!

campaign.story:
We love miniatures. We love tabletop games. We love anthropomorphic animals, from Disney's Robin Hood through The Wind in the Willows to Brian Jaques' Redwall books. So we combined the things we love in our Burrows & Badgers tabletop skirmish game and the accompanying range of miniatures. And our Kickstarter backers have already helped us to grow the range to over 100 miniatures - but now it's time to add some more!
Some miniatures from previous projects...

Why are we making more miniatures?
Because we want more characters for our Burrows & Badgers games – my Freebeast warband needs reinforcements, for a start! 
And we know a lot of other people are looking for more anthropomorphic animal miniatures too. A lot of people are playing Burrows & Badgers now, and many of them have asked for Massive Hounds and a Massive Raptor, so we've sculpted them! Some will want to use them for other tabletop or roleplaying games, while others love painting miniatures, and our figures are perfect for that, full of character ready to be brought to life with your paintbrush....
And some people just love collecting miniatures; again, we've made this new set of Burrows & Badgers figures perfect for collectors. They are all single piece models, with integral bases, so there are no fiddly parts to be glued on.
We love making miniatures; we hope you'll love our miniatures too.
Why we need your help...
We've got 17 new miniatures sculpted, but they need to have moulds made before we can start producing the miniatures. And that's why we need funding; to get the production moulds made, and get the casting process started.
About the miniatures...
There are other ranges of anthropomorphic animal miniatures out there, but ours are a little different. We didn't want all the races of animals to be the same size. Instead, we've scaled them to each other; so a shrew or a mouse is a very small model, about 20mm tall, and a really big animal like a badger will stand about 50mm tall, for example.
Each sculpted figure shown below has a scale picture with it, showing its height in millimetres. All our models are supplied unpainted.

If you'd like to learn more about the Burrows & Badgers range and the game, here's a link to the Burrows & Badgers website and to the Facebook Group (which is the friendliest Group on FB, I reckon!):

The Pledges
We’re keeping it as simple as possible; there’s an ‘All-in’ pledge, which gets you all the new miniatures in this Kickstarter, and any bonus bits that may come along… there’s also a ‘Pick’n’Mix’ Pledge, if you just want to get a few of the new miniatures. For the Pick'n'Mix, just total up the prices of all the miniatures you want, and pledge for that amount. There's a minimum pledge of £10. 










Pictures of the miniature sculpts
Below you can see pictures of each of the miniatures, and there's a scale image at the bottom right of each picture to show the height of the model in millimetres. There's also a price at the bottom of each picture, for the Pick'n'Mix pledge, or to add extra models to an ‘All-In’ pledge, if you wanted to. 

Price £6.50 for Pick'n'Mix pledges
Price £7 for Pick'n'Mix pledges
Price £5 for Pick'n'Mix pledges
Price £4.50 for Pick'n'Mix pledges

Price £5.50 for Pick'n'Mix pledges
Painted examples
The miniatures are supplied unpainted, but we've painted a few to show off possible colour schemes...



Shipping
Shipping costs are included in the pledge costs, wherever you are in the world; though bear in mind you are responsible for any Customs charges or import duties applied by your country.
See the Frequently Asked Questions below for more information on this Project.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risks are getting the miniatures safely moulded, and then producing enough casts to satisfy demand. Thankfully both these problems come down to the skill and experience of the sculptor and the mouldmaker. And we've been doing this for a long time now, with 14 projects all fully completed, and delivered on time. In short, we're not expecting any problems, but if we have some, we'll keep you informed, and we'll deal with them professionally.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hey everyone!

Hey everyone,
Time for another quick Update... so; all the United States pledges are now in the mail (except Backer #251, as we're still waiting to hear back from him.) The last five bags went off today, along with the Norway and Switzerland pledges.

Hey everyone, hope you're all well. I thought I'd post an Update to let you all know how we are getting on with fulfillment of this Project. We're still getting a lot of messages and emails from people asking when their pledge will be sent... I'd like to point out again, that this Project is not even due to start shipping until March! We're ahead of schedule. So, please be patient - we'll get your stuff to you as fast as we can!
Here's Jo, hard at work, having packed another three bags full...

Hey everyone,
It seems our plan to make an early start on fulfillment with the EU has caused it bit of confusion, so we thought it would be best to do an Update to explain things...
So - although this Project isn't actually estimated to begin delivery until March, we always try and be ahead of the estimate whenever possible. And we were concerned about Brexit; we didn't want our EU Backers to run into possible Customs problems because of shipping after the January 31st deadline the UK government has set.

updates.update_userinfo: Most of the EU pledges are in the mail...
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone, hope you're all well and 2020's being kind to you!
As you know, we got the first batch of miniatures from the caster a couple of weeks ago, and got them sorted, with the aim of fulfilling the European Union pledges before the end of January, and the massive uncertainty that is Brexit. So that's what we've been getting on with this week...
On Monday, we had several deliveries arrive, bringing us all the packing supplies we'd need for the project; and there's a lot of them! Jiffy bags, plastic boxes, bubble wrap, packing peanuts and more besides... now we really need to get on with fulfillment, just to clear some space in the workshop!

Hey everyone!
I hope you all had a good time over the holiday season! As we're now in the new year, I thought it was time to update you on the project's progress...
Generally, we try and get all the miniatures cast and sorted, and then take a break from all our other work, and do packing and shipping over a non-stop week or two, starting with Australia, New Zealand and Canada, (which take the longest to arrive) and working on through the rest, finishing with the UK (which arrive fastest.)  That usually works pretty well for us.

Hey everyone, hope you're all well.
The productions moulds for all the metal miniatures are now done - here's a quick pic of one of them:

updates.update_userinfo: A quick Update just to keep you all in the loop...
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
Well, it's been two weeks since the Kickstarter finished, and we've had our notification that they'll be sending the funds to our bank sometime this week. Which is good, as it means we can start getting all the things we'll need to fulfill the project!
Although it's early days yet, things are still progressing behind the scenes... our metal caster has been busy making production moulds, and 13 of the 17 are now complete, with the last 4 expected to be finished this week. We did have a bit of a scare, though - Chris the mouldmaker has his workshop at the bottom of his garden, and last week the floods the UK has been suffering got a bit too close for comfort! You can see Chris's workshop on the bottom right...

updates.update_userinfo: ...and we're done! Thank you all so much!

campaign.story:
- Now Featuring Jim'll Paint It - Scroll down for more information!
For this Kickstarter, we're hoping to fund the Say What You See: Ultimate Edition app for Apple iOS and Android devices. It's a brand new version of Say What You See, the the greatest Catchphrase-style rebus puzzle game ever (Don't just take our word for it - Harry Potter star Tom Felton loves it too!).
- Tom Felton (Draco Malfoy, The Harry Potter Series)
We've got some amazing offers for you during this Kickstarter too, including:
 Great deals on Puzzle Pass annual subscriptions (which give you access to over 50 canvases at launch, at least 25 more in the first year, and tons of other benefits)
 Signed copies of the new Jim'll Paint It Book 'Of Mouse and Man' 
 Jim'll Paint It signed Say What You See canvas prints 
The chance to appear in a future SWYS painting done by Jim'll Paint It 
 And lots more! 
A sample puzzle from our game - it's "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows"!
Launched by Big Ideas Digital almost 10 years ago, 'Say What You See: The Collection' was a mobile puzzle app like no other. Based on a concept by Big Ideas Digital owner David Stevens, it presented players with large themed canvas paintings, each with 50 rebus picture puzzles hidden inside for players to find and solve. It‘s also known as SWYS*.
If you've ever seen the TV show Catchphrase, or seen the puzzles under the bottle caps of Lone Star beers, you'll know how a rebus puzzle works - just look at the puzzle and Say What You See!
Here's a small sample of the US TV Shows canvas to give you the idea:   
Those puzzles explained: Buffy The Vampire Slayer - It's a buff 'E' slaying a Vampire! Charlie's Angels - It's Charlie Chaplin surrounded by angels! Knight Rider - He's riding a knight!
You can click here to play trial versions of some of the canvases at our website - give it a go, and you'll quickly see how much fun it is! 
An instant success on launch in 2010, Say What You See: The Collection was a #1 app, and had over 2.5m downloads. It was also among the top 30 most popular apps of 2011. Over the next four years, Say What You See released over 50 canvases, and several spin-off apps, including a popular official tie-in version with the BBC to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Doctor Who. Click here to try it! We did an interview about it with Pocket Gamer, which you can read here. The Doctor Who canvases will be available in this new app too!
- The Doctor Who version featured over 150 Doctor Who-inspired puzzles!
Sadly, all good things eventually come to an end, and in 2014 the app was discontinued when its parent company was sold on.
But the story doesn't have to end there. Cybernet Apps (a new company made up of ex-Big Ideas Digital staff) have licensed the game's IP, and are all ready to create a brand new Say What You See app - "Say What You See: Ultimate Edition".
We just need your help to make it happen.   
We want "Say What You See: Ultimate Edition" to be just that. It will contain the 50 original canvases produced for the various Say What You See apps, as well as new canvases every month. 
We're bringing back all the classic Say What You See artists like Army of Trolls (Arcade Classics, Console Classics), Ryan Firchau (Fantasy Movies, Doctor Who) and Martin Davey (Christmas Movies, Grace's Toons). We're also very excited to announce our Exclusive Backer's Canvas artist...
Yes, our Exclusive Backer's Canvas will be created by internet sensation Jim'll Paint It! All Reward tiers from £5 and up include Jim's Exclusive Backer's Canvas in the game. 
"Ask me to paint anything you wish and I will try no matter how specific or surreal your demands. You name it. I’ll paint it. On Paint.”
Since making this promise, back in 2013, Jim has painted some 400 requests - covering everything from Thom Yorke the Tank Engine and Dad’s Army of Darkness to Mick Jagger disappointing customers at the paint mixing station in B&Q by matching every colour as black - each brought to life with painstaking detail using nothing but an archaic version of Microsoft Paint and an optical mouse. 
- Just a few of the brilliant images that have spewed from Jim's mind.
We're really excited to have Jim come on board to do his first Say What You See canvas, and we've got some great new backer deals that will let you get a signed copy of his brand new book 'Of Mouse and Man' (unbound Publishing, RRP £25) or even a signed print of his upcoming canvas!
At Say What You See, we pride ourselves on finding the very best artistic talent around. Check out some of the 50 Canvases we've already produced:
Arcade Classics Canvas - by Army of Trolls
Fantasy Movies Canvas - by Ryan Firchau
Kids Cartoons - by Martin Davey
Rock Bands - By Aileen Raistrick
Here's the full list of already produced canvases. The 50 canvases below are all completed already. All 50 will be unlocked and ready to play at launch with any subscription. On top of all these, we'll be producing new canvases every month, just as we did before.
The 50 original SWYS canvases.
Say What You See is suitable for gamers of any age, gender or dexterity. Playing it is as easy as 1, 2, 3!
1. Search for a potential puzzle, based on the canvas theme. Don't be shy to get a closer look too - use finger pinches and stretches to zoom in and out, and swipes to scroll around the image!
2. Tap the puzzle and type in your guess... 
3. Repeat until you solve all 50 puzzles and the canvas!  
While the initial app download and starter canvas is free, additional canvas downloads can either be cherry picked individually with one-off in-app purchases, or you can unlock all the current and future canvases at once by purchasing a Puzzle Pass Subscription! 
Here's how the subscriptions stack up!
Subscribing offers the ultimate Say What You See experience. No ads, early access to canvases, free hint coins every month, and a store discount for purchasing Say What You See merch!  
Buying a 1, 2, or 3 year Gold Puzzle Pass subscription will give you access to 50 canvases at launch, plus all additional canvases released over the duration of your sub. That's 2500 individual Say What You See puzzles at launch!
This Kickstarter is a great time to purchase a Gold Puzzle Pass Subscription, as we're offering massive discounts of up to 50% off if you're quick enough to grab an early bird package. 
And if you're already a big SWYS fan, you can even purchase a lifetime Platinum Puzzle Pass Subscription which will last for the entire length of the app's life. You'll never have to buy another canvas again! Plus you'll get access to Demo builds as we develop the app, meaning you'll be playing Say What You See again before anyone else!
Plus, in addition to all the Gold Puzzle Pass benefits, you'll get EXTRA bonus canvases that are only available to Platinum Pass Subscribers! It gets better too - we're offering a whopping 60% off for this Kickstarter only - that's better than half price!
These discount rates will never be available again, so there really is no better time to subscribe.   
We do appreciate that some people simply don't like subscriptions, so there's also the Gold Digger tier, where you can purchase 25 canvas unlocks of your choice upon the app's release. 
App Will Be Available On Android and Apple Devices
Say What You See: Ultimate Edition is currently aimed at most mobile and tablet devices - but we're not ruling other platforms in the future! Currently we're targeting:
iPhone and iPad (iOS 12.0+)
Android phones and Android tablets (Android OS 8.0+)
We're aware that a lot of SWYS fans purchased canvases on the original app, and while we don't have access to the old App Store and Google Play accounts, and can't restore purchases, we don't want our oldest fans to feel ignored. So for this Kickstarter period, we'll be running the Canvas Exchange Program. 
If you back our Kickstarter at the Early Bird Gold Puzzle Pass tier or above, you'll have the option to exchange all your old paid canvases* for the equivalent amount of canvas unlocks in the new app. You can either spend them on the same canvases, or brand new ones! These canvases will be yours to keep whether or not you stay subscribed to the app. 
*NB. Proof of purchase, which can be found in your Google/iTunes accounts will be required.  We will show you how to find and send this information to us once the Kickstarter has completed. 
If you check out the rewards section, you'll see we've got some amazing backer rewards available, including:
A once in a lifetime chance to own a beautiful gallery-quality giclee print of Jim'll Paint It's Backer's Canvas
Signed copies of Jim's brand new book "Of Mouse and Man"
- Signed copies of Jim's brand new book 'Of Mouse and Man' are available in the rewards!
The chance to have your face painted into the canvas by Jim, preserved in the app for all time! And hey, if you're not a fan of putting yourself in the picture, think what an amazing birthday, wedding or anniversary gift it would make for a loved one!
And of course, almost all backers* will get access to the Jim'll Paint It exclusive backer's canvas, as a thank you for your support.

Need a handy guide to see which rewards you get at each tier? We've got you covered, with this handy matrix diagram that we spent many hours making. 
*£1 tier excepted. 
Rewards Matrix
So the Say What You See project is awesome, right? Well what if we told you we could make it even more awesome by telling other people about it? 
As you tick off backer achievements by helping us spread the word about this Kickstarter campaign on social media, you'll unlock some awesome backer rewards! 
These rewards will change the Kickstarter for everyone, from unlocking  free hint coins to getting awesome physical rewards. Get all 36 achievements and you’ll earn a new free canvas for every single backer! We'll be revealing more achievements as each target is hit. 
The links for the content you need to promote can be found below the picture. 
Backer achievements and rewards
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/swysapp 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/SWYSApp 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/swys_puzzle_app 
David Stevens - SWYS Creator
David Stevens is the owner of Big Ideas Digital, and the creator of the Say What You See franchise. 
Formally VP at 20th Century Fox, David has built and run several companies in the technology and media space. He also makes a pretty mean cup of tea.  
Jon Hamblin - SWYS Designer, puzzle writer and pun-master.
Jon Hamblin was the designer of Say What You See: The Collection, and also the author of most of the original canvas puzzles. He also ran the social media channels, customer support and tea making for Big Ideas Digital. 
Since then, he's gone on to produce several award-winning games, and most recently worked on Fall Guys: Ultimate Knockout for Devolver Digital and Mediatonic.
He'll be running this Kickstarter campaign, designing Say What You See: Ultimate Edition, writing all the puzzles and probably doing all the washing up. Again. 
Carleton Handley - Programmer extraordinaire
Carleton Handley has been programming since the 8-bit era, notoriously coding the original Spitting Image game for Domark on the Commodore 64. 
Carleton was the programmer on Say What You See: The Collection, and he's keen to get started on bringing this classic series back to life. 
If you're good enough to back this project, it's only fair to tell you how we're going to spend the money. 
We've asked for the absolute bare minimum to make this project, and it breaks down into three sections - app development, UI (Essentially the menus, animations and whizzy graphics) and content, which is the canvases themselves. 
Budget Breakdown: App Development - 50%, UI/UX - 30%, Content, 20%
If we are lucky enough to get more than our goal, we'll be spending the extra money on more content for the app and marketing. So the more you fund the app, the more canvases and content you'll get! 
Finally, you might wonder why we're bringing this project to Kickstarter. 
It's pretty simple really. Ever since we made the original Say What You See app, we've been passionate fans ourselves. It was heartbreaking for us when the app's first run ended, and behind the scenes we've been working tirelessly ever since to bring it back.
Now the planets have aligned, and we have the Say What You See license back, we're keen to start making it as soon as possible - so rather than spending months looking for independent funding, we decided to Kickstart the development by bringing it to the SWYS fans first. 
One of the biggest reasons the app died originally is that Say What You See is not a cheap game to make. We pride ourselves on only using the best artists from around the world and keeping the quality bar extremely high. The money raised by this Kickstarter will go towards new canvases, development costs and a fresh new look for the app. We're only asking for the barest minimum to make the project, and any extra money we make will go on more content. 
That's why we're asking you, the fans, to help. Simply put, if the Kickstarter doesn't work, the app just won't get made. 
Given how much joy this app has brought to people over the years, we think that'd be a shame. So let's all work together to bring Say What You See  back - and hopefully add a few extra smiles to the world in the process. 
Say What You See has had lots of press - here's where you might have seen us!
*Oh and finally, sorry to any confused rugby fans who‘ve been directed here by Google - it stands for Say What You See and not Swys de Bruin, the Isuzu Southern Kings rugby coach 😉
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're a small team, and sometimes there are unforeseen bumps in the road. Games get delayed sometimes, and it would be impossible for us to promise you this one won't be.

That said, we've made Say What You See in several flavours before, and we're confident that we've set a timetable and budget that we can stick to. We've spent months trying to get this one right because we believe in the game (and really, really want to play it again!) We’re certain the game will be made, and that you’ll get all the rewards you’ve backed for.

It's important to note that this is not some corporation buying an old license and trying to wring some cash out of it - this is a passion project from the people who started Say What You See. We're hoping that there’s enough fans out there to help bring this app back through crowdfunding. 

We want to create the Ultimate Edition of Say What You See, and with your help, we think we can do it.

We know Say What You See is special to many of you - It’s certainly very special to us. Let’s all work together to bring this app back, and this time, keep it around for good.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone. It’s with a heavy heart that I post this, but it’s pretty much certain now that the Say What You See revival won’t be getting funded. To say we’re sad is an understatement.
Obviously the first thing to say is a massive thank you to everyone who supported the campaign. It’s really nice to know that people do still have fond memories of the game. And don’t worry, no money will be taken as the target won’t be hit.
I’d also like to thank David Stevens for giving us a chance to bring it back, and Carleton Handley for agreeing to work in the game if we’d been funded.
Massive thanks to all the artists who’d said they’d work on the revival, especially Jim’ll Paint It, Martyn Davey and Ryan Firchau.

updates.update_userinfo: Jim'll Paint It is our backer's canvas artist!
updates.update_content: We're excited to announce that our guest artist for the Exclusive Backer's Canvas is internet darling and MS Paint specialist Jim'll Paint It!

updates.update_userinfo: NEW! Get Backers Canvas and all your old canvases for £5!
😝 Say What You See is a quarter funded! Woo!
updates.update_content: Big news yesterday - we just hit a quarter of our funding goal in four days! Just wanted to say a massive thank you to everyone who’s supported us over the last week - truely, it means everything to us. Plus it turns out even Luigi is a big Say What You See fan!

Hi guys - just a quick update to let you know we've added a £10 tier to our campaign, "The Ten-tative Fan". It gives you 10 canvases for £10, plus the Exclusive Backer's Canvas and entrance to the Canvas Exchange Programme. 
If you previously backed at a £1 or a £5 tier, you can increase your pledge to £10 to get this new pack of 10 canvases. Or if you're feeling especially generous, this weekend only you can also increase your pledge to £35 and get two years of Subscription for the price of one!

updates.update_userinfo: 2 for 1 Lightning deal on SWYS this weekend!
updates.update_content:
Celebrate EGX this weekend with a 2 for 1 lightning deal on SWYS!
The campaign is going great - thanks so much for everyone's support so far, it means everything to us. Please, keep sharing the campaign as much as you can!
Also, it's EGX (the UK's Biggest Gaming Event) this weekend, and we'll be there! I'll be wearing a red SWYS hoodie, so come say "Hi" if you see me wandering round.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you everyone, from the bottom of our hearts.
updates.update_content: This means so much to us.
