updates.update_content:
Afternoon All, I hope you're safe and well.
Just a quick update for those of you still waiting on Cauldron Warband goodies. Metal restock is here, and anyone whose Pledge was metal only should have had their stuff, or received a Shipping notification. 
Mugs printed exclusively for the KS are in lockdown, 200 miles away - if your Pledge includes one and you'd like your other stuff sent separately, please get in touch.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #25 - Lockdown, restocks, and closing stages
updates.update_content:
Long overdue an Update here, sorry! The curse of the one-man band and ALL THE JOBS, pandemic notwithstanding .....
Other than EXALTED pledges (which contain all of the larger resin models as well as extras like the KS mug) I'm down to the last half dozen unprocessed Pledges, all of which should be processed this week. If you haven't received a Shipping or Processing email notification in the last couple of weeks, it *probably* means you've not completed your Pledge/paid postage - drop me a DM or email if you worry that this is the case.
Fenris (ie. me, Ian) are still locked down with 75% of the workshop,  moulds, stock and masters for the entire product line 200 miles away in Lincolnshire, and currently inaccessible. I've been effectively living in the workshop since  lockdown, here seven days a week with for company, and have been making new moulds (where possible) or  remasters, and casting, packing, and shipping 5 days a week. As moulds naturally wear out, there are some  models I'm unable to remaster until I get the move completed, and in  these cases I'm part shipping your orders and offering the choice of a  refund or a later shipment. KS exclusive mugs, too, are locked up in Lincs, and I'm part-shipping Pledges containing those where possible and will send out your giant receptacles ASAP.

Afternoon, Backers - quick Update for those of you still awaiting Pledges ( 29 of you remaining at today's count, with 49 of you STILL NOT HAVING COMPLETED PLEDGES) - I've had to make the hugely difficult decision to close the Fenris workshop at the end of January (see copy/pasted website blog post below) due to a) funding crisis and b) the need to move house as well as work following relationship breakdown.
This will hopefully have minimal effect on completion of Pledge Fulfilment - still packing your parcels in between packing boxes of moulds and equipment!

Morning Backers, just a quick Update to wish you all a restful break and to mention that 50/188 Pledges have gone out this week with another batch hopefully going out in next week's post before the end of the year and thus still hitting the original campaign ETA. I'd hoped to have processed more but the fact I've been away teaching for 5 of the last 6 weeks has *seriously* impinged on Fenris time. 
Remaining Pledges will start to go out in January before another batch of teaching. Please note that I still have FIFTY TWO of you who *still* haven't completed your Pledges via the webshop with your personalised codes nor paid Shipping charges. Please check that you've done so - I can't ship your Warband 'till you do!

Evening All and welcome to my second attempt to Update after my first draft here just got deleted by KS....
Apologies for the delay since my last Update - I've been away from home and the Fenris workshop for 5 out of the last 6 weeks, teaching to cover the never-ending bills. Fenris daily orders/business are now not nearly enough to cover workshop rent, let alone any other expenses - hence working away and the simultaneous search for new, cheaper premises.

Afternoon All, and apologies for the delay between Updates. Real Life has a way of interfering with the plans of the one-man band and this year's been no exception. Long story short, I've had to take on a huge amount of non-Fenris teaching work to make ends meet and am in the process of sourcing a new workshop and facing an imminent house move alongside ! 
However: the Good News as far as all you Backers are concerned is that the metal and resin casters are in production mode and that all looks still to be pretty much on target for the promised/estimated December fulfilment (Xmas postal delays notwithstanding).

Afternoon Rotters!
Quick chase-up for the 75 of you who've *still* not completed your Pledges/paid shipping costs. 
I really need to nail down the final numbers needed to let Chris and Christopher at Macrocosm/Shed Games get cracking with the casting queue if we're to have any chance of everyone in the campaign getting their Pledges on time. With that in mind, I'll be closing the PM on Sunday 29th September. If you've not placed your own Pledge via the weblink provided along with your personalised Pledge Code, please scuttle along and do it ASAP.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #19 - Turn it off and on again ?
updates.update_content:
Aargh.
By now you've doubtless noticed I sent you two Pledge Manager emails. Please ignore the first one, sent in error. The *second* email is the one containing your unique Pledge Code.
Clearly, in the rush to leave the workshop by ambulance yesterday, I somehow convinced myself that I'd finished prep for this email.

Quick apologies to all, as I've had a few messages worried that you haven't received the Pledge Manager email. 
I unexpectedly had to spend the entire day in hospital with chest pains yesterday, so workshop plans went on hold as soon as I got in the ambulance ;) Overworked, stressed, but otherwise an all clear from the docs by the end of the day.
Back in the workshop now, making final checks on the relevant chunk of the webshop and on the email auto-code thingy, and hoping to get things out in the ether today. Thanks for your patience !

updates.update_userinfo: Update #17 - Painted Dorfs and Pledge Manager
updates.update_content: Afternoon Rotters ! - just finalising the details on the Pledge Manager email, and aiming to hit SEND this evening. This email will contain your own personal, unique code for use in a dedicated, hidden section of the Fenris webshop and is set at the same value as the amount you Pledged during the live campaign. You'll be able to add models from the KS campaign, and any addons you may not have been able to afford/may have missed in the final countdown/which weren't released (eg. Pierre Alpoint from Update #16) as well as anything else you'd like from the broader range of Fenris stuff.

campaign.story:
We present you in exclusive our new N-paint acrylic colors: 48 high intensity matte colors, 8 ultra-high-pigmented Inks, 8 high adhesion Metallic colors, Black, White and our Ultra Matte Solution Medium, that will delight classic and new painters with its very intuitive combination and incredible tones. Each Set contains 8 colors in 18 ml pots. A total of 67 Nocturna Paints. Go ahead for details!
Also, to celebrate these Ten Years of Nocturna, we present you Ten New Resin Figures to assemble and paint. Find them all down page!
70 mm remake of classic figures
We are glad to present you THE ART OF NOCTURNA, a luxury hardcover edition book special for collectors, that will captivate the most demanding. More than 300 pages of the art of Nocturna, a review of ten years of figures from the prism of creation, with a collection of designs, sculptures, unpublished and discontinued figures, painting processes analyzed by our art director Jesús Martín, and our trip through collaborations with the best professionals in the sector and renowned international artists such as Luis Royo, Romulo Royo or Nekro.
If you´re a backer in this project of the book THE ART OF NOCTURNA, you will become part of the history of the brand, and you will receive exclusively a signed and dedicated book, and you will appear in the printed credits of it as grateful, in addition to the exclusive gifts of the campaign.
YOU CAN CHOOSE BETWEEN SPANISH AND ENGLISH LANGUAGE/ LIBRO A ESCOGER ENTRE ESPAÑOL E INGLÉS
More pictures here
Every combination is possible, just select what is better for you and Manage your Pledge adding everything that is in the Add-on list.
FIND ALL THE ELIGIBLE SETS AND FIGURES BELOW.
WARRIOR SKIN PLEDGE
DARKNESS GREY PLEDGE
DEMON RED PLEDGE
CRIMSON HELL PLEDGE
THE ART OF NOCTURNA BOOK PLEDGE
DRAGON BLUE PLEDGE
POISON GREEN PLEDGE
RUNIC GOLD PLEDGE
MIDNIGHT ALL IN
Everything is an Add-on! If it´s here, you can add it to your main Pledge. Remember to Manage your Pledge and add your favourite item. We will create more Add-ons when we reach some Stretch Goals.
Just for participating in the campaing, you receive a free PDF from RedArt Miniature Academy about how to paint our Esthel Bust. THIS BUST IS FREE FOR BACKERS OVER 170 EUROS.
Also, we have the Stretch Goals of the Campaign. Each time we reach a new Stretch Goal, we will unlock freebies and new Add-ons to buy.  We will update periodically.


YES, it reminds classic but it is new.
The N-Paint colors have been manufactured in the UK by the best modeling paint developers in the world, with more than 40 years of experience, authors of the most famous paints you have used during your life.
We used a classic formulation with some improvements. N-Paint has the perfect creamy texture you need, and the right coverage for a brilliant transparency on layers. We created a new formula for a perfect easy blending with high pigmentation. An enhanced matte finish without losing intensity, the cleanest colors for an elegant and smooth work.
Join the PAINTSPLOSION!
Forget about sand texture and muted colors. N-Paint is matte enough, but anyway you can adjust the slightly satin level of the finish, if you need it, by adding a drop of our Ultra Matte Solution into your mixes. This way you can reach an extremelly matte finish without losing intensity of color. This is how we paint, give a try! 
Our Inks are deeply pigmented and they have a little satin finish, but much less glossy than others. They can be used directly undiluted, or mixed with normal colors and metallics to reach incredibly intense tones. Also they will get completelly matte if you add Ultra Matte Solution to them, while they keep their high pigmentation and liquidity.
Our Metallic colors are designed to have the best covering and strong colors, including a extreme light valid for every tone. They go well directly and combined with inks. You will need nothing else.
N-Paint is very resistant! It can be used for wargames as well as professional painting or fine arts. Its consistency and fluidity does not disintegrate and it can be used both brush and airbrush. Its tonal variety makes it perfect to be used by themselves or combined with any other water based paint on the market.
But the greatest quality of N-Paint is not in its physical characteristics, but in what it allows you to do chromatically. The mixes made by Jesús Martín, who created the colors of Vallejo Acrylics Fantasy Pro line, have exceeded expectations, achieving a balanced range of colors that will bring you closer both to Nocturna painting style and the extremes of the most radical painting you can think of.
Live the N-Paint experience. A world of new colors is waiting for you. 
For those who want a Basic Set to start trying our N-Paints, we have designed a Starter Paint Set composed with some basic colors for a first contact. All of them are included in their own paint set, they are just a selection.
 The Full Range of N-Paint Colors is composed by 8 Sets of 8 Colors, and the Auxiliary Paint Set (White, Black and Matte Medium).

N-Paint rules. We don´t say that, our testers can tell you. Anyway, follow them because they are some of the best painters out there!
Marc Masclans  @masclans_miniatures 
Aleksandra Tana Cvetanovski  @craftworldstudio 
Michal P Lan @lanstudio 
Iván Hortal  @ivan_hortal_miniature_painter  
Arnau Lázaro  @arnau.lazaro 
Andy Wardle   @andywardle_artwork 
Flameon  @flameonminiatures 
Arkaitz   @nohacademy 
Aaron Lovejoy  @aaronlovejoy 
Arsies    @arsiesstudio  
Kirill Kanaev  Yellow_one 
Krzysztof Kobalczyk   Krzysztof 
Banshee  @miniatureartacademy 
Jesukrypton  @jesus_nocturna 
Óscar  @rrwatercolor 
THESE ARE THE ELIGIBLE FIGURES OF THE CAMPAING.
We have remade 3 of our classic figures, Nocturna, The Sorcerer and El Juglar. They are 70 mm scale now.
Thor, Freya and Deirdre are busts in 1:12 scale.
Gorthor, Armendal and Narry are 30 mm classic wargame scale.
The Highlander is a 30mm exclusive Kickstarter figure, not for sale. It´s a gift for Erly Birds during the campaign.
Every miniature is a multi part resin kit that needs to be assembled and painted.
These have been the first 24 hours Early Birds! They are not available anymore.
Once the campaign is finished, you will receive an email with the access to Backerkit platform to check and choose your items, late pledges and shipping costs. Costs will be based on weight and what is shown here is illustrative.
We will calculate the exact shipping costs according to your final Pledge, includding add-ons and everything we have to send you, so this cannot be exactly determined now.
Retailers and distributors
Please, contact us at info@nocturnamodels for details.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our main risk is to have a big success that could create a little delay in delivery, as happens usually in almost every campaign that includes a big amount of items and shipments. For that reason we have started to produce a certain amount of miniatures and paints that can help us in the future. We will get you updated and we will try to be faster than the estimated delivery deadline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shipment Update/ Actualizacíon de los envíos
updates.update_content:
Dear fellows
As you know, we are shipping the last part of the items. We have been asked about the current situation and we want to update you about it. Our new casters are working very hard to be on time for us, because we REALLY want to finish the shipment asap.
We have received 90% of the figures we were told to receive in september, but 2 of our new casters had some problems with covid themselves in september. In fact Madrid is starting to be quarantined again! The good new is that we are receiving the remaining items next week.

Dear friends, we want to share with you part of the official spanish document by the Spanish Transport Ministry. This information is OFFICIAL and updated on 07/20/2020 and valid until now.
Those countries listed are in the group of NO ADMITANCE for shipping from Spain, whatever the reason is, including restrictions in delivery countries.
Anyway, this situation will change during the next weeks, so don´t worry about the goods because you will receive them.

Good morning, friends.
We want to update you with info about shippment.
BackerKit generates a list according to the type of pledge and sorts it alphabetically. We are using that list for the shippment, not the backers order from Kickstarter. So, the location of each backer is also not the order of shipping. Aprox one third of the total orders has been shipped currently, and another third will be shipped before the month ends.

campaign.story:
“Although their time at the bottom of the garden hadn't been particularly unpleasant – the weather had been kind and the rats had sung their happiest songs to keep spirits high – Olive knew they would soon have to leave. Since the hoodie crows had appeared there was a change in the air, their cawing giving voice to a restlessness the toys had not known before. The dark woods beckoned.”
Left at the Bottom of the Garden is a project to fund the production of nine high quality, lead-free metal miniatures, each depicting a lost toy. Help me begin to tell their story in miniature form as the toys set off on their journey through the dark and twisted woods.
As the owner and sculptor of Statuesque Miniatures, I've produced many miniatures over the years. However, these figures are something quite different in style and purpose from my usual work and that's why I've come to Kickstarter to help reach as many people as possible. With your help, I can get production rolling and the toys can venture out into the world.
The Miniatures
Measuring approximately 14mm to 32mm tall, the Left at the Bottom of the Garden miniatures represent a motley collection of abandoned or lost toys. I sculpted the miniatures with tabletop gaming, painting and collecting in mind. In particular, I wanted them to be nice little objects in themselves, needing no glue, no assembly beyond normal casting clean-up and no plastic bases. They have bold, chunky details meaning they can be easily painted or finished however you wish.
All photos show production castings of the miniatures (albeit prepped and given a coat of boot polish to bring out the details), so if the Kickstarter is successful I'll be ready to start casting your miniatures immediately. There won't be any stretch goals or additional items added during the course of the campaign - I don't want anything to delay fulfilment.
Please note, due to their small size the Left at the Bottom of the Garden miniatures are not intended for small children.
What are the toys peering at in the inky blackness? One of the hoodies is definitely whispering something mean in Clementine's ear.
The Pledges
Below you can see each of the pledge levels available. With the exception of the Fancy Toys reward, all miniatures are supplied in bare metal state.
Choose any set or sets of miniatures from the Add On list below. Simply pledge the total for those sets. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign.
The complete set of nine Left at the Bottom of the Garden miniatures, cast in high quality, lead-free metal.
Additional sets of miniatures can also be chosen from the Add On list below. Simply add the total cost for those sets to the pledge level. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign.
The complete set of nine Left at the Bottom of the Garden miniatures, cast in high quality, lead-free metal and hand finished by me to match the display miniatures seen in the campaign photos on this page. This will involve the removal of any casting artefacts, a light buffing, ageing with boot polish to bring out the details and a coat of lacquer.
Additional sets of miniatures can be chosen from the Add On list below. Simply add the total cost for those sets to the pledge level. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign. Please note, any additional miniatures added to this pledge will NOT be hand finished and will be supplied in a bare metal state.
This pledge level is limited to 10 backers.
Add Ons
The following items can be added to any pledge for the amount indicated. All Add On items are supplied in a bare metal state.
Olive, Clementine and Little Puss can be added to your pledge for £7.
Add the three singing rats to your pledge for £3.
You can add the Penguin to your pledge for £5.
The two hoodie crows can be added to your pledge for £6.
Add another complete set of the miniatures to your pledge for £20.
And finally, a late addition to the Add Ons, by popular demand:
Little Puss can be added to your pledge, all on her lonesome, for £2


Shipping Costs
Shipping costs will be collected after the Kickstarter ends - do not include shipping costs in your pledge amount.
The shipping costs will follow the usual Statuesque Miniatures Flat Rate shipping costs based on the Royal Mail's World Zones. Full details of the shipping costs can be seen HERE on the Statuesque website but below is a summary:
 United Kingdom - £2.50
 Europe - £4 standard mail or £8.75 tracked
 World Zone 1 (including USA) - £5 standard mail or £9.50 tracked
 World Zone 2 (including Aus and NZ) - £5.30 standard mail or £9.80 tracked
Pledges over £50 will be sent by tracked mail where available for the standard mail shipping cost.
Please note, experience has taught me that it is best to send orders to certain counties only by International Tracked services (or if unavailable, International Signed) to ensure prompt delivery. All rewards sent to Russia (Europe shipping), Brazil and Canada (World Zone 1) will be sent by International Tracked mail only and charged appropriately, while rewards sent to Mexico (World Zone 1) will be sent by International Signed mail only and charged appropriately. No criticism of these countries is implied; I just want you to get your rewards as quickly as possible and I've found this to be the best way.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although this is my first Kickstarter, I have been running Statuesque Miniatures for nearly 9 years now and have a reputation for good quality and good service, something I am not willing to sacrifice.

As such, the preparation for this project is already complete - the 3d prints have been printed and moulded, the master castings cast and the production moulds made and tested. All that needs to be done now is the production casting to complete your rewards.

Should any delay occur due to unforeseen circumstances, I will keep you all updated but I do not expect any problems going forward.

Thanks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Left at the Bottom of the Garden Chapter Two

updates.update_content:
Hello!
As it's the first day of August, I thought I'd give a wee update on where we are with the Left at the Bottom of the Garden Kickstarter.
I've posted the rewards to all backers who have paid for postage by completing the Pledge Manager through the Statuesque webshop (unless you asked me not to post until a certain date).

Hi everyone! It's been great to hear about the toys arriving with backers over the past couple of weeks. I'm now in the position that I've posted all rewards to backers who have completed the Pledge Manager through the Statuesque webshop.
However, there are still 45 backers who have to complete the Pledge Manager and pay for postage.
The Pledge Manager is completed by placing an order through the Statuesque webshop and is a separate process to the Kickstarter survey I used to gather address details.

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge Manager update and some restocks of existing Statuesque stuff
updates.update_content:
Hello!
It's been glorious and hot here in Argyll (a very rare treat in a very damp part of Scotland) but I haven't slacked off, lots of slaving over a hot melting pot, casting toys for you all. Ok, I did enjoy the sun with a couple of gins yesterday evening.
The Pledge Manager orders have been rolling in - we're at 150 so far. Don't forget, even if you filled in the address survey and only want the basic pledge rewards, you still need to complete the Pledge Manager order to pay for postage. In hindsight, the survey probably wasn't really necessary as I've not spotted any mistakes with addresses, so I'd probably leave that out in the future.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick note of expected dispatch of rewards
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
There a lots of Pledge Manager orders rolling in, good to see. I'm getting myself psyched up for a lot of packing come the end of the week! However, I've just noticed that some of you aren't getting the full information regarding expected dispatch in the confirmation emails.
I'd updated the confirmation emails to include information about the dispatch of Kickstarter rewards and Pre-Orders, as opposed to day-to-day orders. This updated confirmation email is being sent automatically for some orders, but other orders are still getting the old info that doesn't mention the Kickstarter or Pre-Orders. Quite why is beyond me.

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter Pledge Manager page and Pre-Orders now LIVE!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
I'm happy to say the Left at the Bottom of the Garden Pledge Manager page is now live over on the Statuesque Webshop, along with non-backer Pre-Orders!
Please read the information in this update carefully. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask.

Hi everyone!
I'm about to send out the Kickstarter Surveys to gather your address information.
Please note, the surveys are not to choose pledge Rewards or Add Ons, just for your addresses. Unfortunately, Kickstarter surveys aren't really equipped for choosing between different Rewards and Add Ons.

Hi everyone!
It's a lovely sunny day here in Argyll, a nice change after some pretty heavy rain. The weather suits my mood!
But of course, there's still lots for me to do so here's how I plan to proceed:
Kickstarter Survey

campaign.story:
Welcome to this new, crazy campaign by Durgin Paint Forge, mighty backers! We have worked hard over the past years to create a new range of resin miniatures capable of making your little heart race at a million beats a minute. At long last, here we are, eager to throw ourselves into this new adventure like a lemming on the edge of a cliff! With ‘The Second Government of Inneath’, we want to repeat the wonderful experience of two years ago and, if possible, raise the bar a few notches. Just as with ‘The Iron Crows’, our goal has been to make you fall in love with us and our creations, "The Second Government of Inneath" was born to remind you that, despite the passing of years, in our eyes, you are still as beautiful as the day we met.
THE BACKER'S PORTAL: I made a page on our website to track all the progress of this campaign in the next months of wait (I know, it will be hard to wait!!). At this moment, obviously, the page is almost blank, but it will be updated regularly with all the news and important info concerning this campaign. Go to the Backer's Portal.
We have a single purpose: to create miniatures that are worthy of great heights. Or, at least metaphorically; in as much as 32mm miniatures can be. We sculpted 20 new characters and a solid range of Stretch Goals to give you the very best of the greatest human nation of Inneath: The Second Government. All our miniatures are casted in high quality resin, the best way to give you miniatures as faithful as possible to the original sculpt: if you took part in our previous Kickstarter (the blessing of Grundur be upon you!), you already have proof of how uncompromising we are when it comes to the quality of our products. On the other hand, if this is your first experience with us then you are even luckier! Now we have two more years of creative and technical experience that give us a firm belief that this Kickstarter will be even better than the last.
PLAY

See the 3d sculpts of some of our characters in literally every single details on Sketchfab: you will be able to rotate and zoom at your leisure the 3d sculpts (warning: it could be addictive). 
NDT: we strongly believe that humans have different heights. Or at least, this is what I learned when I met a Latvian guy and I seemed like his backpack, comparing our heights. For this reason, our human characters represent individuals with different heights and their miniatures reflect this concept, going approximately from 34 to 41mm size.
Have I failed to dismiss your doubts? Feel free to write to us at info@durginpaintforge.com if you have any more questions!
You will be able to support this project and contribute to the success of this range in three ways: you can select the miniatures you like individually, pounce on the convenient bundles for some bulk savings or, if you have an impassioned heart but only a few doubloons in your pocket, we would greatly appreciate if you could share this project far and wide, to wherever you think people might be interested.
If you are only interested in some specific miniatures from the range, take a look at the table below, crack out a sheet of paper, a pencil and some rounded-tip scissors. Note down the miniatures that interest you and add up their individual prices. Their total will be the amount that you will need to insert as your pledge amount. After the campaign is completed, we will send out a pledge manager in which you will be able to sort out the details of which miniatures you want. 
If you are interested in buying a bundle, simply select the appropriate pledge and enjoy the anticipation of that little box of goodies being dropped on your doorstep (if you still have those scissors ready, you could cut out some nice origami to pass the time!).
 "What if I want to buy more bundles? Or add more miniatures to my bundle?"
Easier than shooting an Elf in a barrel (don't feel bad, he deserves it). Just select the reward you are interested in, then modify your pledge by adding the value of the miniatures or any other bundles you want to add; voila!
It wouldn't be a Kickstarter campaign without a constant range of freebies raining down on you like a benevolent monsoon. As you can see, each bundle has a specific list of Stretch Goals available, if unlocked: obviously, if you buy, for example, the Redcoats Bundle and the Bluecoats Bundle you will receive all the unlocked Stretch Goals of both. The Stretch Goals that will be unlocked will be added to your bundle for free but if you want more copies of them, you can buy them adding their individual prices to your pledge (see the voice "Add on:" on the various Stretch Goals graphics)
After the campaign, as usual, you will be able to take part to our Pledge Manager Event. Of course, the Iron Crows range will be able also on the Pledge Manager, including the same bundles that we offered during their campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk, concerning a project like this one, is about the times of delivery. During our previous campaign we had, luckily, an unexpected success and we unlocked a lot of unplanned sculptures: we were overwhelmed by gratitude and happiness, but we lost almost 5 months to sculpt all the features unlocked. Moreover, our previous resin caster overbooked its schedule, which led to several quality problems and we lost several months to replace the bad resins, because, as any decent creator would do, we couldn't accept to send to our backers anything but high-quality miniatures. To avoid a similar situation, during these last two years we worked hard to start this new campaign with a better organization: we have already sculpted all the main range of characters including a solid amount of Stretch Goals and we have already started to 3d prints the first miniatures. This, for sure, will strongly optimize our production, allowing us to respect our schedule. Moreover, we found new partners, concerning the resin casts, that will surely grant us to better manage a large production maintaining the high quality that we expect for any of our products.
If, as during the previous campaign, we will unlock more unplanned features (which would mean exceeding the 36.000€ funding goal) it may happen that our schedule will be slightly delayed, to allow us to properly design and sculpt them.
Our first goal is to create something worthy of your expectations and we organized this campaign to be better than our previous one, concerning the times of delivery. We have worked hard to optimize this project and we will work even harder to give you a Kickstarter experience as smooth as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Update #46: "All the rewards have been shipped, today!"

updates.update_content:
Good evening mighty backers!
After two months of troubles and worries (personally, this is the 49th day of quarantine), things here are slowly getting better. For us "civilians", nothing has really changed, we must stay at home and we can exit only for buying groceries, but many activities re-opened, including the printing company of our booklet!
We received news about the new schedule: we should receive the booklets between 13th/15th of May. Obviously, as soon as we'll receive these long waited booklets, we will restart to ship the remaining rewards that still have to be shipped.

Good afternoon, mighty backers!
As you surely have read on, well, everywhere, the situation here in Italy is not the prettiest I can remember: the whole country has been declared "red zone", that basically means that the whole Italian people is requested not to leave our houses if not for very important needs (buy food, go to the hospital, go to work -where possible-).
As you may imagine, despite goods still can be sent and circulate inside and outside Italy (so, don't worry: your rewards are unstoppable!), we are experimenting a lot of delays and slowdowns: sorry!

updates.update_userinfo: Update #43: "First week of shippings & remaining shippings schedule"
updates.update_content:
Good afternoon mighty backers!!
This week, as anticipated in the previous update, we started to ship the first rewards, I'm super happy about it!
During this first week, we shipped almost all the Arcane/Bluecoat/Redcoat Bundle, almost all the "I'll grab a few things" reward and the minor bundles like the Legacy of Flonzi (sorry mighty Oumaguille, I've not shipped yours because I'm painting your Flonzo as promised :D), .

Good afternoon mighty backers!
The last weeks have been super busy, here at the DPF headquarter! 
Being only two persons working at the fulfilling of our KS campaigns (me and my girlfriend), we dedicated some time to properly set an assembly line to (hopefully) speed up the delivery of your rewards, maintaining good control over the various step of this process.

Earlier than expected, today I've received the Mighty Mega Boxes (I mean, the boxes themselves!) :D
Before going on, let's take a look at them:

updates.update_userinfo: Update #40: "A first look at the resins!"
updates.update_content:
As promised, here I am with a fresh update about the progress of this project!
Yesterday I received almost half of the stock requested to fulfil your rewards: as you can see, there is A LOT of stuff to check (and it is only half of the total amount!).

updates.update_userinfo: Update #39: "Stock of the situation! (we are almost ready!)
updates.update_content:
Good afternoon mighty backers!
February has almost arrived and we are setting up for the last step towards the delivery of your rewards :)
I think that it's time to take the stock of the situation, in order to update you about the next, fiery weeks!

updates.update_userinfo: Update #38: "The last update of the year!"
updates.update_content:
Good evening, mighty backers!
It's been a long time since we talked, and indeed I apologize if you thought my silence was due to my negligence: at all! In fact, I experienced a new situation, concerning the managing of a Kickstarter campaign, the lack of news.
Don't misunderstand me: the project has not stalled, but everything is proceeding as planned (for God's sake!), so I hadn't had news to share with you, in the last period. The resin caster is doing his job nicely and according to the schedule, we have sculpted all the features of this campaign a long time before this winter...it's quiet, indeed!

updates.update_userinfo: Update #37: "The Iron Titan kit, in all its resin glory!"
updates.update_content:
Good evening, mighty backers!!
Today, I want to show you another progress in our production, this time a big kit indeed (well, the biggest kit we ever designed!): The Iron Titan!

campaign.story:
Hi friends! We’re Ehud Lavski and Yael Nathan. You might know us from the short comics we’ve created such as Midnight Radio (Link), Ark (Link), and Test (Link).  
Three years ago, we began creating short comics and putting them online. We were lucky enough to have people enjoy our stories. During this time, our comics were read over 20 million times, were shared by hundreds of thousands of people and most surreal of all, are now being taught in US high-schools.
Each of our comics tells a short, unique story: A woman who becomes obsessed with a radio station that only appears in the middle of the night, a man in a post-apocalyptic wasteland, trying to collect all the healthy animals in a modern Noah's ark, and a cranky old man who might just have a time machine in the guest bedroom.
Here's one comics. A twisted little love story called COLD EMBRACE:
Now, we’re collecting all 15 of our comics stories for the first time, in a beautiful 144 page hardcover book. We’ve pulled out all the stops to make this book really special. We hope you’ll join us in bringing it to life.
ABOUT THE BOOK
We’re obsessed with making this book the most beautiful object we can. We’ve spent the last months testing different types of paper and debating foil-stamp colors. And now, it’s finally time to make the book a reality. 
 The book will be a cloth-bound, foil-stamped, oversized hardcover (The size of Marvel and DCs deluxe hardcovers). It will be printed on thick, durable paper.
 To make this book as gorgeous as possible, we’ve teamed up with Mark Vierra of On The Mark printing. Mark has printed some of the most funded and beautifully produced books in Kickstarter’s history (Steve Lichman and Scurry among others).
PLAY

 ABOUT THE REWARD TIERS
We want to keep things simple and want every item we offer to be of the highest quality possible. For this reason, we’re offering only 3 reward tiers: 
Note: If you’re a comics store and would like to order Multiple copies of our book, please get in touch with us at: midnightradioks@gmail.com. We’d love to help.
ABOUT THE STRETCH GOALS
We wanted to make the stretch goals as cool and beautifully printed as the book itself. We only chose things we’d love to have, so we really hope you’ll like them too!
We love this design. That about sums it up. Once we reach $45k we will include the bookmark with every copy of the book. 
Once we reach $50k, every backer who ordered the limited-edition and original art versions of the book will receive the entire set of 4 signed and numbered mini-prints.
This one we've been obsessed with from the very beginning. Once we reach $55k, all backers who ordered the book will receive a copy of the 32 page MIDNIGHT RADIO COLORING BOOK! Like the name says, it’s a coloring book, featuring Yael’s gorgeous illustrations. We hope we get to share it with you!
ABOUT GETTING THE BOOKS TO YOU 
 We want to get the books to you as quickly and smoothly as possible. For that, we’ve teamed up with fulfilment company Quartermaster logistics, who know how to do exactly that. Quartermaster are focused on fulfilling crowdfunding campaigns and have successfully shipped backer rewards for hundreds of campaigns. 
 AND THAT'S IT!
 If you have any questions, please email us at: midnightradioks@gmail.com
Thanks for reading all of that. You’re awesome!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is 100% ready for printing. We’ve teamed up with the best people to print the book and ship it to you. So basically, we can die tomorrow and we’ll still get the book in your hand. 

There can always be small delays in the printing and shipping of books, but we will update you on things every step of the way. That is, if we’re not dead. If we’re dead, updates will be a little less frequent.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp: You will receive the beautiful cloth-bound hardcover book containing our 15 comics stories.

support.descp:
The limited edition version includes: The book, a signed and numbered bookplate, and a Kickstarter exclusive slipcase cover.
One of four signed and numbered mini-prints will be randomly inserted into each limited-edition book.

support.title: The Original Art Version
support.descp:
You will receive everything in the limited-edition version, along with a piece of original art from Yael Nathan depicting a character from the book.
This version also includes: The book, a signed and numbered bookplate, a Kickstarter exclusive slipcase cover, and one of four signed and numbered mini-prints.

updates.update_content:
Hi friends,

The day we’ve waited for is here: The books are being sent to you! Around half the books have been shipped to you already and the others will be shipped in the next few days.

You should receive a confirmation email from our fulfilment company soon. Please check your spam folder if you don’t.

Hi friends,
A quick update: All our books have arrived at the fulfillment center in the US last week. The books are packed and ready to go and we have your addresses in the system.
But as with everything else this year, there’s a slight delay. Our fulfillment company was shut down for a while because of Covid, so they have a backlog of packages they have to ship before ours.
So our books are in the queue to be shipped. We will let you know as soon as they’re sent to you. Thank you for bearing with us just a little bit longer. This is literally the very last step before you receive your books.

Hi friends,
We’re almost there! The books will reach our fulfillment center in the US next week, and from there will be sent to you.
We are finalizing the address list and we need your help. If you’ve moved since providing your address, please go to this link to update your address:

Hi friends,
A quick update: Over the last few weeks, Yael has published a series of wonderful illustrations of female warriors. The response to them has been amazing and they’ve gone viral all over the internet.
We’re collecting all the illustrations in a hi-res digital book. You can download it for free here: https://gum.co/ynwarriors

Hi friends,
We’ve just received a wonderful update from the printers. The books are all packed and are being shipped by sea to our fulfillment center in the US. From there, they will be sent to you.

Hi friends,
This is the day Yael and I have been waiting for during these chaotic last few months. We’ve just received copies of the printed book for final approval. We thought they’d be gorgeous. They still blew us away.
Below is our unboxing of the regular edition of the book. This package is how you will receive you book.

Hi friends,
A quick update: We just released a new digital comic book. It contains two brand new stories. One of them can currently only be read in the book.
We really love this one and hope you enjoy it. You can download it for free here: http://gum.co/lightsgoout

Hi friends,
We hope you are all safe and well. We’re glad to finally have some good news to share with you in these crazy times. 
We just got the news that our books were printed! They are now being assembled and copies will be sent to us for final approval next week.

Hi friends,
A quick update: As we told you in our last update, we were all ready for our book to go to print last week. But since our book is being printed in China, it suffered a setback owing to the coronavirus.
There was a delay with the printers returning to work, but we’re told they’ll be back to work next week. All our files and materials are ready to go, so we’ll update you as soon as we know.

campaign.story:
Art by Critter Selina Erika Espiritu (@siriusdraws)
Bidet!
After an amazing 45-days, our Kickstarter campaign is now closed. Please be sure to stay tuned to our backer updates page for behind-the-scenes production and rewards updates.
Have a question? Please give us a shout through the 'Ask a Question’ button on our Kickstarter campaign FAQ page.
We can’t wait to bring the entire 10-episode The Legend of Vox Machina animated series to life!
<3
Critical Role
Critical Role is a weekly livestreamed tabletop roleplaying game featuring a group of prominent voice actors, who happen to be best friends. Each week, veteran Game Master Matthew Mercer leads the cast through epic adventures set in the world of Exandria! Trust us — it’s rad.  
Our original storyline centered on a group of heroes known as Vox Machina — Pike Trickfoot (gnome cleric, Ashley Johnson), Keyleth (half-elf druid, Marisha Ray), Percival “Percy” Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Rolo III (human gunslinger, Taliesin Jaffe), Grog Strongjaw (goliath barbarian, Travis Willingham), Scanlan Shorthalt (gnome bard, Sam Riegel), Vex’ahlia (half-elf ranger, Laura Bailey), and Vax’ildan (half-elf rogue, Liam O’Brien) — as they battled the forces of evil and learned to work as a team. Their epic tale concluded in November, 2017 after 115 episodes and 373 hours of gameplay.
The show is still going strong, now over 50 episodes in to our second season, which tracks the misfits known as the Mighty Nein. Critical Role reaches a wide, international audience called Critters, who are just about the greatest fans in history. 
 Titmouse is an Emmy award-winning animation production company behind the hits Big Mouth, The Venture Bros., Metalocalypse, Niko and the Sword of Light and Star Wars: Galaxy of Adventures. One of the largest 2D animation studios in America with studios in Los Angeles, New York and Vancouver, B.C., it employs more than 400 of the most talented people in the industry (all guaranteed to be 100% human). Its fresh styles can be seen on major networks such as Disney, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network and streaming services like Amazon and Netflix.  
Vox Machina is back, baby — but this time they’re cartoons! Here’s the amazing creative team that’s gonna take our tale from imagination to animation...  
Art by Critter Hunter Bonyun (@deerlordhunter)
WRITING TEAM
A brand new story was crafted by the cast of Critical Role and scripted by our good friend and talented TV writer, Jennifer Muro (Star Wars: Forces of Destiny, Spider-Man, Justice League: Action). Muro is one of the most sought-after writers in the industry and she’s written an in-canon adventure that takes place before the events of the streaming show. 
ANIMATION TEAM
To bring the magic and mayhem of Exandria to life, we’re sinking the vast majority of our resources into the animation budget. As Titmouse has proven again and again, they pride themselves on top notch quality and attention to detail, ensuring this story will be told with visceral, action-packed visuals. It’ll be bloody gorgeous.
VOICEOVER
The voice acting for The Legend of Vox Machina will (of course) be provided by the cast of Critical Role, who bring decades of experience to the table. You’ve no doubt heard their voices in some of your favorite cartoons — Teen Titans Go!, Ben 10, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Attack on Titan, Dragon Ball Z, Sofia the First, Avengers Assemble, DuckTales, Transformers, and many, many more. And to round out the main cast, we’ll bring in some extra special celebrity cameos, as well as voice over industry legends. 
OTHER DETAILS
In The Legend of Vox Machina, our adventuring group is right around Level 7 — fledgling adventurers, but still powerful enough to fire off exciting spells and brutal attacks.
So, what will this campaign allow us to create? A bitchin’ high-quality, fantasy cartoon set in a world created by one of the most accomplished storytellers, Matthew Mercer. With heart-stopping action and side-splitting comedy, it will have something for everyone. 
If we smash through our crowdfunding goal, The Legend of Vox Machina will be released in Fall 2020. But we can’t do it without your help funding this campaign — which ends on Thursday, April 18th at 11:59pm Pacific.
UPDATE (MARCH 7TH):
Due to the overwhelming love and support of our amazing backers, we're creating an animated series!
As a quick refresher: the first few episodes of our animation will focus on a brand new Vox Machina adventure, which takes place before our show began streaming live on Twitch. But because of your incredible generosity, we’re following your lead and going for it, diving right into a series that begins the retelling of the saga of Vox Machina. We can’t wait to show you how the story shapes up!
We're excited to share new episode offerings as part of our new stretch goals for our campaign: The Briarwoods are coming to animated life in The Legend of Vox Machina!
The Briarwoods arc is one of the most exciting and popular storylines of the Vox Machina streaming campaign. When we were brainstorming about what might come next, the clear winner was introducing the Briarwoods into The Legend of Vox Machina.
The Briarwoods arc story so far… Vox Machina arrive in Percy's hometown, Whitestone, to avenge the murder of his family and the corruption of his city at the hands of the evil Briarwoods. Danger and betrayal lurk around every corner, and it will take all of Vox Machina's abilities to combat this deadly threat. The Briarwoods arc began in episode 24 of our first streamed campaign, and remains one of our absolute favorites.
For the last batch of stretch goals that we crush, we’ll be able to create two additional 22-minute Briarwoods arc episodes.
So, to recap, here’s what you can expect episode-wise from The Legend of Vox Machina animated SERIES:
 Episodes 1 & 2: A brand new story centered around Vox Machina at level 7 (FUNDED!)
 Episodes 3, 4, 5, 6: Briarwoods arc! (FUNDED!)
 Episodes 7 & 8: Continuation of Briarwoods arc (FUNDED!)
 Episodes 9 & 10: Continuation and conclusion of Briarwoods arc (FUNDED!)
Be sure to check out our backer updates tab at the top of this page for the full download.
UPDATE (APRIL 5TH):
We have unlocked our final stretch goal and now, we’ll make the entire 10-episode The Legends of Vox Machina series for you AND a one-shot GMed by our very own Ashley Johnson! 
At the moment, we’re not planning on adding additional stretch goals -- every dollar that we raise after this point will be allocated directly into making an even more kick ass animation. This means more animators, more music, and more awesomeness. Of course, if that changes, we’ll be sure to let everyone know as soon as possible.
In our wildest dreams, we never thought that we’d be able to bring an entire Vox Machina SERIES to life. But, time and time again, you all continue to challenge our expectations in the best way. We cannot thank you enough and we cannot wait to roll up our sleeves and get started. 
Travis & Sam went on dozens of Hollywood pitch meetings, and found some interest — but we ultimately decided to create our first animated special on our own. By doing so, we can continue to stay true to our beloved characters and tell the stories you want to see. With an ever-burning desire to bring a Vox Machina animation to the masses, we decided to give the power back to our amazing community, roll up our sleeves, and make this special with YOU instead. 
Every dollar you contribute allows us to embark on this animated adventure together, with the ultimate goal of producing a full-blown animated series. We’ll keep you posted on how the project is going — with behind-the-scenes looks at the animation process, recording sessions, reward product creation, and everything in-between. As a backer, you are part of our team and we guarantee you’ll feel empowered and informed every step of the way.   
CONTRIBUTE if you have the means to do so! Backers will get updates along the way, receive awesome rewards, and be the first to know when the show is ready for prime time.
SHARE with your friends and family. Even if your loved ones don’t know Critical Role yet, a super badass cartoon is a perfect way to introduce them to it. Help us spread the good word! 
Along with making the 22-minute animated series of our dreams, the money raised through this campaign will allow us to provide cool rewards and administer our crowdfunding project. 
It’s incredibly important that we remain transparent, so we created this handy chart to show you exactly where your hard-earned money will go. 
The overwhelming majority of our funds raised will support the production of our animated special — from our incredible animation team to voiceover studio time, soundtrack composition, music, effects, sound design, etc.
Of course, we have accounted for some boring (but important!) stuff too — like credit card processing fees, accounting, and additional staff to keep this project running at full steam. 
We wanted to give you the coolest and most high-quality rewards, all of which are exclusive to this crowdfunding campaign, which means you won’t be able to find this swag anywhere else! 
 We’re thrilled to offer you a selection of campaign-exclusive perks as a thank you for supporting The Legend of Vox Machina. We’ve set it up this way to guarantee that most of your funds go towards creating the best damn cartoon possible. After countless creative meetings, we created this set of sweet products that we would be proud to own ourselves.    
Each time we hit a new goal together, we'll share our new crowdfunding goal with you! This means more swag and some bad ass Vox Machina one-shots that will unlock for everyone (backers or not!).   
First, check out our Kickstarter FAQ on our campaign page. We will update this page as often as possible to ensure that the answers that you seek are readily available. 
If your question isn’t covered in the FAQ, feel free to drop us a note by hitting the ‘Ask a question’ button on the FAQ page. 
Special thanks to Critter Jessica Mahon (@my2k) for creating the portrait art for our campaign headings.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With our animation and creative team locked, it's important to mention that we expect our animated special to arrive in Fall 2020. Animation can be a lengthy process and above all, we want to make sure that we create something that stays true to who we are. 

We hope to begin shipping rewards as early as May 2020, which will allow us to ensure that each of our reward products meets our standards. 

We don't anticipate any major challenges, but should the unexpected pop up, we'll be sure to communicate any issues or delays with you right away.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey there, Critters!
Our behind-the-scenes documentary series, The Legend of the Legend of Vox Machina, is back with a special reveal of A VERY BIG DEAL lead character designer… Give us a drumroll, Scanlan!
<< drumroll >>
The incomparable Emmy® Award-winning Phil Bourassa! We have been huge fans of Phil’s work for decades so having him helm character design for our series is a dream come true stacked on top of another dream come true. Phil has spent the past 20 years taking over the animation scene, particularly through a vast array of DC superhero projects with Warner Bros. Animation, including , ,among many others. Now, it's Vox Machina's turn to join the ranks of these esteemed heroes!

campaign.story:
It’s been 20 years since my first sketches of the diminutive fubarnii and this Salute will be the tenth anniversary of the first Twilight releases! Over those two decades I’ve visited large areas of Anyaral and we now have well over 100 unique playable units for the game (not to mention all the different variants, civilians and a wide variety of critters...), all in the usual World of Twilight scale (roughly 28mm).
If you are new to Anyaral, then I recommend you go and visit the World of Twilight website to find out more!
Over the last year I’ve continued with the normal range, but I’ve also had a play with something slightly different, and that is where I need your help!
Legends of Anyaral is a random little side project that will let me play with big buildings and creatures that simply wouldn’t work in the usual scale. I took the very simplistic approach of sculpting everything half the usual size, which effectively makes it a 15mm range. The first sculpt I did was of a piece of Fubarnii architecture that I sketched during Inktober 2017; the Crooked Trade Outpost. 
"Crooked" from Inktober 2017
"We paused our travels briefly at the crooked tower of Geliad. I had initially assumed the tower was on the brink of collapse, but was assured by the locals that it was all part of their local engineer's eccentric but deliberate design! It now serves as an outpost where traders rest before braving the Moerasii marshes. We were fortunate enough to see a domesticated lorsaan being loaded with baggage. It never ceases to amaze me that such behemoths wander our lands." 
I wanted to create the building, but figured it would be somewhat huge in the usual scale! Instead, I halved all the dimensions, making it a much more manageable 135mm in height. Having sculpted the building I did of course need to sculpt the lorsaan to accompany it. Then a few little traders to look after the Lorsaan... Which gives a good insight into how Twilight has generally been created over the last twenty years!
The Crooked Trade Outpost, painted by Joe Karame
I’ve got a few other ideas I’d like to do in the Legends scale (the enarii, more huge beasts!), but it depends a lot how well this project is received. I have no current plans for any rules, although that could be very tempting! That's for the future though, this kickstarter is just about the Outpost :)
Thanks to all the people who have backed so far, we have achieved our target! There are of course more things I would like to add to the campaign though...

Even in the smaller scale I wasn’t entirely sure how practical it would be to release the trade outpost, but the very talented Rob Huntley (Warploque) took it in hand and did an amazing job casting the tower as a single piece kit! I then worked with Rob Alderman and John Bryan to make some more production moulds that would make the set affordable to gamers as well as collectors. For this kickstarter most of the pledges will be cast by John Bryan, but I am also giving you the opportunity to get your hands on the Warploque master casts as a special collector's edition.
I’m keeping everything about this campaign simple. The campaign will run for a short period and will be very focused. I’ve got a couple of ideas for extras and stretch goals (remember those traders I mentioned earlier...), but nothing that will delay delivery!
As soon as the campaign is over I’ll get everything ordered and get the pledge manager open so I can start shipping as soon as Kickstarter release the funds.
I’m sure many of you in Europe will be a bit apprehensive about Brexit. I can't make any promises as there isn't much time, but the plan is to get all European orders shipped first (hopefully before the end of March) with the orders to the rest of the world close on their heels! 
For this Kickstarter I’ve come up with a few simple pledges, so you can get the Lorsaan or the Crooked Outpost, or everything together.
I've also put together a special Master Quality Collector's Set, which is the definitive collector's edition. The Collector's Set includes resin Warploque master casts of the Trade Outpost and the Lorsaan. 
You can add the following to your pledge by simply increasing your pledge value. You will then be able to specify what you would like after the campaign is over.
Three Tiny Traders: £5
Tiny Twilight (2 Knights, 4 Militia, 2 Devanu and 3 Grishak plus 1 Delgon priest and 1 KalGarkii): £12
The Misfits (Limping Belan and Trader, Injured Knight and Militia) : £6
Resin Belan: £12
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've run three larger projects previously, so have a good grasp of the challenges involved!
This project does involve a lot of individual resin casts, which I know can cause production delays. However, I’ve lined up the casters so I’m confident they’ll be able to deliver in time.
The other concern is the impact Brexit might have on delivery for European backers, but we will do our best to get European orders out in advance, as long as details are provided efficiently.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hello everyone,
Welcome to our ninth Kickstarter and the first of 2019! We have been working on this project for over a year and we enjoyed every step along the way. From the initial ideas bouncing around in my head to the concept sketches, the sculpting process and then seeing them come alive through printing and casting. It has been a very rewarding experience and now I can finally share them with you!
Last year might have been mostly about scifi and Cyberpunk, but this year, we will start with some fantasy love!!!
This campaign is about a trio (trio?!? yes, trio!) of elves known as the Dragon Masters. They raise and train dragons for others of their kin. So the dragons (technically one of them is a Wyvern but we'll count it as a dragon! ;) ) you see on the busts are not mature and fully grown dragons. But they will be! Who knows, one day we might make some proper fully grown ones...!?
Karadhran, the male Dragon Master stands almost 80mm tall and has a width of over 115mm!
Ciadrin, the female Dragon Master stands a little over 66mm with a width of 90mm!

Concept art
The journey starts with an idea formulating in my head. I often do some rough sketches and write down some thoughts and notes to start establishing a concrete plan for the character. The second step is finding an artist that is suited for what I have mind and then let him or her do their magic.
In this case Denis Zimin took my ideas and made these two concepts which I really like!
He is currently making them into fully coloured artworks and I hope to share them soon. 
Karadhran
Ciadrin
Renders
After the concepts are finished, the sculptor goes to work. He takes the concepts and starts sculpting them. Digitally in this case. The concept art was spot on and Radmir Achmentov, one of our regular sculptors, had a blast and this shows in the sculpts.

Karadhran render
Ciadrin render
Cyara render
Prints
Once the sculpting has been done and the cuts are in place, the sculpts are turned into STL files and these are sent to the printer. In our case we use Micron 3D. 
Ciadrin print
Casts
Once the printer has sent the prints to our caster, the moulding and casting process begins. A magical and obscure happening that I absolutely have no clue on how to do it myself so  we rather let trained professionals do their stuff! First the print/sculpt is prepared and then a master mould is made. From this master mould some test casts are made to see if everything is working properly and if so, these casts are then used to produce casting moulds. 

Ciadran master casting (prior to clean up!)
Karadhran master casting (prior to clean up!)



We have a few types of pledges. The regular ones that will be available throughout the campaign with the busts at a discounted price from the MSRP and...   48 hour only EARLY BIRDS!!! 
Karadhran
Ciadrin

Karadhran & Ciadrin
Cyara

Add-ons! 
We decided to add the Draken busts of Drakogor and Dragyn to this campaign as they fit right in being dragon hybrids themselves! Drakogor wa released last year and dragyn is a brand new release!
Drakogor
Dragyn
Drakogor & Dragyn
These are HUGE busts! Drakogor standing at 90mm from bottom to top and Dragyn an impressive 110mm from bottom to the top of his horns!!! 
For more angles check here;
 https://drive.google.com/open?id=1CMjSP14DRwLniSDOznFwpa83mXnyIrW9 


Shipping will be charged during the Kickstarter. For all pledges it is €10,- which includes tracking, signed for delivery and insurance.  
We have set the delivery date for May 2019. Casting will begin once the campaign is over and we have funded. We believe this is a realistic date after speaking things through with our caster. 
The company who handles our shipping proved eight times already that they do a good job. We have every faith we can deliver on time as we have become quite good at organizing and packing. We don't think there will be a delay in packages going out to backers but would just like to add that delays can happen. Once the shipping company has your parcels it is out of our control. However we will do everything possible again to fulfill this Kickstarter on time. 
Please note that we are not responsible for any customs or other fees that might occur. 
Miniatures come unpainted and need assembly and some minor cleaning.

As always there are a few people I want to thank! The following people who's help and hard work has made it possible to do this campaign!  
Sir Castalot (mysterious and legendary caster supreme!)
Radmir Achmentov (Punga Miniatures)
Toni Garcia Krespo (CHK Studios)
Michal NT (Digital painter)
Kyle Cruickshank (Mr Lees Minis)
Luke Wilson
Micron 3D
Bulat Satuchin

One thing that is very important if you want to help us fund, is to please take a moment to share the project. You can do this by sharing the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, your blog, forums and on any other Social media you might know! 
Tell your friends who might be interested and with your help we can make this project as successful as possible, ensuring we can make many more wonderful busts and miniatures in the near future!  
You can follow us here: 
https://www.facebook.com/OuroborosMiniatures/
https://ouroborosminiatures.blogspot.nl/
https://www.instagram.com/ouroborosminiatures/
https://twitter.com/OuroborosMinis
https://ouroborosminiatures.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Dragon Masters have already been sculpted, moulded and (test) cast. Production will start as soon as (and only if) the campaign is successfully funded. Once we receive the casts, we will process them and make everything ready for sending them on their way. Out of experience packaging doesn't take us very take long. We have a reliable shipping company who does the distribution and therefor we have good confidence that we will be able to deliver on time.

Please note though that the estimated delivery time is based upon a certain number of expected backers. In case of a highly succesful campaign, the delivery could take a bit longer.

This is our ninth campaign and from our previous eight, we only had one campaign being delivered late. All others were shipped on time or even ahead of the estimated delivery times. Our current caster is a true professional and a man of his word. He has delivered on time and provided great quality so we know he will get the job done!

We have great confidence that we can deliver yet another project succesfully and on time!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome everyone, my name is Lewis Collins and this is a small project of four traditionally sculpted miniatures aimed at gamers and painters. the models have been sculpted so that they can be base coated and washed and look great, whilst at the same time providing a lot of enjoyment for painters who want to take them that bit further.
Living in Nottingham means that I'm lucky enough to live down the road from the casting company (Warbanner), which means i get to quality check every cast and oversee the whole process, and being a painter and hobbyist myself i know what type of quality I expect from products, and only the best will do! 
The company (Warbanner) I have casting for me are big in the industry and have had years of experience both casting and distributing, which means maximum efficiency after this project hopefully funds.
I have a huge passion as i know most of you do for what we call 'The old style' of miniatures and that's really what i wanted to capture with this project. I really wanted to make it easy for gamers to just put a base coat and a wash over these miniatures and for them to come to life with good contrast and pacing of detail. But on the other hand i also wanted them to be a good challenge for more seasoned painters with a lot of room to play with, and with the current feedback they've been getting it seems to have worked! 
Bellow are individual pictures of the Four and Postage Values for shipping across the world.

The Pilgrim
The Knight
The Man-At-Arms
The Guard
Postage costs:
Thank you for looking and I wish you all the best in your future hobbying adventures
all the best 
Lewis
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As this is a small project I don't expect any risks or challenges to occur, the only aspect that may be time consuming is the quality checking, which i will be doing personally as i know how frustrating it can be to receive models that aren't of the best quality!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi guys,
The last few weeks have been crazy quality checking, packaging and posting minis, I've finally come to the end of it all and the minis will be with you within the next 2-3 weeks! It's been very hard work but I'm very proud to have done as much of it on my own as I could.
Footsore have cast beautiful metals that I hope you guys will really enjoy painting, so a huge thanks everyone involved there.

Heya guys, if you paid an invoice and it said I haven't collected it's because a problem has happened paypal's end and it won't let me!
Could you please cancel it and resent too lewiscollinsminiatures@gmail.com
It's all being sent at the moment!
Thanks!

Hi all!
I've been quality checking and packing every single model of the 1800 that were brought, to ensure everyone gets the best quality! I brought more casts than I needed just incase some fell prey to the inevitable misscast beast, but the quality have been just fantastic, none the less, I've been checking them all so as soon as you get them you can start painting!
I feel it's important for me personally to be part of the whole process from start to finish as I've invested so much time in the sculpting and Kickstarter it would be a shame not to make sure everyone had the best casts of my toy soldiers in the end, it has taken me a few extra weeks than anticipated to get everything done and packed because of this, but I'm getting towards the end of the mammoth packaging task and will be sending out the minis in the next two weeks!

Hello all,
I've just sent out the postage invoices for the Fantasy four kickstarter, all of the parcels will be making their way to new homes by the end of the month, and I can't wait to see what you do with them.
I will be posting a couple of updates at the parcels are shipped, and then it's onto the next project, which I'm excited to show you all!

Here is the nearly finished rip-tooth doggo, best friend to the man at arms...
Story by Richard Kua -
He had many names, Boy when he was a puppy, then Biter when the shop-keep had owned him, the man at arms has bought him for a piece of silver and the shop-keep was glad to be rid of him. They were well suited, both had scars and both had fought, both had a mean temper with everyone but their one and only friend. They kept the kings peace and patrolled the city streets, bringing in thieves and cutpurses, robbers and drunks. The criminals of the city called him Rip-tooth or The Black Hound as the man set him upon anyone who he could not catch. In the times when they were off duty, man and dog had that silent bond where they did not need to talk, they looked and nodded and knew what the other was thinking. They were friends who had seen everything and owed

Thank you everyone for showing your support over the last week, and as we go into the final week I wanted to say a huge thanks!
As a special thank you I'm currently sculpting a small doggo companion that will be given away for free to every backer of all 4 characters!
Picture updates coming at the end of the week!!

campaign.story:
Munchkin Dungeon is a hilarious adventure game designed by Andrea Chiarvesio and Eric M. Lang where 2 to 5 players explore the Dungeon and have to push their luck, facing not only hordes of monsters but also their friends' treacherous tricks! The celebrated hit card game Munchkin and its infamous characters come to life on your tabletop with amazing miniatures!
 Find out more about these Optional Buys in the following links: Munchkin Dungeon: Board Silly, Munchkin Dungeon: Cthulhu, Munchkin Dungeon: Cute as a Button, Epic Dungeon Board, Extra Dice Pack, Villain Dice Pack, Colored Dice Pack, Legendary Pack.
Core box painted miniatures. PLEASE NOTE FIGURES COME UNPAINTED.
Side Quest painted miniatures. PLEASE NOTE FIGURES COME UNPAINTED.
Note that anything marked with this:
is an exclusive item for Kickstarter backers (or from other crowdfunding platforms), with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.


Please Take Note!
Based on past experience, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends, using PayPal. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options.
We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship to you from our hub in the UK (EU backers), China (Asia Pacific backers), Singapore (Singaporean backers), Canada (Canadian backers), Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers) or Atlanta (USA and the rest of the world). Following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a standard game package (4kg volumetric weight). Keep in mind these are just estimates, and costs may rise based on weight increases from unlocked stretch goals and any optional buys you choose.
USA: $10-$20 to most states. $50 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico. 
CANADA: $15-$30 to most cities. 
LATIN AMERICA: $70-$80 to most countries. 
ASIA: $10 to China, Hong Kong, and Singapore. $35 to most other countries (we can’t predict an estimate cost to Malaysia). Backers in China, please read THIS UPDATE.
OCEANIA: $20-$45 to Australia. $40 to New Zealand. 
AFRICA: $95 to most countries. 
EUROPE: $20-$30 to most countries. 
 • $35 to Norway, Switzerland, Finland, Estonia, and Latvia. 
 • $50 to Bosnia/Herzegowina, Croatia, and Iceland. 
 • $70-$80 to Israel, Liechtenstein, and Serbia.
 • $90 to Belarus.
Unfortunately, different import laws and customs have made it impossible for CMON to ship games to certain specific countries.
*WE DO NOT SHIP TO:* Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
Please note that while we do our best to get you your rewards in a timely manner, you may not necessarily receive your rewards before the product makes it into distribution in your own country or before it's made available at conventions and special promotion opportunities. We hope that the special price and exclusive items you will get during the Kickstarter will make up for any such possible lag. However, if this is something that is not acceptable to you, please do not back this project, and instead wait for the retail release. Thank you for your understanding. 
Be aware that all pledges that are confirmed after the pledge manager deadline will be shipped from the US hub at a later date. For non-US backers that will likely incur increased shipping costs. We also cannot ship to PO Boxes domestically or internationally. Due to the size of each package there is too great a risk of the package being bounced back to us.
The table below gives you a general idea of the full schedule of what to expect once the campaign ends. Keep in mind these are just estimates, and the timeline may vary due to circumstances. 
To learn about Retail Pledges click HERE.
Munchkin is © 2001, 2002, 2006-2008, 2010-2012, and 2014-2019 by Steve Jackson Games Incorporated. All rights reserved. Munchkin, the Munchkin characters, and the pyramid logo are trademarks or registered trademarks of Steve Jackson Games Incorporated, or used under license. Munchkin Dungeon is © 2019 by CMON Global Limited. All rights reserved.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 36th Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as: 
Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays

The estimated delivery date for this project is February 2020, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment, no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and in the past have led to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
