campaign.story:
Hello everybody,
Welcome to our 8th campaign here on Kickstarter! This campaign is to help us fund the first model in our new Wasteland Raiders line called Fast Johnny. In doing so we can hopefully realise a few more of the riders that we have in mind for this range.
Digitally coloured render of Fast Johnny by Miranda Bosch-Thurlings
Fast Johnny, the model in question, has a kind of ironic meaning to us personally. It didn't start out like that of course but this year has been really odd and intense for us. A rollercoaster ride of epic proportions with great highs and deep lows! 
You see we started out this year with a very successful campaign called CP New Skin. The result from that campaign made sure we could do a lot of the things we had planned for this year. We try to very loosely plan a year ahead and for 2018 we wanted to try and release between 20-25 miniatures and busts. So when the New Skin campaign ended much better than we ever could have imagined, we had good confidence that we would be able to do all the things we wanted at a steady pace. Boy oh boy were we wrong...!!!
Continued below... (it turned out into quite a long read and it was not very eye catching so hence the split!)
So who is Fast Johnny?! When the world went tumbled into madness and destruction reigned, Johnny who's actual name is Jony Ag Anaba, found himself without his trusty camel Sarah. Sarah got killed as his tribesmen ate her. Johnny was heartbroken and after having trained her from birth he was at loss on what to do. 
Emptiness and bitterness filled his soul and in a fit of rage he murdered his kin and ventured out into the desert. Wandering for weeks on end he almost gave in and was about to take his own life to be with his loved Sarah. 
But then, as a sign from above he found a giant turtle in need of help. The turtle fell from a sand dune and was lying on its back, unable to get back on its feet. Johnny flipped the turtle over and ever since then, an unbreakable bond was firmly established between the two of them. He named the turtle Sarah in honour of his beloved camel and now they wander the Wasteland that the world has become.
Slowly, yet steadfast...
Renders
Here are the renders that the sculptor, Radmir Achmentov of Punga Miniatures, made. He took our idea and really went for it. You can tell he enjoyed sculpting Fast Johnny and we hope that will be the case for the others we have planned too.
In these pics you can see one of the stretch goals we have planned. Sir Teddy was taken as spoils of combat from an encounter with another Wasteland Raider named Zarola. Apparently Fast Johnny shot her mount and took Sir Teddy from her. She's not dead though and is planning revenge as soon as she has found a new mount!
Print
When the print came in we found out that there was quite some damage unfortunately and we had to use Green Stuff to fix some cracks and breaks. While a bit rusty I was able to repair them all. The print also suffered from some missing detail that the printer wasn't able to print very well. Mostly on the rifle. I think I managed to fix it properly and it even adds to the character of a post apocalyptic wanderer that has to prepare things with limited resources at hand. 
I also took the liberty to add reins that run from Fast Johhny's hands to the head of the turtle. The sculptor did sculpt them but only held in his hands and to me it looked a bit odd since Sarah has a halter and there was nothing attached to it.   
Cast
The casting is done by our anonymous casting benefactor who I call by the codename of Sir Castalot! He has done the casting of the new batch of CP New Skins, CP Yakuza Dragoness and Kumicho as well as the Eldritch Dre'ya the Silent leaf. Needles to say, that to us, he is an absolute legend and he has saved our ass a couple of times! 
He told us that Fast Johnny casts up like a charm so we foresee no problems there whatsoever!
Fast Johnny front
Fast Johnny side
Fast Johnny other side
Fast Johnny back
Pictures courtesy of Sir Castalot. We didn't recieve the package on time and I didn't want to delay the launch. I'll prep one and do a video of fast Johnny and sarah this weekend.
Size
Fast Johnny is 54mm scale. From the top of Johnny's head to the bottom of the turtle's shell is roughly 60mm. Including the turtle's legs this will be roughly70/75mm.
Below you see the print with a ruler next to it. 
Fast Johnny height
Fast Johnny length
We only have two types of pledges this time. An Ouroboros Miniatures' first time ever...  48 hour only EARLY BIRD!!! 
Yes you've read that right. For the first 48 hours of the campaign you can get Fast Johnny with an additional extra €5,- off!
The standard pledge for a copy of Fast Johnny comes with a discount from the MSRP too of course! 
EARLY BIRD!
Fast Johnny regular pledge!
We also have options (normal pledge plus an early bird!) to get two Fast Johnny miniatures with a little more discount. Just in case you are thinking to convert one so Fast Johnny doesn't get too lonely! ;)
Shipping will be charged during the Kickstarter. For all pledges it is €10,- which includes tracking, signed for delivery and insurance.  
We have set the delivery date for February 2019. Casting is almost ready to go and we believe this is a realistic date. 
The company who handles our shipping proved a couple of times already that they do a good job. We have every faith we can deliver on time as we have become quite good at organizing and packing. We don't think there will be a delay in packages going out to backers but would just like to add that delays can happen. Once the shipping company has your parcels it is out of our control. However we will do everything possible again to fulfill this Kickstarter on time. 
Please note that we are not responsible for any customs or other fees that might occur. 
Miniatures come unpainted and need assembly and some minor cleaning.
As always there are a few people I want to thank! The following people who's help and hard work has made it possible to do this campaign!  
Radmir Achmentov (Punga Miniatures)
Mally Anderson (Journeyman Miniatures
Miranda Bosch-Thurlings
Sir Castalot (our mysterious incognito caster who we very grateful for to have on our side! You know who you are and you are a legend mate!!!)
Kyle Cruickshank (Mr Lees Minis)
Luke Wilson
One thing that is very important if you want to help us fund is to please take a moment to share the project. You can do this by sharing the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, your blog, forums and on any other Social media you might know! Tell your friends who might be interested and with your help we can make this project as successful as possible, ensuring we can make many more wonderful busts and miniatures in the near future!  
You can follow us here: 
https://www.facebook.com/OuroborosMiniatures/
https://ouroborosminiatures.blogspot.nl/
https://www.instagram.com/ouroborosminiatures/
https://twitter.com/OuroborosMinis
https://plus.google.com/u/0/collection/4nJUNE
Continued from top...
Due to severe issues with our then caster, we were only able to unofficially release a bunch of busts and could only release all of them officially last September. Releasing them all at once and in such a short timespan was definitely not ideal as you can imagine but we had no choice really. Our game of playing catch up had started and by now we are almost reaching a point that we are there where we want to be. Why not hold things off to next year you might think? Well to be honest we don't want this year to mess up our plans for next year really! We don't want to look back anymore but move forward! So, coming back to what this text started with, we started the year full of enthusiasm and wanted to go full speed but then did a Fast Johnny! Not going very fast but moving on forwards at a slow yet steady pace. Determined to not give up and continue doing what we do! Thankfully a lot of you like what we are doing and your continuous support has made it possible for us to grow and keep growing. We say it often but we do really appreciate your support!!! So maybe this comparison is not entirely accurate but the story of the turtle and the hare kinda suits here. A fast starter not always ends up first. But a slow starter ends up over the finish line at some point as well! Sorry for turning this into an essay in the end but to some of you it might be interesting to have some insight into things.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fast Johnny has already been sculpted, moulded and (test) cast. Production will start as soon as (and only if) the campaign is successfully funded. Once we receive the casts we will process them and make everything ready for sending them on their way. Out of experience, packaging doesn't take us very take long. We have a reliable shipping company who does the distribution and therefor we have good confidence that we will be able to deliver on time.

Please note though that the estimated delivery time is based upon a certain number of expected backers. In case of a highly succesful campaign, the delivery could take a bit longer.

This is our eight campaign and from our previous seven, we only had one campaign being delivered late due to the caster not being able to do as promised. All others were shipped on time or even ahead of the estimated delivery times. 

We have great confidence that we can deliver yet another project succesfully and on time!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome, welcome, one and all, to the second Warp Team Fantasy Football Kickstarter! 
Following on from the successful Ram Raiders: Halfling Team Kickstarter in August, I am delighted to bring you another brand new scaly squad - The Croc Blockers!
WTFF is a new range of unique and distinctive miniatures to use in your Fantasy Football games. Each model has been hand sculpted, and is cast in the finest white metal and resin. My goal is to make sure that every single WTFF miniature is packed full of character, is a joy to paint, and will look suitably splendid on your table top.  
So grab your popcorn, break out your beverages, and take your seats. Whilst we wait for the match to start, how's about we look at our second team to take to the pitch...
Cast in either white metal or fine resin.
Human model is for size comparison only and is owned by Games Workshop
Different team, same quality
Battle Ball/ WTFF Pitches
CLICK HERE!
CLICK HERE!
Warp Team Fantasy Football have teamed up with Chris from Battle Ball to bring you these awesome Croc Blockers branded vinyl gaming mats! Usable on their own, they can also be placed inside the epic Battle Ball laser cut stadiums, and how awesome do they look?
To grab either the mat or the stadium, check out the Battle Ball Kickstarter here! - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/178326236/battle-ball-field-a-fantasy-football-arena/description
Why are there only a few stretch goals?  
Kickstarter is an interesting beast, as all of us know from experience. Countless times people get involved in long, extensive campaigns only to wait months, sometimes years for them to be fulfilled. When the crowd bays for more, it's tempting to give in and offer far more products than you can deliver in the time frame promised at the start of the campaign!  
In the past I've ran a few of those types of campaigns, and, as with the Ram Raiders Kickstarter, I have once again decided to keep this short and sweet. This means fewer products for you all to buy, but a much shorter time for you all to wait before your lovely models are on your painting desk. Which we can all agree, is exactly where they ought to be.
The cost of shipping is not included in your pledge, and will be added after the conclusion of the campaign through the pledge manager. I will provide you all with full instructions when the time comes. I am still finalising the exact shipping costs, but to give you a rough idea here are a couple of preliminary estimates:  
GAME DAY TICKET: - £0 unless used to purchase miniatures in the campaign.  
BOOGIE'S BUY: - £2 to the UK, £4 EU and £4 ROW.  
TEAM PLAYER/GOLDEN CLAWS: £3.50 to the UK, £7 EU and £7 ROW.  
These estimates may increase if you purchase a large number of additional models on top of your core pledge, especially at the BOOGIE'S BUY or GAME DAY TICKET level. The final shipping costs are subject to change, and will be based on your location and specific rewards.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any undertaking of this nature is a huge commitment and a lot of work for everyone involved. Miniatures need sculpting, manufacturing, packing and eventually shipping to the backers.

It is at these hurdles that some Kickstarters have faltered in the past, so, I have given careful consideration to each part of the process to minimise potential risk. Warploque Miniatures is a family run business, so everyone involved is 100% dedicated to making this project as successful and professional as possible. My father is our resin caster, my mother is in charge of packing and shipment, and our metal caster is a tried and tested person we have worked with before.

Also, instead of relying purely on concept art and work-in-progress sculpts to illustrate my products, all of the initial models that I am offering have already been sculpted. They've been cast, the display copies have been painted, and they are ready to go into production, so backers know exactly what they are investing in. I will be relying on Work in Progress sculpts and concept art for some of the stretch goals, but be assured that they will be completed and cast in a timely manner once the campaign has been funded.


Finally, I have set achievable delivery date estimates. I have kept the campaign small and manageable, eschewing the long list of stretch goals that other campaigns have had, so this project has a much higher probability of being completed and delivered on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Ho there, Sports Fans!
Hope you are all well. I bring you good tidings and joyous news...
Packing of the Croc Blockers has officially started!
Half of the parcels have been packed, and will be taken to the Post Office tomorrow morning.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for fulfilling your pledge managers!
updates.update_content:
Ho there, Sports Fans!
Thank you to everyone who filled out their pledge managers for me on time! You will be the first ones to receive your miniatures when packing starts.
HOWEVER
There are still outstanding pledge managers. If you want your models to be on time, please complete them as soon as possible.

Ho there, Sports Fans!
I am very pleased to announce...
The Pledge Managers have been Sent!
For this campaign I have decided to use the wonderful BackerKit, so it's incredible easy for you to manage your pledges.

Hey guys!
Just a quick one - the pledge manager still isn't ready to launch. Although I submitted it last week, I imagine the guys at BackerKit have quite a bit of backlog to wade through! 
I will let you guys know as soon as it is ready. Thank you for your patience!
Cheers,

Ho there, Sports Fans!
I hope you've had a wonderful Christmas, and are looking forward to your New Years celebrations!
Just thought I would keep you all in the loop about the progress of the project...
Pledge Managers going live soon!

Ho there Sports Fans!
Sorry this update is a little late - as I said in my previous update, I am currently performing in a stage show of Beauty and the Beast in Nottingham, and I've only just got back home to my computer!
A huge thank you to every one of you who backed the campaign. Not only have we funded it, not only have we smashed all of the stretch goals, but we have raised more than the previous WTFF Kickstarter, The Ram Raiders. Astounding!
So, what's next?

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Infamy has run multiple Kickstarters of our own and project managed or advised on other campaigns.

We are experienced at producing miniatures and already have The Getaway kit 3D printed and in pre-production. Any extras in this campaign have been carefully considered, to fit within achievable parameters, and we have set realistic delivery dates.

This campaign has been constructed to be simple and easy to complete when fulfillment comes:

- The production process is ready to begin when the project is funded. 
- Stretch goals have been carefully planned, to make sure we do not create a production backlog. 
- Full transparency - we will ensure backers are informed at every stage of the fulfillment process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Infamy Games are hitting the reset button!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, James here, writing an update for first time in quite a while.

I wanted to take the reins with this message and let you know where things are at with Infamy Games. It's been a tough time for the company but I'm going to do my best to be a more active part of communication and promotion over the coming months, to bring things back to what they once were.

We put out a rather in-depth report on social media earlier in the week but in case you didn't see it, here it is:

Hello everyone,
Very pleased to say that casts have arrived without warning! Not a bad surprise to receive! That means that we are ready to finish this campaign. Thank you so much for your patience and our apologies for the time it took. We hope you'll think that the wait was worthwhile once you get your Getaway kits!
We will Lockdown the BackerKit on the morning of Wednesday 23rd October - please ensure your details are all up to date by then.
Once that's done we will be shipping pledges by the end of the month. If there are any issues with pledges we will contact you directly, but we are hoping all can run smoothly from this point.

updates.update_userinfo: Sample casts are in and looking good
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Thank you for your patience while we sorted casting. Our new caster has made the molds and has sent sample casts to us for approval. The quality of these looks great, so we've given that approval and casting of the other Getaway kits will start soon.

Hey backers, welcome to 2019!
A simple update today to let you know we're launching the BackerKit. You'll receive invites shortly and be able to head in, sort any pledge details and add-ons, and add delivery details.
The BackerKit won't fully lock down until April, so there's plenty of time to make changes if you need to, but it helps us with production if we know what volumes we need to get produced.

Hey backers,
Thank you for getting behind this Kickstarter campaign. We're all done, the Getaway's funded, and we'll be moving into 2019 producing this awesome model. 
That's actually about all for now! We hope the end of 2018 has lots of good stuff for all of you and we'll be back with an update in early 2019 with news of the BackerKit launch, where you'll be able to pick add-ons, extras and all that good stuff.

updates.update_userinfo: All done! Thanks for the support y'all.
updates.update_content:
Hello backers,
Another Monday brings more James W Cain models to the campaign at a reduced price. This time it's his wonderful Jekyll and Hyde busts.

We've joined up with our friends at Artis Opus to bring a Kickstarter Exclusive Infamy version of their awesome Series S: Brush Set to the campaign.

Hey backers,
On Sunday evening the campaign reached its goal target. Thank you to all of our backers - The Getaway is now funded!
We can move to Stretch Goals now. Some of these will be extra freebies added to your kit (like the first art card one) and others will be additional Add-Ons that you can pledge extra funds for and select in the post-campaign pledge manager.

campaign.story:
Designed by Rory (11), Ben (8) and Dad Jon (45), The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is the latest installment in the Forest Dragon Story. We hope you’ll come along for the ride!
The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is a fast and fun game of keeping up with an ever-changing piece of music, played by a variety of characters on a variety of characterful instruments from the world of The Forest Dragon.
The musicians gather at crossroads and campfires across the forest. They produce their instruments, tune up and begin to play! They play tunes both weird and wonderful, with many a twang and bang from their array of amazing musical implements. As the tunes get faster and more complicated, the musicians wrestle to keep up and challenge each others’ musical ability.
With amazing art from Rory, Ben, and with just a little help from their dad, games-industry veteran Jon Hodgson, The Forest Dragon Bang & Twang is a fast and exciting game for the whole family!
The Forest Dragon centres around 3 special cards. On one side they have “Bang” and on the other, they have “Twang”.
There’s also a deck of 24 other cards, from which players draw a hand of 2 cards. Players must try to match the sequence shown on those special “riff” cards with the cards in their hand. They can flip one of the riff cards, or they can move one of them. If they can match a riff they "bank" that card. Or they can play a special card that has special effects. 
A round of play takes around ten minutes, and play moves around the table nice and fast!

We’ve made the game so there’s almost always something to do on your turn, so no one gets left out. And for younger players, you can just play along and have an enjoyable time. For older players though, there’s a lot more strategy - remembering who has “banked” what card, and deciding which of the possible moves is the best one on your turn adds a lot more depth.
There are 8 special cards in the Bang & Twang deck, and these cards form “the tune”. If you want to change the tune for the next game, you can take out those 8 special cards, and replace them with a different set! This makes gameplay really varied!
Bang & Twang features 6 sets of special cards - 6 “tunes”, and totals 67 cards in the box!
You can download a print and play version of Bang & Twang right now! It doesn’t have art - we’ve kept it very simple for home printing, but you can try out the first “tune”, absolutely free! Download it here: https://www.dropbox.com/
In 2016 we Kickstarted our first game together. The Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9 proved to be a huge success. We raised way more support than we expected, and doubled the size of the game through the campaign! It was an amazing ride!
The Forest Dragon was created by Rory when he was 7. He’d been thinking about games, and described the whole thing in pretty much one breath. We wrote it down and slowly over a couple of years turned it into a playable game. And with your help on Kickstarter we made it into a reality. You can buy our first game in selected stores and on line.
Clearly, this isn't really just about making another game. I want my kids, Rory and Ben to continue to learn about hard work, games design, probability, art, layout, writing rules, product design, costings and all kinds of things that are good to learn about. 
Making a game with them has been a way to show them a creative path, and how the whole world around them is someone's idea put into practice. With this second game, we’re learning about sticking with something, persistence, and all the trials and pitfalls of making that second game. Can we do it? We think so!
I really want to show the boys the reality of how games get made, and all the different processes involved. With Bang & Twang, we’re learning about what it means to make an “intellectual property” and how we approach a line of games, rather than just one game. 
Our first game was made with print on demand technology that let us order one game for each person that backed us. This time we’d like to try to go one further and make a full print run of the game, and get it deeper into more shops around the world! If we fund, it means we’ll make the game through print on demand once again. And we’ll be very happy with that. But if we can reach some of our stretch goals, we’ll be able to make a more fancy box, and do a whole print run, which will be a big learn for the boys! (Dad has made many such boxed games in his day job, so you’re in safe hands!)
To help build towards our goal we had some great Add-Ons. These are extra things you can pledge for. If you decide you’d like an Add-On, then up your pledge by the appropriate amount. You can pledge for them before they are unlocked if you wish - that will help them get unlocked.

If we do manage to unlock some of these Add-Ons we’ll make some new pledge levels that include them too, for your convenience.

All prices include shipping.
Bang & Twang Badge Set Add £5 to your pledge
You’ll get a cool selection of exclusive Forest Dragon goodies! 4 Forest Dragon badges, a cool round sticker, and a square fridge magnet!

The Forest Dragon By Rory Add £17 to your pledge
This is the game that started it all. The price includes shipping.
The Forest Dragon Expansion Box Add £17 to your pledge
 A selection of amazing expansions to the original Forest Dragon game! Includes The Poo Cave, Dogs and Stuff, Robo Realm, Fire Dragon Realm, Quest Givers!

Original Game Double Up! Add £30 to your pledge
Both the original Forest Dragon by Rory game AND the Expansion Box
Bang & Twang Play Mat LOCKED Add £12 to your pledge
Currently locked, but with enough backers, it’ll become available! A neoprene play mat that makes a lovely space to hold the riff cards and the draw deck. It’s 13 inches square making it large enough to use the coasters on too! It’s like a mouse mat but bigger and cooler!
Bang & Twang Coasters Add £5 to your pledge
AVAILABLE NOW! These are adorable! Replace the Riff cards you get in your Bang & Twang Box with a set of 3 Bang & Twang Coasters! 
Bang & Twang Coins Add £12 to your pledge
AVAILABLE NOW! The Bang & Twang coins are something very special - a strictly limited edition set of real metal coins, with gorgeous enamel colours - green on one side, orange on the other. Made by the coin experts at Campaign Coins these are really amazing. They come in a set of three, and are perfect to replace the riff cards in the Bang & Twang box for the fanciest game imaginable!
Burp & Fart LOCKED Add £15 to your pledge
Currently locked, but with enough backers, it’ll become available! This is basically disgusting. One of our playtesters who is old enough to know better suggested the whole game could be re-skinned as “Burp & Fart”. This will feature the adorable “Greedy Boys” characters sat in a ditch, holding a burping and farting contest. If we unlock this stretch goal we’ll make a whole new base game available as an Add-On. It will have the same rules, but all new, deeply ill-mannered card art. 
WARNING: Will contain pictures of burps and farts drawn by giddy children.
Many of our fans are friends and family who don't know much about Kickstarter. Thanks for making it this far! We love you!
Kickstarter is a website that allows project creators with an idea to pitch that idea to the audience of the Internet. There's usually a product at the heart of a Kickstarter campaign. In this case, it's the Bang & Twang game. 
If people like the idea they can pledge money to the project. If enough money is pledged in order to meet the campaign's funding goal by the end, the money is collected from your card by Kickstarter, they take a cut, and the rest is passed on to the creator. And the project is made a reality. If we don’t raise enough pledges no one gets charged. And we go away to think very hard about what we did wrong. 
To encourage and thank supporters, or "backers" as they are known, we are offering a range of Rewards and Add-Ons. These start out at the game itself, and you can get more stuff like artwork, your own expansions and more!
Another encouragement to spread the word and convince others to join in, are Stretch Goals. These are milestones which unlock extra rewards. Sometimes they allow backers to buy something new, by upping their pledge. Other times they add something to existing rewards for free. 

Throughout the period of the campaign, you can amend your pledge up and down as you see fit. Only once the campaign ends is the amount you pay locked in. So it pays to keep an eye on progress, and pledge for everything you'd like!
If you have any questions at all, please drop me (Jon) a line via PM, email, text or whatever method suits you best, and I’ll do my best to explain how to back us! Don’t be shy, we understand that Kickstarter can be daunting if you’ve never used it.
To pledge to our campaign you need to hit the Pledge button. You'll sign up to an account, decide how much you'd like to pledge, select what kind of reward you'd like - you can choose to just give to the campaign out of kindness, or you can select what you'd like to receive for your support. We'd love you to have a copy of the game.
You can throw in whatever you like above the basic pledge levels - there aren't fixed amounts you have to give.
You'll provide some payment details and, if enough people chose to support us, at the end of the campaign your card will be charged. The project creators get in touch a short time after that to collect any additional information they might need.
Following a Kickstarter campaign is a lot of fun. A community of supporters is created, who can all share their excitement and support in the comments section, as well as ask questions or make requests of the project. You'll also receive updates throughout the campaign either here or by email.
For our second campaign we’re playing it very safe - the whole of the base game is done. 5 additional Expansions are completely made. With children helping to make the core reward we needed to know they'd be able to finish the project. And they have. We just need money for printing and shipping it to you. We are not spending any time after the campaign on further development, testing or art for the core game. It’s done. This does mean we won’t go much beyond 5 additional expansions, but we feel that’s the best and most honest way to do things. We have not yet completed work on the art and graphics for “Burp & Fart” but should we be lucky enough to unlock that stretch goal we’ll get it done as soon as possible! It won’t take long.
Stretch goals are each unlocked as we reach their milestone in our funding level. If we’re lucky we’ll reveal more as the campaign progresses!
£1500 This is our basic goal. At this level, we’ll make a print on demand version of the game in a nice tuck box and send it to you with our thanks. 
We’ll reveal more stretch goals if we do well!
Praise for the Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9
Don’t just take our word for it, here are some thoughts about our first game, The Forest Dragon by Rory Age 9: 
"The Forest Dragon is a precious thing, an experience Jon Hodgson and his son Rory will treasure for years to come. And it’s a fine game to boot! We’re so lucky they decided to share it with us." - Francesco Nepitello, game designer
“The Forest Dragon is as indispensable as wet wipes and snacks, and occupies a permanent place in my 'leaving the house with the kids' bag.” - Gareth Ryder Hanrahan, author, game designer 
"If you’ve ever experienced wonder while wandering and exploring, the Forest Dragon contains that excitement in a conveniently-carried, child-friendly card game." - Jacob Rodgers, game designer
“It's very easy to pick up and play the game, with enough depth in the game to keep kids of all ages entertained. At its heart, there's a marvelous whimsical adventure, which had my pair (an 8 and 11-year-old) coming back for more. I knew I was onto a winner when they were picking up the cards and having games without me :) ” - Newt Newport, game designer
“The most nutritious cardgame I have ever eaten!” - Patric Götz, game publisher 
"Our Forest Dragon card game has (literally) been to the base of Mount Doom and to Hobbiton, entertained plenty of adults and children along the trek and is an absolute joy to play." - Scott Purdy, artist
“It’s not a good game because it was written by a kid; it’s a good game because it’s a good game.” - Jared Earle, writer, photographer
“It's an awesome game which my kids love playing! Especially when they beat me at it!” - Gordon Kennedy, game artist

"With its bright colors, fun illustrations, and easy rules, The Forest Dragon became a fast favorite in our house. It is quick enough to learn to hold my children's attention and fun enough to appeal to adults as well." - August Hahn, game designer

"This game is amazing. I like stealing items from my family, especially my brother. We usually play with the whole pack to make the game really long and exciting, and my favourite bit is the Poo Portal!" - Milla aged 7.
"Both enchanting and hilarious, this simple-but-fun card game is already a favourite in our house. The artwork is delightful. The Poo Cave Expansion is essential. We've played it with small people and with my eighty-year-old parents. It's a winner with everyone. Gutted we missed out on Clarinetto." - Claire Longhurst, gamer

"So good I wrote a review of it"  - Pookie, game reviewer

"It’s funny and my wife likes it" - Adam Littlefield, musician

"I’ve so far only played it with adults, but they all loved it (and it wasn’t too complicated for them) 🙂" Andrew Peregrine, game designer

"Fantastic game. My kids have racked up over 200 hours playing this game. A family favourite that never get old! Highly recommended." - Wayne McNamara, gamer

"Such a simple game and great fun to play. That said, I’ve yet to win a game against my eight year old and his friends!" -Tom Cusworth, gamer
"The Forest Dragon is a great game. Attractive to look at, simple enough to play as soon as the box is open, but with enough variety to repay any number of repeat plays. And the monsters are very cool." - Matt Cambridge, writer
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve successfully made our first game and delivered it to people all around the world. 

We're keeping things very simple. We have our game completely planned, made and costed. Everything is already completed at a digital level, except the Burp & Fart reskin. Everything will be ready to start printing at the end of the campaign. 

Like every kickstarter creator, we’re a bit worried about shipping - the price of moving stuff around the world can change a LOT in a short time. We hope we've done our sums right.

Where we print the game will depend on how well we do. If we fund at a lower level it will be printed in the UK. If we manage to unlock the fancier version it will be printed in Europe, and dispatched worldwide from the UK.

We want to deliver in a timely fashion, using processes we understand, even if that means a lower final figure. We’re ok with this. We will not be adding any new stretch goals beyond those in our plan.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
As previously mentioned hereabouts, we were expecting our Bang & Twang Riff Coins on the 5th of March. But they were delivered TODAY and they look awesome! 
We've packed them all up, and they're ready to head out to you! We'll be dispatching over the next few days.

Yo Bangers & Twangers,
Good news!
Almost all Bang & Twang games have now been dispatched, wherever you live! 
We're starting to see UK copies arrive - we've been delighted to see photos from backers Megan, Tom and Newt of their shiny new games.

Hello!
This one is a bit region specific, but we like to keep you in the loop.
All UK rewards have been dispatched! I was going to explain that I'd dropped the last batch off at the post office, but just this second I got notification they've all been processed, so they are officially en route. We sent a ton on Saturday, and the remainder this morning, so watch your mail box over the next few days!
Our print run of Bang & Twang has arrived!
Hello!

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter Promos and Print Run Delivery Date
updates.update_content:
Hello!
We have our delivery date from the printer, and it's the 22nd of February. So we'll get dispatching as soon as they arrive. If we can work fast, lucky UK people might see their copies before the end of the month!
Here's a quick run down on the other stuff from the campaign:

Greetings Bangers and Twangers!
We got some samples of our black ink card revisions (pictured below) the other day, they look great, zero blurriness, and so today we hit the print button! (Metaphorically. In actuality we just sent most of the KS money to the printer, but it as the same basic effect!)
This means in 3 weeks or so we should take delivery of the print run, and despatch begins!

Hello!
In our last update you may have seen that I had a little query on the crispness of the white text on the cards. The printers have been excellent to work with on this, and we've taken the decision to switch to a darker text, just to ensure consistency throughout the deck. 
I loved the white text against those colourful cards, but we're going to err on the side of readability and consistent standards using the print process we have at hand. Which is the right thing to do, we believe!

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Kickstarter campaign for Goregasm Arena - A Brutal Blood Sport in a Weird Wasteland! With your help I will bring my new game to your tabletop. 
Goregasm arena is a game of fast paced gladiatorial combat for 2 - 4 players, set in the crazy Post-Nuclear world of Wasteman. 
You can download the rulebook for free here 
In the desolate future desperate times call for desperate entertainment! Goregasm Arena pits the hardiest denizens of the nuclear wastelands in brutal gladiatorial combat. Strike, shunt, and tackle the competition into submission, asserting your dominance of the alter square in this fast and brutal game. Wrestle for the adoration of the crowd by stomping your opponents into a bloody pulp and reap the rewards (or lament the disastrous consequences) when you spin the wheel. Will you claim the glory in the arena?
Players take it in turns to control miniature combatants, spending adrenaline to perform actions such as strikes, shunts, and tackles in an attempt to gain glory points and whittle down their opponents meat points. Adrenaline only regenerates slowly, so players must be careful not to be caught out after an epic bout of athletic prowess! 
Scream with delight while your foes squeal with pain as they draw awfully brutal injury cards as a result of your critical strikes!
Combatants will inevitably be called to face the crowd with the wheel, where the unpredictable nature of their fans comes to life with fantastic bonuses or treacherous hazards.    
Each box of Goregasm arena comes with the following:
The Miniatures - 35mm scale cast in high quality Resin. Supplied unpainted.
 4 Combatant miniatures and 4 Totems, cast in gorgeous high quality resin. Each miniature is supplied unpainted and in a single piece. 
16 Page, wonderfully illustrated A5 rule book
1 Arena Game board 
1 Spinner wheel
4 Large Tracker cards
28 Injury mini cards
4 Signature mini cards
12 Tracker tokens (design to be confirmed)
4 10-sided dice
  Arena Board and Glory Trackers
The Wheel, Injury cards, Signature cards, and dice
Here are some great add ons to enrich your Goregasm experience!
To add these to your reward simply add the amount shown in the corresponding swag bag image to your pledge. Please add the funds to your pledge during the campaign. Shortly after the kickstarter has finished I will send a survey to find out which specific sets you wanted.
Come complete with unique Signature cards
Come complete with new rules and Signature cards
Providing I exceed my goal I have loads more fighters, add ons and extras planned! These will become available to add to your pledge once the following goals have been exceeded.
Wasteman is my first game, and the home of the universe which spawned Goregasm Arena. A frantic skirmish wargame set amongst the ruins of a neglected and scorched earth where players engage in desperate battles between post-humans, hideous monstrosities and killer robots over the dregs of an age of gluttony. Take control of you own syndicate and test your mettle against the weird and terrifying denizens of the wastes!
Fun, easy to learn, and refreshingly crazy, players or 'comrades' control syndicates, typically comprised of between 5 and 20 ruthless denizens of the wastes, in an attempt to vanquish their opponent, survive bizarre encounters and/or capture much needed supplies.  
To find out more and check out the abundant range of figures to populate your wasteland go to www.tcminiatures.co.uk
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my seventh Kickstarter campaign. It's been a journey full of important lessons, all of which I have applied to this campaign. Delays in manufacturing are usually the main cause for delays, especially if I end up doing dramatically better than I expect. The same goes for packing and posting, as I do all of that myself. I've taken steps in the design of the game to keep the impact of those minimal, and have been working closely with my caster to prepare. 

It's worth noting that international customers may encounter unexpected import taxes and/or delays in customs. Sadly these can be fairly unpredictable. You can contact your customs department for more information.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Well - not much progress I am afraid.  I now have the MDF boards.
The masters for all models are being moulded but to be honest I have been focused on sorting out the even older Kickstarter for Radtown ruins.
The good news is Radtown is closing in on completion.
I will use the same model for this kickstarter that I used for that one.  Its been so long since this Kickstarter went off you may find you don't all want the same things you wanted 2 years ago.

Hi everyone is Jamie from Oldschool Miniatures here
finally i have full access to this kickstarter.
So, news.  Last week we finally started to upload wasteman minis to www.osminis.co.uk the revenue from these sales is vital to funding the production of the Gorgasm miniatures.  The minis are on offer until Sunday with 30% off and all are in stock and will be shipped the same week.

Hey guys,
Once again I'm really sorry about the lack of updates.
In short I should have a better idea of what's going on after I've spoken to my Hobgoblin Business partner Jamie, hopefully this week - I've not seen him since the start of the pandemic and he's been so busy with his day job and home-schooling that we've not been able to talk properly.

Hi guys,
First up I'm sorry this update is so long overdue. Some of the subject matter has been pretty difficult for me to write, though don't worry, the project is still active. Though obviously there have been some delays. 
The short version - My ill health, and the volume  of casting I've needed to do myself since the original manufacturer went out of business, and now closing our workshop due to the pandemic, has lead to some delays. I was hoping I could get everything 100% done by October, but as I'm not sure when we'll be able to safely open the workshop again I'm a little reluctant to commit to a date at the moment.

Hey guys,
First off sorry for such a long gap in updates! I've been really busy setting up the new casting studio/ getting used to the new workload, and just haven't had much of a chance to sit down at the computer. This definitely doesn't mean I haven't been making progress though, as those of you in the wasteman facebook group will know - So some of what I've been up to:

Hi Gorefans!
The Goregasm Arena Survey is now up - Please fill this in asap, as this will give me definite numbers for production, as well as your delivery address so I can post your pledge out to you.

Thank you! Thanks to your support Goregasm Arena will now become a brutal reality! 
In a couple weeks I will be sending a survey to find out what you pledged for, then over the next few months I will keep you updated on the production, sculpting, printing etc. But right now I'm going to take a couple days off to recompose myself and catch up on some sleep!
In the mean time give the rulebook a read and join the conversation in the wasteman facebook group!

campaign.story:
Welcome to Litchmyre Dungeon, the home of a new range of detailed resin and metal fantasy miniatures, which ooze nostalgia and classic goodness. Zealot is back with our third Kickstarter, bringing to life this new range, with our usual reputation for quality and jaw-droppingly detailed miniatures.
Back in 2014 we created a new level of Dungeon scenery, using digital production methods and detailed vacuum casting. Then last year, we breathed new life into a too-long forgotten fantasy race, the Minotaurs, which we are finishing the delivery of now - with delighted backers praising the detail and quality.
This time, we wanted to go back to our roots and tackle real heroes and villains, characters which capture our imaginations and make us remember why we started gaming or collecting.
We are heavily inspired by classic RPG games; playing old fantasy games from the 80s is what started all this madness in the first place!
So welcome to a fusion of past and present, new and old. We are updating, modernizing and offering to you, this range of high quality miniatures traditionally sculpted by the awesome miniature artist, Boris Woloszyn.
If you like what you see; Read on, brave adventurer.
 We don't produce board game counters, these are not PVC pencil toppers, injection moulded in china  - we make Miniatures. Resin and Metal, these are produced the same as they were 30 years ago, cutting no corners and not skimping on quality or detail. It's not the fastest or cheapest process, but it certainly is the best. If you want Miniatures which you will cherish and still want to use in another 30 years time, then these are for you.
 We have teamed up with Boris Woloszyn, a traditional putty sculptor from Brazil, these models are made by hand, no 3D printing involved (unusually for us!). Boris has a real talent as an artist, able to bring true character to each sculpt, I'm sure you will agree.
These models are heavily inspired by the classic games we grew up loving and playing with our families and friends. Just take a look at the greens, all made from putty.
Production of Boris's sculpts is done in three materials, Standard Resin, White Metal and Premium Resin. As we unlock each material in the stretch goals, you will have a choice to add which material you want.
Standard Resin is one for the gamer, it is on par with a lot of other companies' resin materials, the details are good but the resin is not as tough and flexible as the Premium offering. There will be more splits and parts for each model when they are produced in this material.
White Metal, that fabled shiny material which is fondly remembered by older gamers. When your army weighed more than a cinder block and dropping a Dragon model on your toes resulted in a trip to the hospital.
It's for the gamer or painter who wants a shot of nostalgia, feeling the weight in their hands. The details are good, the models are tough and it paints well. White metal does have more gates and vents to clean up from the model than resin models.
Premium Resin is really a superior resin. It requires very few gates and vents, has a nice matte surface to paint, has 0.2% shrinkage and captures every detail of the original sculpt perfectly. It is tougher than Standard Resin with some flex to avoid damage. It cuts and files well when cleaning the model up or converting.
Premium resin is the material for the serious painter or collector.
 All of the pledges you can supplement with "Add Ons" from the section below.
Miniatures come in three tiers 'Hero Sized', 'Mighty Sized' and 'Monstrous Sized'. Green, Blue and Yellow Dots respectively.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, Forgotten Halls
You can add to your pledge with any of the following packs. Just increase your pledge by the amount needed.
To see each scenery piece in better detail, you can view them in our store by clicking here.
Here is a gallery for each of the core Miniatures, stretch goal models can bee seen in the section below. The coloured dot on each image, indicates if they are "Hero Sized", "Mighty Sized" or "Monstrous Sized".
Each model will come with a standard Plastic Round Base or Classic Rectangle base, as shown in the pictures. You can make your selection on the Pledge Manager after the campaign closes.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, 3DBases
 As funding progresses we will unlock stretch goals and extra miniatures. Below you can see what has been unlocked and what is the next goal coming up. The coloured dot on each image refers to the size. Green "Hero Size", Blue "Mighty Size" and Orange "Monstrous Size".
We are splitting the production into three tiers with the three types of material on offer. This should allow us to deliver to our deadlines as the load on each manufacturing method is reduced. Currently we have marked July 2019 as the delivery for this project. 
Since this is a traditionally sculpted project, Boris requires around 1 week to complete each additional sculpt, depending on how many stretch goals are unlocked, this could take a fair few months for him to complete the sculpting. You cant rush this kind of art!
If this is the case and we hit a lot of the planned stretch goals, we are happy to offer a split dispatch option, where the core models are dispatched early - since they are already in moulds and not far off mass production. There will be no problem delivering core models before the dispatch date.
Then the stretch goal sculpts will follow some months later in wave 2.
Due to the manufacture method of vacuum cast resin and spincast metals, dispatch date will depend a lot on amount that we fund. We will update this section once funding is underway and we have a better idea for how popular this will be. We do dispatch on a rolling backer ID system.
It may be possible to dispatch Standard Resin core miniatures ahead of the predicted delivery date.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, 3DBases
MAXIMUM Postage Costs
These are the MAXIMUM postage costs for a large pledge. For example a pledge of 50 models in White metal would be these values. 50 models in resin, the postage is around half these values.
Postage costs start at the values which are stated on each pledge (£3 UK, £4 EU and £5 Rest of World) If you add more models and Add ons, postage costs will increase with weight. The end postage will be calculated by the pledge manager after the campaign end.
Please note, metal models are around 4 times as heavy as resin.
The end postage costs will be calculated on the Pledge Manager, but they will not exceed the postage values in the table below. These include tracked and signed for shipping.
By Adam Skinner
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We will produce a new range of quality resin and metal Heroes and Monsters. The risks to this project are very minimal. We do this kind of production, every day for 8 years, producing miniatures for many high profile companies. All the core set of models are already ready to start mass manufacture. 

We are not new to Kickstarter; our first Kickstarter was a colossal project ~200k resin cast pieces.
We delivered it and it was highly praised that "the quality was beyond amazing" and the detail was "phenomenal". Certainly achieving what we set out; to bring a new level of cutting edge dungeon scenery to gamers.
Our second project, the Minotaur Horde, we are on track to deliver the last few hundred backers inside the next 2 months, and again the feedback was overwhelmingly positive by everyone receiving their pledge. 

Risk#1: Speed of manufacture.
Resin and Spincast Metal are labor intensive materials to cast with. If there are many stretch goals which we hit, then Boris will need more time to sculpt them. This will push back the start of manufacture. 

While there will be no problem delivering the core models by the estimated date. If the project funds well and many goals are hit - then we will offer a split shipping option, so core models are delivered on time, then stretch goal models get delivered in a wave 2 a few months later. 

Aside from the risk of delayed dispatch of stretch goals, the risks are very minimal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: W2 All in Production . Progress update 21st May
updates.update_content:
Greetings there Dungeon Dwellers! It's about time for a Dungeon update. Even though the world seems to be grinding to a halt and nobody can hold a conversation for longer than 5 minutes without mentioning Covid19 - we are still working away in the dungeon, casting and mould making. There has been some supply issues, staffing issues and more stress than usual this month. But compared to other companies, we really cant complain too loudly.
I know it is almost a cliche by now; but after 3 big fantasy model kickstarters, we really appreciate all of you who come to support us, more than ever. From all of us at Zealot we wish you all the best, to you and your families, during these challenging times.

campaign.story:
WHO DOESN'T LOVE ORCS AND GOBLINS RIGHT? 
 Those ever present mischievous murderous little rascals and their big stupid brutish cousins go a'rampaging all over the Auld World just often enough that adventurers always have something to do and always show up in significant numbers that your heroes get a good muscle building / skill developing song worthy workout in the process. And these heroes really NEED some awesome enemies to fight right? After all what is a hero without a worthy foe? Tooooo right! NOT VERY MUCH!!
RED BOX GAMES makers of finely detailed, exquisitely designed and expertly sculpted 28 mm traditional western fantasy miniatures presents;
And here they are all gussied up and ready to smash bash and thrash fool hearty would be adventurers painted by Sebastin Picque at DEad Fish Painting with pics granted by the very generous collector who commissioned them from Seb. You can check out more of Seb's awesome body of work on facebook at https://www.facebook.com/DeadFishPainting/?ref=br_rs
  SCALE REFERENCE PICTURE!!!!
   pictured below from left to right RBG Orc, Reaper Orc ( sculpted by me as well ) and a GW Orc ( which wasn't sculpted by me but maybe might have liked to have been )
 Hey look at that!!
   With your generous support and encouragement we hope to fund the production of a boxed set of fearsome beasties fit to harrow your favorite adventuring heroes in primeval forests old and dark and shadowy dungeons dark and deep. 
    Amoungst these burly brutes and sneaky scamps you'll find;
    2 modular Orc Warriors fitted for universally interchangeable legs ( 2 ) right hands with sword or axe ( 2 ) left hands with weapon or shield ( 2 ) and helmeted heads ( 2 ) repeated TWICE for a total of  4 modular figures
    2 Modular Orc Brutes fitted for universally interchangeable legs ( 2 ) bared heads ( 2 ) and weapon options Sword or Mace ( 2 )  repeated TWICE for a total of 4 modular figures.
    2 Runty Goblin Archers cast in a single piece with short bows at the ready repeated TWICE for a total of 4 figures.
    2 Runty Goblin Spearmen cast in a single piece with crudely wicked Spears ready to puncture adventurers repeated TWICE for a total of 4 figures.
     2 Runty Goblin Warriors cast in a single piece with battered rusty swords just perfect for cleaving and cutting hapless passers by! Repeated TWICE for a total of 4 figures.
     All this in one box for the low low price of $40.00 USD! 
     We ALSO have Orcs only Horde boxes where in you will find 16 Orc bad asses just FROTHING at the maw to rend and slash, and bash and smash for the super awesome price of just $40.00 USD
     Aaaaaand cause yall asked for it!! A Goblins only horde box where in you will find 24 of the filthy little rapscallions gnawing on each other's ears and licking their blades and just generally being a writhing mass of stinking pelt bound meanness ready to be unleashed upon those picturesque little hamlets a-scatter in your storybook la-la land. Also for JUST $40.00 USD.
     See? Not much math stuff, lots of Orcs and Goblins. Who needs them book learnin talkie times anyways? Not Gobbers and Orcsies don't.
     It is our hope that as the campaign progresses we can add items to the offering and perhaps to the initial box contents as well HOWEVER as this is our first effort in plastic manufacturing we want to be sure we are responsible and take this slowly keeping everything nice and predictable and efficiently produced and delivered. So there will only be a few additions to this campaigns. We don't want to get too ahead of ourselves with promises but we also want to make sure we make the most of this campaign that we can. You CAN NOT go wrong with more and more monstrous beasties eh?

    Please be aware you can buy as many of these boxes as you want! Personally I don't think any orc or goblin warband is complete unless it nearly breaks the shelves under it's ponderous weight when stowed away between sessions of rampaging blood thirst. 
   If you want to add to your rewards you can do so by managing the amount of your pledge upward by enough to cover the addition of as many green hellions your heart desires. 
  And remember a forest without goblins under every hedge is just not a forest worth trodding through for any self respecting adventurer! And what would goblins do once they DID grab the attention of those hapless Adventuring jerks without their trusty overgrown and significantly less intelligent cousins the Orcs! Big hulking murderous brutes just FROTHING at the mouth to rip into a nice shiny suit of plate mail to get to the squishy red gooey center!!!
  HEY! Yes. YOU! You want to look TOTALLY awesome?! of course you do. ESPECIALLY when looking awesome means wearing a truly kick ass Face of the Orc God T-shirt. No stupid logo. Just an awesome Cave drawing of a screaming horned savage Beastie who strikes fear into the hearts of all who cross his path. You too can borrow a bit of that thunder. Just buy this T-shirt. Wear it proudly. When people ask you where you got that piece of awesomeness Growl! Laugh! Maybe slap yourself in the face a few times and beat your chest and say YOU are a proud contributor to the Red Box Games Hordes of the Auld World Orcs and Goblins kickstarter campaign!
  available in men's sizes S M L XL XXL XXXL XXXXL and XXXXXL
  Want one? All you need to do is add $25.00 to your pledge and you too can look totally awesome in command of your Orcses and Gobbers!
  Your characters are heroes! MIGHTY adventurers! They DESERVE awesome enemies to fight! the theatre of your imagination DESERVES fantastic minis! YOU. NEED. THE HORDES OF THE AULD WORLD ORCS AND GOBLINS BOXED SET!!
   The whole idea of this kickstarter is to fund the production of these fantastic monstrosities in high detail hard grade PVC plastic similar to many of the newly beloved board games recently hitting the market like a spiked ball of steel in the gnarly green fist of a feral Orc berserker rampaging through the ranks of silly tights wearing doods who spend all their time preening their poofy feathered hats and shining their armor and dancing with their little swishy poke " swords " and singing songs about damsels and wine and stupid stuff. Do we really want those kinds of doods in charge of stuff and ruining our good time? No. No we do not. We want Orcs and goblins. Lots of them. That is why plastic is good; cause we can make a LOT of them and sell them cheap.

  So to help us do this well we need your help to allow us to pay the high cost of plastic production with tried and true manufacturers who have produced many of these exact same great boxed game projects.
   Ok this is serious. Shipping is important and can be costly depending upon where in the world you need your stuff to be delivered to. Because we do not know exactly when the project will complete production we cannot bill for postage until the product is actually in hand and ready to deliver. We are working to build a base frame of reference for the shipping costs and we are also working to establish relationships that may allow us to ship from hubs in various parts of the world to mitigate those costs. 
   We will work to keep the postage costs as low as possible cause we don't really want to make money from shipping we just want to get your stuff to you as soon as possible cause once you know you have orcs and goblins on the way.... well they just need to get there fast and cheap right? 
   For now though the only region in which we can reasonably project postage costs is the US. We will be shipping orders via priority mail so as long as your stuff fits into a priority box ( and we will be working to make sure that they do ) you can expect to pay the priority mail shipping rates.
And Say! If you like all this snazzy artwork we have here you should check out Dave's artwork over on his facebook page https://www.facebook.com/Zhu-Industries-765057203635151
And Hey! If you want to check out our existing catalog you can follow this link here to view the Red Box Games body of work currently available! All of these figures are going to be cast in metal with the exception of just a small few of the larger pieces being cast in resin.
http://red-box-games.com/index.php?main_page=index&cPath=19&zenid=c6fd084e9c502403d9131d5312484211
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My name is Tre Manor. I have been in the miniatures industry since 2006 launching my own business in 2008. I have a significant amount of experience in producing resin and metal figures having produced some 300 odd figures over the past 10 years of being in business for myself. I also have a good deal of experience running and delivering on kickstarters having run and delivered successfully on 11 of them since 2012. I DO NOT however have any experience in the production of plastic miniatures. I have never dealt directly with Chinese production firms nor handled the importation of goods from China. However I AM in contact with competent advisors on these subjects and I have contacts and quotes from reliable and proven Chinese manufacturing firms who have a proven record for delivery and professional service and exemplary quality.

All of that said there are aspects of both production and delivery that go wrong in the production of plastic miniatures and the importation there of. Delays in production, delays in shipment, delays in customs. All of these can be factors in the course of the fulfillment of the campaign as well as changes in the actual product as it goes through the process of plastic production.

We will be actively working to insure this campaign runs as smoothly as possible and that the product delivered is a quality product.

You as a backer need to bear in mind though that by pledging your support to this campaign you are taking on a degree of risk that the end product may be different than the product shown in the campaign or that delivery may take longer than projected. We will always work to be sure you are as satisfied as we are able to but we cannot offer refunds once the funding for the campaign is secured post kickstarter. If you pledge to this campaign you are here by acknowledging that you accept that we cannot offer refunds of pledges.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Goblins Trolls and Wolves!!! Oh my!!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everybody!
 I have just released my newest work in the Red Box Games store. Currently on pre order status these new releases will begin shipping around the 22nd of March I have a new set of goblin warriors accompanied by a goblin thief a goblin hunter and two goblin shaman perfect for an intrepid adventure into the ruins of the Cold North. These Goblins are accompanied by two faithful Wolves.....err well....wolves who have not decided to eat them yet, and three Trolls. The figures are all single piece figures cast in high quality lead free white metal but the trolls each have universally interchangeable weapon types and one of the trolls has an optional shield included as well. I have also created a bundle deal that gets you all of the new releases for 20% off RRP but this bundle deal is strictly limited in quantity to 75 so once those are sold the bundle will no longer be available.

  For those who may not recognize these that is an RBG orc on the left, a Reaper Orc in the middle and a GW Orc on the right.

campaign.story:
It's been a hell of a ride!
Welcome, welcome, one and all, to the first ever Warp Team Fantasy Football Kickstarter! 
WTFF is a brand new range of unique and distinctive miniatures to use in your Fantasy Football games. Each model has been hand sculpted, and is cast in the finest white metal and resin. My goal is to make sure that every single WTFF miniature is packed full of character, is a joy to paint, and will look suitably splendid on your table top.
So grab your popcorn, break out your beverages, and take your seats. Whilst we wait for the match to start, how's about we look at our first plucky team to take to the pitch...
Cast in Metal (TEAM PLAYER) or Fine Resin (GOLDEN BOOTS)
Add any of the miniatures in the Team to your pledge
Human model is for size comparison only and is owned by Games Workshop
 Ram Raiders review by The Wargamer Viking
 Why are there only a few stretch goals?  
Kickstarter is an interesting beast, as all of us know from experience. Countless times people get involved in long, extensive campaigns only to wait months, sometimes years for them to be fulfilled. When the crowd bays for more, it's tempting to give in and offer far more products than you can deliver in the time frame promised at the start of the campaign!
In the past I've ran a few of those types of campaigns, and this time I have decided to keep it short and sweet. This means fewer products for you all to buy, but a much shorter time for you all to wait before your lovely models are on your painting desk. Which we can all agree, is exactly where they ought to be.
Kickstarter Launch Hangout!
The cost of shipping is not included in your pledge, and will be added after the conclusion of the campaign through the pledge manager. I will provide you all with full instructions when the time comes.  
I am still finalising the exact shipping costs, but to give you a rough idea here are a couple of preliminary estimates:
GAME DAY TICKET: - £0 unless used to purchase miniatures in the campaign.
MICKEY'S PICK: - £2 to the UK, £4 EU and £4 ROW.  
TEAM PLAYER/GOLDEN BOOTS: £3.50 to the UK, £7 EU and £7 ROW.  
These estimates may increase if you purchase a large number of additional models on top of your core pledge, especially at the MICKEY'S PICK or DAY TICKET level.
The final shipping costs are subject to change, and will be based on your location and specific rewards.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any undertaking of this nature is a huge commitment and a lot of work for everyone involved. Miniatures need sculpting, manufacturing, packing and eventually shipping to the backers.

It is at these hurdles that some Kickstarters have faltered in the past, so, I have given careful consideration to each part of the process to minimise potential risk. Warploque Miniatures is a family run business, so everyone involved is 100% dedicated to making this project as successful and professional as possible. My father is our resin caster, my mother is in charge of packing and shipment, and our metal caster is a tried and tested person we have worked with before.

Also, instead of relying purely on concept art and work-in-progress sculpts to illustrate my products, all of the initial models that I am offering have already been sculpted. They've been cast, the display copies have been painted, and they are ready to go into production, so backers know exactly what they are investing in.

To ensure the campaign runs smoothly I will be working on it full-time, and will ensure that all your questions will be answered and updates will posted at all hours.

Finally, I have set achievable delivery date estimates. I have kept the campaign small and manageable, eschewing the long list of stretch goals that other campaigns have had, so this project has a much higher probability of being completed and delivered on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Ho there, Arc Fans!
The next WTFF team, the Squeaky Blinders, is LIVE!

Ho there, Sports Fans!
Hope you've got enough cheese, because the Ratmen are preparing to take to the WTFF pitch!

updates.update_userinfo: Missing Pledge managers - Why don't you want your Halflings? :'(
updates.update_content:
Ho there, Sports Fans!
I hope you are all well. I've been receiving lots of lovely messages from all of you who have received your models! I hope they bring you much joy, and that they aren't too rubbish on the pitch ;)
This is a public service announcement to those of you who have, even now, not got your pledge managers back to me...

Ho there, Sports Fans!
I have a very important, and very exciting announcement...
The Ram Raiders Kickstarter has been shipped!
You heard it, folks. In less than 2 months we at Team Warploque have managed to get the entire project manufactured and packed. So everyone who got their pledge managers in to me on time, your models are already on their way!

Ho there, Sports Fans!
I hope you've all been well. I bring good tidings and even better news!
We've now received all of the models for the Kickstarter! Our casters have been hard at work, and I am pleased to tell you that on Wednesday next week I'm hopping on the train back home to Yorkshire to start packing up your orders 😊

updates.update_userinfo: Thanks for getting your Pledge Managers in!
updates.update_content:
Ho there, Sports Fans!
So I've done my final count up... and 76 of you got your pledge managers in on time! 
Thanks guys, you really are wonderful. Gold stars for you all!
As for the 29 of you I'm still waiting for... tut tut tut. Sit in the naughty corner. You know who you are.
What happens now?

Ho there, Sports Fans!
I hope you are all well! 
Just a final reminded that today is the cut-off point for getting your pledge managers in to me. Everything is ready to go for casting, so a huge thank you to everyone who has already sent them in!

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge Managers are ready to go!
updates.update_content:
Ho there, Sports Fans!
I am pleased to announce that I have received all of your funds (and not a single dropped pledge, amazing!), so now for the good part – tell me what miniatures you would like!
The way to do this is very simple. To give you a hand, I've made a step-by-step guide on how to let me know your order.

updates.update_userinfo: They think it's all over... it is now!
updates.update_content:
Ho there, Sports Fans!
Well... that's it! The campaign is over, and it was an amazing success. Thank you so much to everyone who backed it, it's been such fun!
So, what happens now?
