campaign.story:
(c) Luo Yang, Beijing Couple, 2011
LUO YANG_GIRLS
This book comprises the most beautiful, disturbing and fascinating images from Luo Yang's internationally acclaimed series GIRLS (2007-2017), as seen on BBC, ARTE Journal or Huffington Post. 
Luo's GIRLS belong to a part of contemporary China that is rarely taken note of in the West. Her portraits depict an emerging Chinese subculture that defies imposed expectations and stereotypes: GIRLS are badassed and self-aware with a supreme sense of cool, yet also insecure, vulnerable and torn. Luo photographs the girls around her, attempting to grasp an understanding of their lives as well as her own. Although different, they share the same ambivalent emotions, confusions and concerns. It is in that connection that Luo finds the strength and fragility of her subject. 
“By shooting girls I understand their life better and it makes my own world bigger and wider. We might have different values and worldviews, but what we have in common are a fragility and braveness inside of us. We face the world with our sincerity.”  (Luo Yang)
Borne from this intuitive dialogue with her subjects, Luo’s images are bold and honest, intimate and sensitive at the same time. Her work explores the themes of youth and femininity, while challenging traditional beliefs about women in Chinese society. 
ABOUT US: LUO YANG & MO
Luo Yang, born 1984 in Liaoning Province in China's northeast, is a freelance photographer living and working in Beijing & Shanghai. One of the "rising stars of Chinese photography" (New Statesman, 2012), she has had numerous exhibitions in China and participated in major shows in Europe, amongst them Ai Weiwei’s “FUCK OFF 2” at the Groninger Museum, Netherlands, in 2013. Solo exhibitions in Berlin and Hong Kong have since contributed to her international recognition. In her work, highly staged portraits and carefully constructed poses alternate with a raw, blurred snapshot-aesthetic. She works with film cameras only, deliberately slowing down the creative process and focusing on a particular moment itself rather than on elaborating and refining an image in post-production.
MO-Industries is a POP-UP gallery staging cultural exchange between Asia and the West. It is a young venture that started at the end of 2015. Luo Yang and MO have been a team since the beginning of 2016, working closely on internationally showcasing Luo Yang's work, while scouting & introducing other exciting artists from China to the West (and vice versa).
Please support us in realising this beautiful project!
THE BOOK IN FACTS:
This compilation, published in a stunning silk-lined hardcover, is scheduled to be released by a renowned publishing house in Vienna in November 2017, reaching international bookstores in Spring 2018.  All texts are presented bilingually in English & Mandarin.
Hardcover (Printed Silk)
Size: 22.5 x 27.5 cm
Pages: ca. 160
Number of Images: ca. 80
Essay: ca. 4200 words by Eva Morawietz
Language: English / Mandarin
The Book's Cover: Detail of Luo's image "Xi Yuan" from 2017
"GIRLS"
(c) Luo Yang, Pi Pi, 2015
  (c) Luo Yang, Jin Jing, 2015
  (c) Luo Yang, Jiang Mi, 2011
    (c) Luo Yang, Jiang Mi, 2011
  (c) Luo Yang, Pi Pi (Highway), 2015
    (c) Luo Yang. Ro Ro, 2014
  (c) Luo Yang, Mao Er, 2017
  (c) Luo Yang, Xu La Di, 2017. The Chinese characters read "Carpe Diem"
  INTERNATIONAL PRESS on Luo Yang:
BBC NEWS: Photographer Luo Yang Captures China's New Generation of Girls
THE HUFFINGTON POST: Empowered Young Women Star in These Portraits of Chinese Girlhood
ARTE JOURNAL: Photographie: Les jeunes femmes de la Chine nouvelle
SPIEGEL ONLINE: GIRLS-Ausstellung von Chinesin Luo Yang
LE JOURNAL INTERNATIONAL: La photographe Chinoise Luo Yang brise la tradition 
IGNANT: Luo Yang Captures a New Generation of Chinese Women
MIRRORED SOCIETY: Luo Yang. An Exploration of the New Chinese Woman (great bilingual interview with Luo!)
STITCH: GIRLS - Luo Yang
JUXTAPOZ: Luo Yang's Photographs of Chinese Women Reveal Duality of Fragility and Inner Strength. 
FEATURESHOOT: Intimate and Defiant Portraits of GIRLS in Present-Day China
We would like to express our heartfelt thanks to LoReLi and Thilo Fuchs for creating wonderful video-footage of Luo at work!
(c) Luo Yang, The Cabinet, 2007
  Luo Yang
  Luo Yang & Eva Morawietz, Beijing 2017

Limited Edition of the book holding a Work-Print, plus mention of donor in the book.
What's a Work-Print??
Layout and printing process involve so-called "work-prints" which are created for inspection by the artist in order to ensure utmost color- and paper-quality. In this special edition of only 80 books, each copy will hold a unique work-print of ONE of the images featured in the publication!
Size of the work-print is circa A6 (= 10.5x14.8 cm or 4.13x5.83 inches). Each work-print will be signed by Luo Yang. You can choose your personal work-print in the order in which you place your pledge - so first come first serve :)
After the campaign is over, we'll provide you with a list of all images to choose from. Or you can let us know right away if a particular image caught your eye!
In addition, you will be mentioned in the book for your honorable contribution!
No shipping costs here!
(Limited to 80 copies in total, counting single pledges AND triple packages, pls. s. next pledge below)

campaign.story:
Over the last few years the World of Anyaral has continued to grow and expand as I have inevitably got carried away sculpting new characters and races for the world. In order to share rules for the new units I periodically release a small digital magazine called 'The Twilight Traveller' or individual Playtest Scrolls. The time has come to pull together all the new releases from the last couple of years into a new Compiled Traveller! I will also be producing an accompanying deck of cards so you can start playing straight away.
The Traveller returns
  This issue of the Compiled Traveller will include lots of new units! The magazine has a general focus on the Engineers of Anyaral, otherwise known as 'Rahkiri'. These eccentric individuals have been a part of Twilight ever since I first started exploring the world so I think it's about time they got a bit more attention! 
At the moment the magazine is 24 pages long and includes rules for:
Belomoch dre Hearn and his explosive automata
Belan Rider
Toloran Cavalry
Nobleguard Crossbow
Imperial Standard
The Pree Pree!
Dhogu Archer and Yirnak Captain
Tak Sirahn
The Yartain and pups
Koi-Koi and Jakiin
 As with the other Twilight Kickstarters I have chosen a suitably eccentric Fubarnii to guide the way: Belomoch dre Hearne. Belomoch was created as part of a previous Kickstarter as a thank you for my friends, Ben and Louise Trayhorn. 
Belomoch dre Hearn and his automata
 As tends to be the case with these random creations, he's thoroughly made his home in Anyaral. He is an eccentric engineer from the coastal region of Teral who at an early age (after blowing up a local garkrid resin refinery) was sent to one of the colleges of Larigal. He has spent the following years causing plenty of trouble while experimenting with explosives and the interactions between living creatures and mechanical devices.
Belomoch is included in the Tinkerer pledge for an extra £6 over the Traveller but will normally sell for £9 so it's a great opportunity to add him to your collection!
For this campaign I'm keeping the pledge levels very simple! You can do the basic pledge for the Compiled Traveller and the cards for £10 or get Belomoch as well as the book and cards for £16.
The Traveller (£10): A printed copy of the Compiled Traveller 2 and the associated deck of 16 reference cards
The Tinkerer (£16): Belomoch Dre Hearne with two automata, a printed copy of the Compiled Traveller 2 and the associated deck of 16 reference cards
The Newcomer (£100): Everything you need to start playing
There is a small additional charge for postage.
Note that all models are supplied unpainted.
 If you would like to add anything to your pledge, then just increase the pledge by the necessary amount. There will be a pledge manager at the end of the campaign so you can tell me what exactly you would like!
                                          If this is the first you've heard of Twilight and Anyaral then you've got a whole world to explore! There is a lot of background on the World of Twilight page about the Fubarnii Empire, the Delgon, the Dhogu, the Devanu and the Casanii. You can also check out the previous Kickstarter pages (Travels through Anyaral and Casanii of Anyaral).
You can download the first edition of the rules here, as well as early issues of the Traveller, which give a good idea of what to expect!
Tak Sirahn and Yartain
  Mike Thorp (The Creator): Mike has done most of the work creating the world of Twilight. He first started sketching the Fubarnii and Devanu over 15 years ago and since then he has taught himself to sculpt, written and playtested the game and self-published three books in order to bring the world to life.   
Joe Karame (The Painter): Over the last few years Joe has been bringing the metal and resin sculpts to life with beautiful paintjobs. Joe runs his own miniature business, Joek Miniatures which has become increasingly focused on his fantastic sci-fi Odyssey universe.
Twilight Helpers (The Minions): There are countless people who have helped me get this project up and running. Particular thanks goes out to Vivek Chandra, Louise and Ben Trayhorn, Paul Townsend and of course my ever-tolerant family (Jules, Lexie and Emily).
Nobleguard of Gar Loren
  Those of you who follow on Facebook will have seen a few hints about the upcoming Kedashi releases... I'll be giving them some proper attention with a full release next year, but I wanted to publish rules for all the other models before getting completely distracted in the Naralon Forests!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our experience on two previous projects and producing several books and magazines previously sets us in a good position to know what to expect with this small project.
The Traveller is largely written already so it is just a case of finishing the formatting, doing some more playtesting and getting it into print. The cards are following the standard design, so it's just the time consuming task of designing each of them!
The biggest risk is getting carried away with extra bits during the campaign, but the short timescale and targeted scope should make it easier to restrain myself!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I’m sure most of you are already aware, but over the last couple of weeks I’ve been involved in a very random little Kickstarter with JoeK miniatures. It has nothing to do with Anyaral, but we are now entering our final 24 hours and I hope you don’t mind me posting an update about it! Don't worry, there's some Twilight stuff later in the update...
The Caravan

I am excited to announce that registration for this year's Twilight Day is now open!
This year the Twilight Day will take place on Sunday 29th July and will once again be hosted in the Park Barn Centre in Guildford, UK. Tickets are £15

And we are done! We have now sent out all the Kickstarter pledges! 
It is great to have completed this third successful kickstarter and I would like to say one last thank you to you all for making this such a lot of fun to do!
I hope you all enjoy reading the traveller and playing games with the new figures and I'm looking forward to hearing more about your games and ideas. 
The 2018 Twilight Painting Contest!

Hi all,  
As many of you will have already seen, we are making great progress with dispatching all your pledges and fulfilment is almost complete!  
Twilight Central has been utter chaos for the last couple of weekends with piles of metal, resin and books, lots and lots of boxes, not enough tape (rectified now) and my two little girls ‘helping’ in their own special way. We have made several trips to the post office and managed to get nearly all of the parcels sent.

I have finally got nearly everything ready for sending out!  
I have all the books, cards postcards, inktober prints and most of the models ready to go. I am only waiting for a few final resin and metal casts, but we are pretty much in a position to start shipping - Woohoo!
The resin delay is my fault - I completely underestimated how many of you would like the plants and the Yartain families! Rob at Hysterical miniatures is working his little socks off to get enough cast, so I'm hoping to have more in time for next weekend when I can do the final push to get things shipped*.

As for progress? Everything is finally falling into place. All the models have been cast and are ready to go so it's just a case of finishing off formatting on the books and the cards and sending them to the printers.

campaign.story:
Two years ago, with the help of 3dtotal Publishing, I launched my first Kickstarter for The Art of Loish. To this day I’m still amazed by the support we received for that project. Thanks so much to everyone who helped us! 
When I was digging through old sketchbooks and digital art files for the first book, I found so many sketches, speed paints, and rough works that I wanted to share. Instead of squeezing them all into the first book, we felt that they warranted their own space, which is why we are launching this new campaign for The Sketchbook of Loish.
Sketches are particularly interesting due to their raw and expressive nature, and they give the viewer an insight into the artist’s unique creative process. This book will showcase my traditional and digital sketches, ranging from character sketches to environment speed paints. It will feature both old and new work, including exclusive artwork that will only be available through this book.  
My goal is not only to give insight into my creative process, but also to share my knowledge through tips and tutorials. It will contain resources for artists who are just starting out, and also for more experienced artists who want to learn more about my digital workflow and techniques.
Through this campaign, we will be offering a unique opportunity for backers to get signed and numbered copies of The Sketchbook of Loish, as well as the first art book (The Art of Loish), which you can get together as a bundle. There’s also a limited number of signed prints available, featuring exclusive artwork made just for this campaign.
All backers will be able to download a tutorial video that teaches my process for digital speed painting. Four speedy backers will also get the chance to buy a unique original sketch!     
Please note that the number of signed copies are limited and will no longer be available once these rewards run out! This campaign is the only opportunity to get this bundle of books, stretch goals and goodies. It will also be the only way to get copies of the book with the unique numbered certificate. However, after the campaign ends, The Sketchbook of Loish will be available through the 3dtotal online shop, Amazon and all good book retailers.  
My first book, The Art of Loish, turned out to be a huge success. Backers of the first campaign received the book in a beautiful mailing carton, along with a few awesome stretch goal rewards. 3dtotal Publishing has a history of fulfilling Kickstarter campaigns to a really high standard, and has established successful distribution methods. By teaming up with them, I am confident that can achieve the same high standard of service and delivery, and another fantastic art book with incredible extras for you to enjoy. 
For anyone who missed the Kickstarter for my first book, The Art of Loish, you can still buy a copy here.
Kickstarter gives us a special opportunity to thank those who make the book possible, by adding stretch goals and extras to the campaign. The more the campaign funds, the more unique items we can give the backers!  
Please note: Stretch goal rewards are not available to backers of tier 1 (the video-only tier).
3dtotal Publishing is able to ship worldwide! Simply select your favorite pledge option and your location, and Kickstarter will calculate the shipping for you!  
All shipping will be untracked. If you require a tracked solution for your rewards, please message us or email support@3dtotal.com and we’ll provide a shipping quote. US rewards will be shipped from the US to help expedite delivery.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, if there is a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will take us a few days to work our way through packaging all the rewards. 3dtotal Publishing has a fulfilment company lined up to do this as quickly as possible, so once dispatched, rewards should reach you in 10-15 working days.
Unforeseen delays that are out of our control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We will be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time!
In the event of lost orders in the mail (it happens!), we will offer to resend the order once for free, or alternatively you will have the option of a refund. Please note that we can only reship an order once if it is lost. If the second parcel is lost, we will not be able to offer a refund.  
For those who are not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a worldwide crowd-funding platform for artists and their creative projects. Once the funding period ends, we will start finalizing the book and the extra rewards, which will be sent to you in March 2018. About a month before that, we will send you a survey through Kickstarter, asking for your address - the reason we wait until a few weeks before is so that we have everyone’s most up-to-date details. When the survey is ready for you to fill in, you will receive an e-mail through Kickstarter. We ask that you fill the survey in as soon as possible, to avoid any delays in sending out your reward!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We learned a lot from the first Kickstarter, particularly when it comes to managing the logistics for such a high number of backers! To help with this 3dtotal Publishing has a fulfilment company in place to start packaging up the rewards as soon as everything is ready. This way, we can ensure that we can process a high number of rewards as quickly as possible. Many of the US orders were slow to arrive last time around, so to counter this, US rewards will be shipped from the US to help expedite delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
(Low res because of file size limits, but you get the idea)
           The game will be a new approach to point-and-click adventures, filled with dark comedy, drama, weirdness, and an apocalypse in the suburbs. This is the first time we're making something set in the unified C&H Universe, so we're completely excited to be making this for you!
When it comes to the writing, we definitely don't plan on holding back, but we're also not out to get the high score with ESRB ratings. We're going to write how we normally do, which often ends up pretty dark, but this will also have a good story to it that will really bring the entire C&H universe we've made over the years together into one cohesive world.
              Cyanide & Happiness (us) are a kinda sorta well-known animation, comic, and card game company that's dedicated to world domination and/or making really funny things. Thanks to our amazing fans, we've run two successful Kickstarters before, and for this game we're making all the writing, art, and animation in house like we've been doing weekly since 2013.
On the game creation side, we've brought in Newgrounds alumni Roger Barr of I-Mockery and Skeleton Crew Studios, creator of games like Abobo's Big Adventure, Bionic Chainsaw Pogo Gorilla, and the upcoming Halloween Steam game, Grave Chase. 
When cornered, Roger said, "I didn't sign on to be a part of this project, they're holding me hostage. Please send word to my family!" 
Rog will be also joined by his longtime game development partner, Jacob West.
After the campaign, we'll be inviting all you lovely people back to our lovely love-lair of a development forum, where we'll be looping everyone in on bi-weekly production updates and, maybe, just maybe, you'll find true love.
Even Gram Gram will be helping us one last time!
  As mentioned above, we're not having many physical rewards so we can focus on spending everything we can on making the game bigger and better because that's what it's all about.
    The game is already in development, so as soon as the campaign finishes we'll kick production in to full gear. The release of the first chapter is expected to be December 2018 with the rest of the chapters coming out later, but if it comes down to a choice of on-time delivery or making the game better, we'll lean towards making the game better.
Along the way, you'll be able to track all of our progress with bi-weekly check-ins on our exclusive backer message forum, behind-the-scenes looks, and directly asking us "Hey why can't I play the game right now, you filthy monster?!?"
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While C&H is new to video games, our developers Roger and Jacob have been making games for over a decade and have been with us every step of this campaign to ensure that everything is put together just right. 

As for the Kickstarter campaign itself, thanks to our amazing fans, we've already run two successful campaigns so we know how to make the campaign actually happen, no matter what challenges we face.

All the additional funding we receive will go towards improving and lengthening the game.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Along For The Ride
support.descp:
Thanks for helping us make the game happen!
We'll keep you posted through project updates and you'll have access to the behind-the-scenes development forum after the campaign. You'll also get a special thank you in the credits.

support.title: Early Bird!
support.descp:
Get yourself a digital copy of all three chapters of the game FOR CHEAPER THAN EVERYONE ELSE. Good job early bird!
(After Kickstarter the game will be $29.99)
You'll also get a special thank you in the credits.

support.title: The Game!
support.descp:
Wrap your fleshly little meathooks around your very own digital copy of all three chapters of the game!
(After Kickstarter the game will be $29.99)
You'll also get a special thank you in the credits.

support.title: Game + Wallpapers + Soundtrack
support.descp:
Not only do you get THE GAME (you know which one, right?), but you'll also get digital downloads of wallpapers from the game, as well as access to the digital soundtrack of the game featuring REAL MUSIC made by REAL HUMANS.
You'll also get a special thank you in the credits.

support.title: Permanent Record
support.descp:
Oh you thought you could get away with this, didn't you!?!? WELL GUESS WHAT BUCKAROO, THIS IS GOING ON YOUR PERMANENT RECORD!
Deep within the bowels of the school, there will be a PERMANENT RECORD of all your wrongdoings. You'll even get to send us some text and photos of yourself (using the C&H Avatar Creator) that'll be in the game!
You're gonna regret you messed with THIS principal!
(Also includes one game download, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Graffiti
support.descp:
Even though graffiti is BAD, sometimes it's FUN to do BAD THINGS. Leave your mark on the game by sending us some text to slap all over town!
(Also includes one game download, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Tragedy Memorial Wall
support.descp:
We're not saying something bad is gonna happen in the game, but if it DID, maybe you would want to leave a message for your loved ones to help find you? It might be a good idea to have your face (using the C&H avatar creator) also put on there as well, but hey, nothing bad will probably happen.
(Also includes one game download, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Limited Edition Medallion
support.descp:
Get super fancy and show off how you helped make the C&H game happen with the limited edition medallion!
(Includes one digital download of the game, game wallpapers, and soundtrack)

support.title: Your Own Locker!
support.descp:
Tell us about yourself and we'll personalize your very own in-game locker that you can check out in the school!
(Also includes one game download, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Gravestone
support.descp:
Seriously, there's probably nothing bad that's going to happen in this game. Promise. But if it WERE to happen and you WERE killed, maybe you could pass on your wisdom on to the next generation. You write the epitaph, and we'll tell you how you died by giving you a custom in-game tombstone in the graveyard!
(Also includes two game downloads, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Limited Edition Game Box
support.descp:
Digital downloads are for NERDS. All the coolest of the cool people, which you are, know that having a limited edition physical game box is where it's at. This also includes a limited edition medallion, three limited edition prints, and a limited edition thumb drive with a DRM free download of the game on it! Limited up the wazoo!
These will be one of a kind from a single printing, so once these are gone, there won't be any more in existence.
Also, we'll still give you THREE digital download copies that you can give to NERDS, right before you you beat them up and take their lunch money.
(Also includes three game downloads, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Become a NPC
support.descp:
Become a part of the C&H canon and get a custom-drawn avatar of yourself put into the game that players can interact with!
(Also includes five game download, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Get killed in the game!
support.descp:
Work with the C&H art team to add you into the game, then watch in gleeful horror as we brutally murder you! It's fun! Trust us!
(Also includes five game downloads, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Become A Mutant!
support.descp:
Ever wondered what you'd look like after being exposed to toxic sludge? Wonder no more! You'll appear as an actual mutant somewhere in our game!
(includes five game downloads, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

support.title: Executive Producer & Statue
support.descp:
Become an immortal god by having your name written all over our credits, sealing your destiny as a big fancy producer who really, really believes in us! You'll even have a statue dedicated to JUST YOU in the game. Legendary!
(Also includes the rewards of the $150 Limited Edition Box tier)

support.title: Inches From Death
support.descp:
Appear in our game as a character who isn't murdered, but instead is maimed within an inch of your life, yet you still have to go on living in total agony. A fate even worse than death itself!
(Also includes five game downloads, wallpapers, soundtrack, and special thank you in the credits.)

updates.update_content:
Ahoy there, Freakpocalypse backers!
It sure felt good being able to finally share the Thursday, March 11th release date with all of you last week, and now we have some more fun to share! Check out the official Freakpocalypse launch trailer:

Ahoy there, Freakpocalypse backers!
“The next time you hear from us it will be with the official Freakpocalypse release date!”
Remember when we said that in our previous update? (insert “It’s been 84 years...” Titanic meme) Yeah, we know you’ve been waiting for this, so no long introductions this time. Let’s get right to it:

updates.update_userinfo: An Update On Your Backer Keys!
updates.update_content:
Ahoy there, Freakpocalypse backers!
It’s been an extremely busy month of QA testing and working on the game since we last talked, but we wanted to give you a quick update on the status of things.
First off, some bad news. There’s no month we would’ve preferred to release Freakpocalypse more than October, but unfortunately the pandemic has thrown a wrench into those plans. Not only has it delayed routine aspects of development like voice acting, QA, additional polish and localization, but it’s also delayed several aspects of game marketplaces. We won’t be able to release this month like we planned and it’s beyond our control. This makes us just as disappointed as we're sure it makes you, but we're going to use this extra time to take care of bugs and also add some more polish to aspects of the game.

Ahoy there, Freakpocalypse backers!

 First off, we want to thank you for all the great feedback we received from the recent Steam demo; it definitely helped us add some stuff you folks wanted. The feedback was overwhelmingly positive, especially regarding the humor, which has us thrilled because the demo is SUCH a TINY sliver of the full game.
One of the biggest requests we received was to include animated avatars for the character dialog windows. We spent some time getting those added in, and we then took it a step further by having the character’s facial expressions change based on their mood. Thanks to your fantastic feedback, the entire game feels so much better as a result. Well done!

campaign.story:
Stretch goal 1 - £2,000 - More books (SMASHED!)
Yay! Thanks to your incredible support, Extraversal Year 1 has already hit 200% of its funding target. We're now able to print even more copies of the book.
Stretch goal 2 - £2,500 - Patches (SMASHED!)
If we hit 250%, all backers who pledge to receive a physical reward will also receive a unique iron-on patch in one of two designs. Choose from a patch declaring you a crew member of the Reflektor from Cuckoos, or one featuring everyone's favourite feline and dessert duo Cat and Meringue. 
Choose your patch!
Extraversal Year 1
A quest to unite 99 magical swords. A ship at play in the space between worlds. A mysterious walled city. A vast alien being in a broken century. A cat and a meringue.
Welcome to the worlds of Big Punch Studios.
From the creators of 7STRING and Afterlife Inc. comes Extraversal, a quarterly magazine serialising five ongoing series from the Big Punch Multiverse. Now, for the first time, issues 1-4 of Extraversal are being collected as a luxury, 164-page graphic novel.
Extraversal Year 1 has arrived. Time to fly.
Enter the Extraverse, the space between worlds, in the pages of CUCKOOS, as the crew of the Reflektor set sail in search of trade, adventure and perhaps a home…
A giant stone warship appears in the skies of an alternate New York in ORB, casting utopia into chaos, and leaving the fate of the world in the hands of a young girl and a superhuman prophet…
Years ago, a legendary swordsmith forged 99 SWORDS of great power. Now, in a world forever changed by their magic, Elsie Blackwood joins the ranks of Swordhunters seeking to unite the 99 Swords and claim the ultimate prize…
High above the city of Prizm, Cyanne and her skilled team of catchers defend their home from showers of deadly crystals, ever wondering what lies beyond THE WALL that separates them from the outside world…
Fresh from their 1,000 days of adventures, CAT AND MERINGUE return for more mirth and madness on an ocean of possibilities…
Hi. We're Big Punch Studios (a.k.a. Nich, Lucy, Jon and Ali) and together we make all manner of adventures in comics and games. We're the team behind 7STRING and Afterlife Inc., and we also made Sandwich Masters, a game of strategy, sabotage and sandwiches. Together, we handle all aspects of production on Extraversal, from script to art to publication, with help from our amazing team of freelance artists: Jack, Verity and James.
We began publishing Extraversal in 2015 as a way of telling more stories from our expanding multiverse. But don't be fooled: while the genres are different - spanning sci-fi, fantasy and comedy - this is one world, one story, told from different angles. Characters walk between pages, appearing in unexpected places. A mystery is developing across the Extraverse, and it's too big for any one universe to contain.
The individual issues of Extraversal are available to our Patrons and followers as a subscription service, but you can catch up on the story so far on our website. We're so excited to bring the collected edition of Extraversal Year 1 to life as a beautiful new book. We hope you enjoy reading it as much as we've enjoyed working on it.
Thanks for your time, gang. Welcome to our worlds.
Nich, Lucy, Jon and Ali
Big Punch Studios
campaign.risks:

We've a good track record of delivering on our past Kickstarter projects, and an excellent relationship with our printer, who always delivers work of the highest quality. Together with your support, we know we can make something pretty awesome.

campaign.story:
I’ve always had a love affair with Dinosaurs. They where one of the first things I remember drawing as a kid, and they captivated me. I had tons of dinosaur books, many of which I never got tired of looking at. I studied dinosaurs, I drew dinosaurs, and I even made my own little books. As a concept artist creating worlds in the video game industry,  I still  have this dream that's been left unchecked, and that's to create my own world, and put it all in my own dinosaur book. My ultimate goal for this book is that it would inspire anyone who looks through it, the same way my dinosaur books inspired me when I when I was a kid.
    Dinosaurs of the Wild West will be an art book. It will be hardcover, 11" x 8.5" and over 130 pages (please note the book image is a mock up, and the dimension size will be a little different). It will contain black and white illustrations, and paintings depicting dinosaurs and people of the old west living together. It won't just be cowboys either, you'll see Native Americans, outlaws, settlers, towns folk, and many more. You’ll visit towns, vast landscapes, and you'll even have a map so you wont get lost. You will also see all of my development sketches, and early drawings, plus a look into my process of  how I create these illustrations
      The way Kickstarter works is that I can raise funds upfront from pledges made by backers.  Any amount you pledge is more than appreciated, and I'm very grateful! Below you will see a visual break down of the reward tiers so you can see what prints and original art is included. There are TEN original pieces of art, one per set, once they're gone, they're gone. You can see which drawing you get with the sets below, and you can select the rewards you want to pledge to on the right. 
                                        This is my first ever book, and kickstarter campaign. I'm coming to kickstarter because I need funds for the printing costs of the book (which isnt cheap), the cost of the reward prints, the shipping and packaging costs, and the kickstater fees. 
    I'm aiming for a March 2018 release to get everything sent out to backers. This gives me enough time to finish the content for the book, and allows for the 2 months it takes to get the book printed and shipped to me.
    I've been drawing and creating my own worlds since childhood. I love drawing so much that I turned it into a career. For seven years I've been working as concept artist in the video game industry, and the last two and a half years were spent with Nintendo. 
I love drawing dinosaurs, animals and creatures. I also really enjoy history, with the American wild west being one of my favorite time periods.
I live in the Pacific Northwest with my amazing wife and three crazy little doggies. 
Thank you so much for taking the time to look my project, its a labor of love, and I want it to be the best book it can be. I hope that you would consider supporting me in making this book a reality. And if you like what you see, please share!
best,
Shaun
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The good news is that the content of the book is about 90% complete. As a professional artist in the video game industry I'm no stranger to working hard, and meeting deadlines. Ive been diligently working on this for over a year, and I just need a few more months to finish the remaining art, and complete the layout. Then it just needs to get printed and shipped out! With a project like this, there's always the possibility of unforeseen delays, and if those occur you will get detailed updates. Either way this book is getting made!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, this is the last update.  The remaining books and orders have all been shipped out. If your order had an original drawing, the drawing will be coming separately. For the international orders, delivery  times will be different for each country, and tracking isn't available for all countries. Thank you again for your patience, and I hope you all enjoy the book!
best,

Hello everyone!  I'm shipping the books in two big chunks. The first batch of 300 books were picked up today by USPS. The second batch of books will be going out later this week. I can't provide tracking numbers for all international orders, as for some countries tracking is not available. Thanks to everyone for your patience while I stumble through this entire process. It feels great to get the books out into the wild. 
best, 
Shaun

updates.update_userinfo: Last Call on address changes: WED, AUG 22 last day
updates.update_content:
Hello, just a quick reminder. I had a number of people still giving me address changes after the 48 hour deadline had passed. Thats fine, and I understand some might not see emails right away. If you sent me a new address, it was updated. However I need to wrap this all up, so I'm giving a final firm deadline of Wednesday, Aug 22. After that, addresses can't be changed. Thank you!
best,

Hey everyone! This is a 48 hour notice to make sure I have your most current address. A number of you have contacted me already with new addresses, and those have been updated. I will be printing up all the shipping labels this week, and once I lock down the addresses, they can't be changed. We're in the home stretch! Thank you again for your patience and hanging in there with me as I get your books and prints ready to ship. It's been quite the learning experience!
best,

Hello everyone, I've have some raise concerns on where the books are, and I just wanted to give a little update and insight. I'm still in the process of packaging up the books. The main cause of delay is two fold. First, is that when the cards where charged it  took almost two weeks for those funds to be fully transferred into my account. It was then, that I was finally able to order all the packaging supplies, and begin getting the print sets underway. The second cause of delay, is balancing the freelance work to pay the bills. The good news is that I have about half of the books all packaged up ready to go. This is my first time ever doing this and I'm a one man operation. I want to put at ease any concerns you may have about getting your books/rewards. You will get a notice email with a tracking number once the shipments have been made. Thank you so much for your patience during the last leg of the process! They will be arriving soon!

Hello everyone! The books have arrived and they turned out great! I will be shipping them in a week or so, as I get everything sorted and planned out. You will receive an email with a tracking number once the books have been shipped. Thank you all for your patience and supporting this project! I can't wait for you all to get the books!
much love, 
Shaun

Hi everyone! The books are done, and are being shipped out to me from China. The printer has told me it should take 6 weeks for me to get the books, this is due to customs and the fact they're being shipped on a ship via the ocean. Once I get the books, I will immediately begin shipping them out to you all.  I sincerely apologize for this last little delay. But rest assured, we are in the final stretch and the books will be in your hands very soon! I'm hoping no later than June/July. I will also be sending out the Digital books very soon, so be watching for that in the next coming weeks. Thank you so much for your patience!

Hello everyone, I just wanted to give a little update. The book is being sent off to the printer! However theres a small unforeseen delay that I never considered. My books are being printed in China, and I never accounted for the Chinese New year. During this time most of China shuts down for almost a month. This shifts my original estimated delivery from March to either April or May, and I apologize for this minor delay. 
The book ended up being 200 pages, and I'm very happy with how it has turned out! I can't wait for you all to see it. Thank you all for your patience. Take care!

Hello everyone! I wanted to give a quick little update as to where things are at with the book! We are still right on schedule, and I will be completing the last remaining art this month. I'm really anxious to get the book into your hands, and I've been working hard on some little surprises that I'm putting into the book!  Once the art is all done, then its off to the printer, and I'll be sharing when that happens soon. With that said,  I'll leave you with a preview of a new piece from the book. Merry Christmas everyone!

I always appreciate any feedback I get, and as a creative person I'm always experimenting. I've gotten a lot of feedback on my last update and wanted to clear some things up. Firstly, the vast majority of the book will remain as planned, clean black and white illustrations with some exploration of other styles , paintings, sketches and process. I also want to make clear the print sets will all remain black and white as advertised. I don't want anyone thinking Im bamboozling them, by switching up styles from what was advertised. I've been working on this project a long time, and was having fun with experimenting with textures and tones, but it will not be a total style change as I mentioned before. I love that you guys are passionate about this book, and want it to be the best it can. Thank you for being transparent with me, as I will be transparent with you all.

campaign.story:
PLAY

Meet Thrawn, the battle hardened, slayer of evil, that has seen more war than any other barbarian in his clan.  Or any other known clan, for that matter.  If you were to find yourself surrounded by demons, Thrawn is the one you'd want by your side. 
This is the first  bust I've had printed, and here it is*:
  *I will be going over this, and the other prints, with clay, smoothing out parts, adding details, and basically doing some quality control, before getting them mold/cast. 
    PLAY

Resh, the Chaos King. He's been marching his armies, of unspeakable horrors, across the land, taking everything they touch. If he's not stopped soon, he will be too powerful to face at all.
    PLAY

This is Raynard.  Much younger than Thrawn, but the only human brave enough to face Resh, and his evil horde of creatures.  He's seen enough war to make most men give up on humanity, but Raynard doesn't give up Ever.
The stretch goals!  At $4000 you will get access to a female Necromancer, one of Resh's Most trusted advisors, and at $5000, an unamable horror, one of Resh's monstrous army.  While these haven't been completed yet, you can expect the same level of design quality, and detail, you've seen in the original 3.
These will be printed by Entrescan, then molded and cast in resin, by Trollforged.  I'm doing my best, to design some really cool, and varied, busts, that should be a lot of fun to paint, and look great when you're done with them. 
My goal here, is to raise the funds needed, to print, mold, cast, package, and ship these busts to your door. In order to keep shipping costs down, I'm going with Fedex International, as they seem to be the cheapest, without forcing me to get a mailing permit ($450) before even mailing anything out. 
Doing this will keep costs down, but I'm not going to know how much shipping will be, until I get all the orders in.  If 50 busts need shipped, they will charge one price, if 75 need shipped, they will charge a completely different price.  This means I have no way of knowing exactly what to charge for shipping.  But I will keep you updated on this, as numbers develop.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only risk comes if the Kickstarter doesn't get funded. Otherwise, I'll have everything I need to get these produced, and sent out. I'm doing the sculpting, so I know I'll be able to deliver on the stretch goals. I have a good relationship with contacts for printing, and casting, as well. 

With that said, there is the possibility for delay, due to unforeseen circumstances. I'm doing my best to cover everything I possibly can, but sometimes there can be something you just can't see coming. 

However, if the project gets funded, you WILL get your pieces! I love doing this too much to give up easily.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: A little sad, but never broken
updates.update_content:
So my first ever Kickstarter didn't get funded.  I'm ok with that, actually. What DID happen was, several people believed in me, and my project enough, to put their money down.  And to me, that is EVERYTHING.  I'm so thankful for each, and every single one of you, who contributed, in any way, to this project.  From the people who shared this link, to those of you who followed me, to those who backed it, and everything in between.  YOU are the reason I'm not giving up. 
Already, I'm planning my next steps.  Right now I'm looking to make some full character minis for my next kickstarter.  I love these busts, and I think the world they inhabit could be really interesting, if I flesh it out a bit more.  I think moving to full characters minis is something more people will be able to enjoy.  So I'll be making a set of minis, based on the Blackened Keep characters.  A full Thrawn, Resh, Raynard, Necromancer, and one of Resh's nameless horrors will be among them.

campaign.story:
Wanderer tells the tale of a man called Rook, a greying convict who wakes from cold sleep aboard a massive orbital prison facility to find that it's crash landed on the ruins of an abandoned Earth. With the help of a hacker named Jin and the aid of a ragtag group of survivors he recruits along the way, Rook must explore the planet and locate the cell blocks which have detached from the prison's central tower and scattered across Earth's ghostly wasteland.
During his mission, Rook will run into allies and adversaries in the form of dangerous gangs of fellow prisoners, the survivors of the Earth's mysterious apocalypse, and bizarre parasitic extradimensional beasts that haunt the dead planet. Core gameplay fuses platforming, pseudo-turn based combat, puzzle solving, and interactive dialogue/decision making into a story driven, atmospheric experience. Tying it all together is a unique visual aesthetic that merges lo-res pixel art characters with a lovingly hand-painted world.
Update 3: Design Philosophy and Inspirations Pt. 1
Update 4: Design Philosophy and Inspirations Pt. 2
Update 6: Earth, 2171 AD
Update 7: Battle System Breakdown
Update 8: Add-Ons + New Character Reveals
Update 9: Inventory System
Update 10: New Add-Ons + Early Music + Skill Sneak-peek
We're very excited to be able to share a draft of a title theme for Wanderer done by our awesome composer Jonathan Geer:
PLATFORMING
Wanderer is a cinematic platformer at it’s core, a modernized take on classics like Another World, Flashback, and Heart of Darkness. Rook can walk, run, jump, crouch, and climb through the world. Additional movement abilities will be unlocked by the player as they advance, opening up the ways they can move around the environment. Light action elements include environmental hazards that Rook has to safely navigate and a ranged/melee attack used to stun/attack enemies that roam the world. Up to two computer-controlled companions at a time can be assigned to follow behind Rook as the player explores the world.
The game world consists of a simplified overworld map filled with locations to travel to and explore. It's centered around a hub where players can return to upgrade abilities and equipment and find companions stationed when not in the party.
COMBAT
When Rook makes contact with an enemy on the 'field', the game switches to JRPG style pseudo turn-based combat (allowing the player to control all three current party members). Striking the enemy before they can strike you will give you a free first attack, and the same applies in reverse for the enemy, so you'll need to take note of how each enemy behaves and moves on the field to be successful.
The combat system is intended to be challenging and fluid, and is largely based on player skill and strategy rather than stats or random chance. Timing, reflex, and pattern recognition are emphasized, and the player will need to manually time and input offensive/defensive maneuvers to maximize their advantage in battle. Wanderer's battle system design is influenced by RPGs including Paper Mario, Valkyrie Profile, and Rogue Galaxy.
PUZZLE SOLVING
As Rook explores and moves through the world he'll find points of interest represented by nodes that can be interacted with in familiar "point and click" adventure game fashion (look at, talk about/to, use item with, pick-up etc.). These interactions take place via a context sensitive radial menu that show the player which actions are available. Puzzles will require the player to examine and interact with characters, the environment, and obtainable inventory items to overcome obstacles and advance the story.
BRANCHING DIALOGUE/CHOICES
Along Rook's mission, the player will have the opportunity to interact with a colorful and varied cast of characters via branching dialogue choices. The way the player chooses to respond to other characters will affect how they view him, and key points in the story will present the player with multiple ways to handle a scenario, each potentially leading to lasting consequences. Inspired by modern interactive narratives like Heavy Rain and Telltale's Walking Dead series, decisions and conversations will play out in real time, actively engaging the player in the scenario and sometimes requiring them to make choices on the fly.
In the fairly distant future, humans have escaped beyond the confines of their native planet after a mysterious, cataclysmic event has left it crawling with bizarre otherworldly creatures and turned it a place where time and space have come ever so slightly unraveled. With colonies on Venus, Mars, the moons of Jupiter, and dozens of massive space stations throughout the solar system, for much of humanity the Earth has become nothing more than a massive graveyard and a nostalgic memory.
The main character of the game's story, known simply as Rook, is an aged convict held in a state of stasis aboard an Alcatrez-esque orbital prison station designated the VC Harlegand. The Harlegand is stationed in the now isolated corner of the galaxy around Earth, making escape a nearly impossible prospect.
After the prison crash lands on the Earth's surface for unknown reasons, Rook is awoken from his prisoner stasis pod by a hacker and fellow prisoner named Jin who's jacked into his neural implants remotely. Unfortunately, as a death row prisoner who was never intended to be fully resuscitated, upon waking Rook finds himself suffering from fragmented memory, recurring hallucinations, and painful migraines. The prison's medbay can ease his symptoms, but Jin need's Rook's help to reactivate it.
Proposing a plan to escape the planet, she suggests the two work together towards a common goal of survival. The duo embark on a journey to gather what she needs for them to escape, which entails traveling to each of the cell blocks that detached and scattered across the Earth's surface when the prison crash landed. Along the way they'll befriend fellow survivors, clash with gangs of dangerous criminals and monstrous creatures, and unravel the mysteries of the Earth's nebulous fate.
Supplementary story elements unfold through optional text logs and entries to the player's codex gained by exploring and interacting with the world and speaking with characters. These offer additional detail and flavor to the game's setting for player's who are interested in it's backstory and lore.
On a secondary narrative level, a strong emphasis is placed on a diverse and engaging cast of misfits and survivors that Rook will encounter and work together with on his mission. Each ally has a unique backstory and viewpoint that the player will learn as they spend time together. As companions follow the player through the world, they'll often comment on the current scenario or begin a conversation amongst themselves that you can engage in while exploring (and even during combat!).
Having certain party members with you will also contextually open up new options and unique ways to deal with scenarios you encounter on your journey. These contextual bonus interactions not only serve to make party members feel autonomous and organic, but offer the player a meaningfully unique experience based on the companions they choose to bring with them..
Just a few of the story's main characters include:
The player will also encounter a wide range of NPC factions that may help or hinder Rook depending on the choices that are made, each with a distinctive visual style, richly detailed background, and unique set of motives and objectives:
The player will also encounter bizarre alien parasitic entities nicknamed 'Phantoms', taking the form of a wide range of hostile creatures and beasts to fight, each with it's own capabilities, behaviors, strengths and weaknesses:
Wanderer is being designed as an episodic series. Episodes will be developed and released in sequential fashion, with each being released as soon as it's finished. Each new episode will add new content in the form of newly discovered areas on the world map (as well as hidden ones that must be discovered by other means), adding new objectives to push the main story forward as well as lots of side content to be completed at your own pace.
Each area on the world map serves as a 'level', full of encounters, puzzles, obstacles, fights, and items. Some levels are much larger than others, and some contain purely optional content seperate from the primary story. You are free to come and go between areas as you please, and you'll sometimes need an item from one area to solve a puzzle on another. Past areas can be revisited in subsequent episodes, and sometimes new content will be added to old areas, so you'll have to keep an eye out and explore to get the most out of the world!
For the Kickstarter, we'll be funding the entire series as a whole, and a $15 or more pledge gains you access to all episodes. We're planning to develop 5 total episodes, but if we hit certain stretch goals, we plan to expand the scope of the game with additional episodes. The reason we're taking the episodic approach to development is to allow us to make an RPG with a greater sense of scope than we would otherwise be able.
Like our favorite RPGs, Wanderer is a long, winding story full of twists and turns, evolving and growing character relationships, and lots of player character progression. To do it justice in a single development period and in a reasonable amount of time isn't a realistic goal for a two-man development team. That's why we're breaking it up into pieces, to make the project manageable and get the game into your hands much sooner. Another benefit is being able to engage with your feedback between episodes, and make sure each one is full of the best possible content!
Our objective is to be able to release the first episode by September 2016, and then release subsequent episodes every 3~4 months.
Our core team is composed of 2 individuals, an artist/designer and a developer/coder. The project found it's humble beginnings on the TIGSource forums, where Cris posted his initial pitch for Wanderer while searching for a developer to collaborate with. As fate would have it, Serge was looking for a new project to work on, and quite literally within five minutes after the creation of it's devlog, the two teamed up and Wanderer's development was underway.
After months of searching for for a musician and composer that fits our vision of the game, we've recently teamed up with veteran Jonathan Geer, and we're very excited to have him on-board to bring Wanderer's soundtrack to life.
Jonathan's impressive versatility is a perfect match for Wanderer's concept, and will allow for the soundtrack to have an array of styles that complement the narratives blend of moods and tones. Though we hope to share a first look at the game's music with at some point during the campaign, in the meantime you can have a listen to an assortment of Jonathan's previous work:
Wanderer is a passion project that took over a year to completely conceptualize. It's a storytelling experience that strives to merge retro and modern design elements into something that feels new and fresh, but at the same time recalls nostalgia from our happiest gaming memories. It's a vision we're desperately invested in seeing come to life, but the only way it can become a reality is via the support of a crowdfunding campaign.

Development started 6 months ago, and our two-man team has made excellent progress towards a playable vertical slice of the game, with a prototype that already supports:

The game's platforming including full AI companion and enemy pathfinding.
Puzzle solving/adventure game mechanics.
An initial implementation for combat mechanics.
Branching and contextual dialogues.
A custom and complete in-game scene editor with an advanced script system.
All the basic components like the save system, medias integration and management pipelines and an advanced and flexible rendering pipeline with light and post-processing effects.
Currently, our programmer is working a full-time job and our artist is living on savings in order to dedicate his time to the project. This is not a situation we can maintain long term. To continue working on Wanderer we need some additional support to allow us to dedicate our full time and attention to the project.
For physical rewards, we're very excited to have the opportunity to team up with wonderful IndieBox to bring you high quality items!

Wanderer is a passion project, the game we always wanted to play but no one ever tried to make. With your help, we can make it a reality! Thank you for time and support! Together, we know we can make a one of a kind gaming experience, and we want nothing more than to share it with you. :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Wanderer is treading new ground in terms of core design structure, which is where we believe much of the appeal lies, but which also means there’s an inherent amount of risk involved in execution. A lack of a tried and true formula means we’re going into this endeavor largely without the benefit of footsteps to follow in regards to the flow of gameplay and the synergy of various hybrid mechanics. 

This risk is why the game’s core mechanics are designed with simplicity and elegance in mind. Adding too much complexity to too many potentially disparate mechanics could quickly muddy the design and make it very difficult to analyze what’s working well and what’s not. Keeping things simple and clean means we can make adjustments on the fly and adapt the direction and emphasis of core gameplay without losing lots of design work and development time.

The game is very ambitious in terms of scale and scope, especially given that development is handled by only the two of us. That’s why early on we made the decision to divide it into episodes, to allow us to divide what would otherwise be an insurmountable amount of content into much smaller and more manageable milestones. 

Further, the episodic structure additionally benefits us by allowing us to receive valuable player feedback between the release of episodes. This will help us steer the direction of content over the course of the games overall development cycle and gives us ample time to make adjustments as necessary.

Finally, even though this is the first project our team is working on together, we've already made considerable progress on the development, and over the previous six months we've setup a very efficient and adapted workflow. Our pipeline is already established and proven, and we'll do everything in our power to stick to our projected deadlines and deliver the experience we've promised in our presentation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
July-August-September-October Progress Update
Hey everyone. Cris here, unfortunately far from the top of my game and with some long overdue insight on what's been going on these last three months.
Firstly, I've got to get a pressing bit of bad news out of the way. This isn't a personal blog, but given that it's very much relevant to development, before I get to the progress I'll say this off the top and for the sake of total transparency. It is with some grief and great frustration I have to announce that I'm presently dealing with unexpected and potentially serious health issues that have come to light gradually over the last 6 months.

updates.update_userinfo: Alpha Demo Released, Plans for July
updates.update_content:
Hey all! Have a quick update to cover a few topics for today.
First up, just wanted to properly announce that our first playable alpha demo went live last week. If you were in the $25 or higher backer tier, you should have gotten an email from itch.io with a download link. If you didn't receive it, make sure to check it wasn't filtered out as spam. If you should have received it but can't find it, let us know so we can help sort it out.

updates.update_content:
September-October-November Progress Update
Greetings all. Yes, I'm still alive! A little weary maybe, but eager nontheless to share our progress and reflect on our first year of development as it comes to a close.


--
June-July-August Progress Update

April-May Progress Update
Hey guys, Cris here, and yes, it's finally that time again! I know you've all been patiently waiting for some news, and I couldn't be more appreciative of that, so I'll spare you the preamble and get right into it. Let's go!

March-April Progress Update
Hello, and welcome back to another fashionably late edition of the Wanderer progress update! As always, I'd like to say thank you all for your patience and understanding in waiting for news. The downside of having such a small team carrying such a sizable project is that it's a 24/7 work schedule to keep things moving forward at a reasonable pace, and as such it can be hard to put on the brakes when you don't want to lose any momentum.

Progress Update
Hello all, Cris here, reporting for duty and back for a monthly progress update! I'll do my best to get one of these out at the start of each month for the rest of development.

Happy 2016...! :D
...sort of? :/
Hello again everyone, and an embarrassingly/obnoxiously tardy happy new years to all! I hope 2016 is treating everybody well thus far. We took a short breather over the Christmas break to hang out with our families and do a bit of catching up on life, and with the start of the year we hit the ground running on development and it's been a mad dash to keep the pace up since.

campaign.story:
Did you miss the Kickstarter? Go to www.skyheartcomic.com to stay up to date on the project!
I'm Jake Parker, and I'm making SkyHeart Book I: The Star Seed. 
SkyHeart is an all-ages graphic novel inspired by my favorite movies and comics. If you liked Miyazaki's Nausicaa, Star Wars, Tokien's The Hobbit, and Indiana Jones, then you just might become a fan of SkyHeart. 
SkyHeart will be a 7.5 x 10 inch 100+ page book that comes in both soft and hard cover editions. 
The book is being written and drawn by me and is scheduled to be finished in May of 2016, and shipped out to backers in October of 2016.
For years I've been developing this project on the side, but it was so big, and so involved that it scared me! I felt I wasn't ready to create this book. 
After years working in animation as a concept artist (Horton Hears a Who, Rio, Epic) and comics (Flight, Missile Mouse, Rocket Raccoon) my skills as an artist and storyteller got better. I feel like I'm finally at a level now where I can take on a project like this and do it justice.
So...I'm going for it!
The Idea for SkyHeart was planted in my imagination over 15 years ago while on a road trip though the Arizona desert. I imagined the desert floor vanishing, leaving only an abyss of clouds with the rock formations suspended above them in the air.
From that seed of an idea grew an entire world of characters and their struggles, with mythologies, cities, and technology fleshing out the rest of this universe.
I love classic tales of adventure, of good versus evil, and struggles with real consequences. Which is why I look to films like Star Wars, Nausicaa, Castle in the Sky, and Indiana Jones, and books like the Hobbit for inspiration. Just because a story is all-ages, doesn't mean I can't enjoy it as much as my kids do!
SkyHeart takes place on Airth, a world literally torn apart by a pre-historic war between the gods who created it. That war left the planet divided into 4 realms:
The Stratos, a chain of islands high in the sky where the Sylph people live.
The Rimland, a massive ring of continents and giant islands where most of the inhabitants of Airth live. Wake, our main protagonist, lives here.
The Abyss, a stretch of atmosphere filled with incredible cloud formations and tiny floating islands. Limberg and Grimm are from here. 
The Core, an ocean covered rocky sphere filled with colossal caves. The Tengru, monsters and beasts, and the Dark Lord live down here.
In that great ancient war, the beings of Light were able to defeat the Shadows and banish them to the core, but not without a great cost. Losing most of their godly energy, they left Airth to search the universe for more power. Their children stayed to protect what was left of Airth from the evil trapped in the core. 
Thousands of years later these pre-historic events have become myth, and the inhabitants of Airth are consumed with their own wars for power. 
However, deep in the core, the Shadows have not forgotten, and have begun sending their agents to the surface to harvest the people of their life force. Once enough of this power has been taken the Shadows will rise again to destroy the rest of Airth and start a new world.
Wake and his crew set off to find the Star Seed with the hopes of both saving Wake's mother, and the world of Airth. That is, if they can beat Malsang and his sinister tengru to it's secret location. 
How Do Add Ons Work?
I'll be using Backer Kit to handle rewards and add-ons. Here's what you do:
Add up the total of your selections (plus shipping if it applies) 
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button) 
Add the total of your Add Ons to your pledge amount. You don't need to change the tier you've selected 
You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. 
Thank you!

I'll be updating the add ons and adding more if the project funds and we hit stretch goals. I want to add a map of Airth, a poster, and more, so check back.
I'm asking for A LOT of money. I've got a great youtube video here that outlines where all this money is going and how I arrived at this number. Basically, half the funds are going to the production of the content, and the other half is getting the books printed and shipped. 
Here's a breakdown of where the funds are going:
Printing: $12,000 This covers getting the books printed and shipped to my house. (15.4%)
Production: $42,000 This covers my time writing and drawing the book, paying a colorist, editor, and building the book and getting it ready for print. (53.8%)
Fees: $8000 This covers Backer Kit, Kickstarter and Amazon fees. (9%)
Shipping: $16,000 This covers packing up the books and shipping charges. I will be shipping the books PRIORITY MAIL to US backers to ensure the safe delivery of each package. International orders will all be sent FIRST CLASS. Orders will be packed in a bubble wrap sleeve, then put into heavy duty cardboard case. I talk all about how I ship things in this video. (23.4%)
This book will be produced in the spring and summer of 2016 and will be delivered to backers in September of that same year. Here's a rough timeline of the production:
November: Run the Kickstarter
December: Finish the SkyHeart manuscript
January - June: Drawing and coloring
July: Building the book, and prepping for print
August - September: Printing the book
October: Packing and Shipping
Hi I'm Jake Parker, and here's a little bit about me written in third person to sound official: 
Jake Parker is an illustrator and cartoonist. For the last 17 years he's worked on everything from animated films to comics to picture books. His credits include the animated films Titan A.E., Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs, Horton Hears a Who, Rio, and Epic. 
He illustrated the New York Times bestselling book The Astonishing Secret of Awesome Man, and went on to also illustrate The Girl Who Wouldn't Brush Her Hair, The Tooth Fairy Wars, The Little Snowplow, and most recently finished his first children's book that he also wrote, Little Bot and Sparrow which will be available in fall of 2016.
Along with children's books Jake also draws comics, and recently finished five issues of Marvel's Rocket Raccoon. His Missile Mouse graphic novel series, published by Scholastic, have sold over 100,000 copies. His own self-published comics anthology The Antler Boy and Other Stories was funded through Kickstarter at over $85,000. 
Jake is the creator of the Inktober challenge and World Art Drop Day, with both initiatives involving thousands of artists across the world. He's taught at Brigham Young University and is the co-founder of SVSLearn.com, an online art school specializing in visual storytelling. 
He and his wife Alison live in Provo with their five kids, two cats, and five chickens. You can learn more about Jake and see his work at www.mrjakeparker.com
                                      Facebook - Instagram - Twitter - Youtube
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my third Kickstarter and I fully recognize that unforeseeable problems might pop up. From production delays to collaborator mishaps to malfunctions with the printing press any number of setbacks could arise and push the delivery date of this project back. 

However, with my experience in self publishing and comics I'm confident that any potential obstacles will be dealt with swiftly and professionally. 

I understand the faith that backers have in me and my project so I'll be very transparent with everything that goes into the production of this book by posting frequent and timely updates, and being quick to notify backers of any setbacks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: SkyHeart Winter Transmission - Tying Up Loose Ends
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Thank you
I just wanted to touch base and thank each of you one last time for believing in this project and buying a book. Watching this book get made, printed, and shipped out has been one of the most stressful, but overall rewarding projects of my career. I'm really proud of SkyHeart and happy to have finished it.

Books are Here!
The books arrived safe and sound from my printer in China. So relieved!

Exciting news! The books are on a boat headed to Provo and get here September 14th.
The printer overnighted a couple of books so I could see what they look like. They turned out so good. Better than I had expected! 
Here's some photos:

I got the proofs back from the printer and the book is looking great!
I'll admit that when I delivered the files to the printer I was SO DONE. I didn't want to think about SkyHeart. But now, seeing these pages, leafing through them with my fingers, it's making me want to drop everything and start book 2!
I'm wrapping up the loose ends with SkyHeart before I send it off to the printers. This week I finished the cover!

You guys, YOU GUYS! Interior pages of SkyHeart are FINISHED!
This includes all the coloring, lettering, copy editing, formatting, back matter, title pages, chapter breaks, copyright page, and end pages. The book is built out in InDesign and ready to export. 
The last thing on my list is designing and polishing the front and back cover.

Before the month closes out I wanted to share with you some colored pages. As of right now I have 94 pages colored, 32 left to do.
Here's some of my favorites so far:
Inks are finished!

Just wanted to wrap up the year with another SkyHeart update.
Ater squeezing in as much drawing as I could in between everything this month I was able to get half of the pages done in this 5th and final chapter of SkyHeart.
You can see some of these pages here. Because of all the detail they took FOREVER.

Hello Everyone!
Touching base here at the end of November to let you know where things are at.
Finished with layouts on Chapter 5. You can see those here below. (Don't look too close if you want to avoid any spoilers.) Chapter 5 ended up being 6 pages longer than all the other chapters. Just couldn't fit everything I wanted to write into 24 pages.

CURRENT STRETCH GOAL: 
£32,000 - Troglodyte Black Brigade section
Welcome to The Land and the world of Panzerfäuste, our exciting game of mechanised warfare in a fantasy world. Enter a world where Dwarves, Orcs, Gnomes and many other creatures continue their millennia long struggles, but with modern advances of tanks, sub-machine guns and grenades. Fight on battlefields where death is impersonal and only a heartbeat away. March your troops across green fields, through muddy trenches, over snow-capped mountains or into dank caverns... Come fight in the world of Panzerfäuste and see if you can reign supreme in The Land!

Panzerfäuste is a fun 'Historo-Fantasy' miniature wargame setting, in which 28mm scale miniatures are used to depict the everyday struggles of standard fantasy races such as Orcs and Dwarves fight out battles with 20th century weaponry. 
So welcome to Panzerfäuste, welcome to Hysterical Games, make yourself comfortable, for you are in for a treat!  
For more information, don't hesitate to visit our Website: http://www.hystericalgames.co.uk 
 And, for all the latest updates and news, please 'Like' us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/HystericalGames
We've made loads of headway! Here's all the freebies you get with your pledges!
New Freebies Matrix, Last updated 01/11/15
Robyn Scott, one of our kind backers, has very generously taken some time to help you calculate your pledge. Just follow this link to a spreadsheet!

http://www.rrhughes.com/panzerfauste.xlsx

All of the current freebies are listed at the top of the spreadsheet, and all current stretch goals factored in, as well as the next 3 stretch goals.
Inspired by Tolkien, Pratchett, the history of the two world wars and everything in-between; Panzerfäuste is split into two rule-sets. Both the Skirmish Game and Mass Battle-Game rules simulate all of the vagaries of modern warfare, including fatigue and morale, but also mix in a flavour of fantasy through racial traits, magickal spells and fantastic abilities. 
The game can be played using the Skirmish rules, with a Section of infantry or played using the Mass Battle rules which cater for collections at Platoon to Company level, with two or three Sections of troops, armoured support and a character or two making up the bulk of most games. This means that the average game of Panzerfäuste requires no more than 30 or so miniatures. 

You can download the Beta rules for Panzerfäuste: Skirmish here: SKIRMISH BETA RULES
You can download the Beta rules for Panzerfäuste: Mass Battle here: MASS BATTLE BETA RULES

Panzerfäuste miniatures will be manufactured in a high quality and resilient polyurethane resin material, perfect for miniature gaming figurines. Hard-wearing and capturing excellent detail, these miniatures truly pop. Check out this video from the manufacturer for a quality check. 
PLAY

This Kickstarter is to create the first wave of miniatures in the Panzerfäuste setting, as well as two luxurious, full colour rulebooks to play out the initial battles of the setting. Right now, we have the first designs and models ready for the nefarious Dwarves and the plucky Gnomes - enough models for each faction to start playing the game. We have also been playtesting the rules; so now is the time to share them with you for Beta testing!
Here are the sets of models you guys have helped raise funds in order to release! Thank you so much!

So, we have a lot of the background written, some of the rules written and a great deal of artwork made. What we need from you guys is the support to manufacture a range of miniatures, expand the rules and print the rulebooks. 
Gregor has been busy making beautiful coloured imagery, including this Gnome!
Pledging in this Kickstarter couldn't be easier!
Step 1: Decide if you want to play the Skirmish Game, the Mass Battle Game, or Both! Every Pledge Level contains a rulebook, or both rulebooks, simply select the appropriate Pledge Level.

Disclaimer: Keep in mind, you can always add extra, or other, Rulebooks in the Pledge Manager after the Kickstarter finishes.
 

Step 2: Choose your units! There are 3 types of unit available in the Pledge Levels!

Every race has options available for each unit type. 

- Sections - The standard grunts of your army, these come in all manner of shapes and sizes. We will unlock several new Sections for each faction during the Kickstarter through our Stretch Goals.

- Command - A set of figures that will command or aid the rest of your army. 

- Support - A set of optional heavier weapon teams that will help give your army some extra punch. 

Disclaimer: You will choose exactly which units in the Pledge Manager, after the Kickstarter finishes. You can also buy any of these units as add-ons for £22 each!

Step 3: Select your add-ons! There are loads of gaming accessories, artifacts such as printed Posters and T-Shirts and also extra units, including extra unit types, such as Heroes, Brutes and Armoured Monsters.

Read on for a full list of add-ons. 

Disclaimer: You will choose exactly which add-ons you want in the Pledge Manager, after the Kickstarter finishes. Be sure to add the cost of the add-ons you want before the Kickstarter ends, so that we can smash those stretch goals!
You can now choose to pledge by PayPal, if you are unable to pledge by traditional means. Simply email hystericalgamesorders@gmail.com and we will invite you to the Pledge Manager after the Kickstarter ends where you can add more items or upgrade.
Dwarf Grenadiers, Dwarf Command, Dwarf Support, Gnome Voltigeurs, Gnome Command, Gnome Support are now available!
