There are a host of amazing add-ons available in this Kickstarter! 
Every single Pledge Level allows you access to these. Simply add the appropriate amount to your pledge amount and you will be able to select your add ons in the Pledge Manager once the project ends!
 Panzerfäuste: Skirmish Rulebook - £10 - A beautiful, full colour and approximately 96 pages (subject to possible change), A4 format paperback book which describes how to play Panzerfäuste: Skirmish and contains full background of the Panzerfäuste setting through the eyes of one of the Dwarves of the Straftgruppe Loki. 
Panzerfäuste Mass Battle Rulebook - £25 - The brand new rules for Panzerfäuste, this A4, full colour, roughly 180-280 pages (subject to possible change) and hardback book will describe how to bring full armies of Dwarves, Orcs, Gnomes and more to the tabletop as well as in depth stories and descriptions for every aspect of the setting.
Panzerfäuste Map of the Land A2 Poster - £8 - A full colour, high quality roughly A2 sized (42.0 x 59.4cm, 16.53 x 23.39 inches print of the beautiful crafted Map of The Land painted by Piotr Chrzanowski.

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE Panzerfäuste T-Shirt - £15 - Final print may vary from those shown, but this will be a black, 'Fruit of the Loom' T-Shirt available in Small, Medium, Large, XL and XXL and printed with high quality in mind. If you would like a smaller or larger size, please feel free to PM us and we will work hard to find the right size for you. 

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE Panzerfäuste Messenger Bag - £25 - A custom printed, high quality canvas Messenger Bag to carry around your rulebooks, dice, tape measures and even a small case of figures inside! 
Panzerfäuste Template Set - £10- A set of all the tokens and templates you will need to play both Panzerfäuste: Skirmish AND Panzerfäuste: Mass Battle. This product is subject to change in composition (exact components to be confirmed before the Pledge Manager).
(Currently contains 1 Burst Template, x5 Critical Success Tokens, x5 Critical Failure Tokens, x5 Jammed Tokens and x5 Suppressed Tokens)
Panzerfäuste: Mass Battle Shared Magick Decks - £5 - You may select one of two (or both!) currently available Shared Magick Decks as an add-on! Each deck is £5. You may choose 'Operation: Blutrach' (Dwarven invasion of the Gnomes), 'Operation: Unterberg' (Dwarven invasion of the Troglodytes).  
Disclaimer: You will need a Shared Magick Deck to play Panzerfäuste: Mass Battle!
Panzerfäuste: Mass Battle Faction Magick Decks - £3 - You may select one of any of the currently available Shared Magick Decks as an add-on! Each deck is £3. You may choose 'Enigma' (Dwarves and Orcs Magick), 'Illusionism' (Gnomes Magick), Shamanism (Troglodytes Magick) or 'Necromancy' (Deathless Magick). 
Disclaimer: These are the cards you require to use the Magick Teams in your Command Sets in Mass Battle!
Panzerfäuste: Skirmish Dice Set - £2 - A set of x5 D6 in a Red and Black marbled plastic, filled with gold dots. All the Dice a General should need to play Panzerfäuste: Skirmish! 
Disclaimer: These dice are now CUSTOM PRINTED! 
 Panzerfäuste: Mass Battle Dice Set - £4 - A set of x5 D6 and x5 D20s in a Red and Black marbled plastic, filled with gold dots (D6) or numbering (D20). All the Dice a General should need to play Panzerfäuste: Mass Battle and Panzerfäuste: Skirmish! 
Disclaimer: These dice are now CUSTOM PRINTED! 
In the Community
We've been very lucky to have quite a bit of coverage! Apologies if we miss anyone, just let us know!

Tales from the Man Cave (Blog)

Beasts of War
The Dread Cave (Youtube)

Chilling Wargamers (Youtube)
Shipping and Postage Charges 
 A Note on Shipping Hysterical Games has experienced a few Kickstarters (as creators, but mostly as backers!) and spoken to a lot of different people regarding shipping in particular. We've used other people's experiences to guide our decision to charge shipping after the Kickstarter ends, based on actual costs. We will collect this charge via our Pledge Manager after the campaign closes. Sadly, our toys are quite heavy (especially because we won't skimp on quality!). This also means that the campaign can focus on what stretch goal rewards we give you! We will be shipping your pledges from Europe. Our aim is to use a tracked UPS service, so that you, at all times, know where your pledge is once it has left us.
We will also be offering the option of paying extra for split shipments, so you can start playing with your models as soon as possible!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a few potential setbacks in any project, these could be obvious from the start or at the end or when we ship! However, the obvious ones to me now are: 

1. Printing - This is outsourced, we don't envisage any problems but it is possible there could be unavoidable delays for reasons beyond our control. We have 3 suppliers lined up. 

2. Manufacture of miniatures - We have decided to take upon the ourselves. Rob is a talented mouldmaker and caster, who has worked professionally on resin casting for a number of years. This will allow us to update you all with the most up to date information that we can provide. Some elements may be outsourced, but this is unlikely. 

3. Rules development - With the help of you guys, there should be no issue here. 

4. Popularity - We're confident that our planning will avoid this! However, it's worth saying the obvious which is that the more popular the project is, the more stretch goals there will be and the more product we have to provide. In every Kickstarter, this causes delay. 

5. Shipping - International customers (outside of the EU) may encounter unexpected import taxes and/or delays in customs. You can contact your customs department for more information. We are aiming to use UPS, who have a stellar track record. 

Throughout this Kickstarter, we will make sure that you guys are communicated with to the best of our ability, to show exactly where we are and exactly where any delays are coming from and how we are tackling them. We have all of the concept art done for the next 3 Factions and the rules are basically there. Now we just need to tie the loose ends and turn this into a marketable product!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Some News You Might Want To Read…
updates.update_content:
I wasn’t expecting to post again quite as quickly and whilst I am not in a position to go into details and still need to start lining up some ducks, there is some light at the end of the (still) very long tunnel.
A good chunk of the day was spent looking at all the resin moulds with a caster, trying to work out what they were etc. and for the most part they still seem usable (the proof of the pudding will be in the casting but maybe things aren’t quite as bad as I was led to believe), hopefully the last few codes needed for this KS will still be ok to produce the last few minis needed for backers.

updates.update_userinfo: Not The News You Want To Read...
updates.update_content:
Apologies for the delay in an update, unfortunately I (somehow) managed to tear my retina which necessitated in having emergency laser eye surgery twice and not being able to attend Colours as planned (so that was another pile of money lost on the trade stand we couldn’t use).
As bad news likes company I also found out that the resin miniature moulds I rescued from Hysterical last December were now useless. Apparently these things have a limited shelf life (unlike metal figure moulds), something I wasn’t aware of.
Of course this means that trying to fulfil the Kickstarter is now even harder. When I said I would try and rescue it I was starting from a position of no money.  I never received a penny from Hysterical so it wasn’t a case I could use something from them to move things on and despite some decent sales at Crusade and Partizan, the cost of some stock we had cast for Partizan (before the moulds went kaput), the trade stands and the storage costs mean that I’ve been running at an increasing loss for some time now.

Hi everyone
Apologies once again for the delay in providing an update, I’m not quite sure where the last couple of months have gone.
Unfortunately nothing to report, money is proving a problem, we are operating at a considerable loss at the moment. Any profit we have made at the two shows we have done has pretty much been wiped out by the trade stand costs and the restock we did for Partizan. The monthly storage costs are on top of this so we are several hundred pounds in the red and my hopes we would be making money to kickstart the Kickstarter is not looking too good at the moment. I need to have a good sit down and plan something that can be done, give the constraints I have on my spare time having a full time job and family commitments.

updates.update_userinfo: All Quiet on the Panzerfäuste Front...
updates.update_content:
Dear backers
Apologies for the delay in providing an update, I had not realised I had left it so long.
The good news is the errant Schweinhund jaw has been sent to the contract casters so hopefully we can get those pledges sorted. Still waiting on news of the Gnome Marins.
More good news is that we will be at Partizan on Sunday 19th May in Newark and, fingers crossed, we should have stock of all the Orc and Dwarf codes (including the wave 3b stuff) for sale.

Dear Backers
Further to the last update it turns out that the missing lower jaw on one of the Dwarf Uhlan schweinhund was not in the mould (I know), so the master needed finding and then to be sent to the contract caster so they could cast up the required number of pieces for backers. 
This proved to be a more onerous task than I anticipated as I could not find the Uhlan masters in any of the master sets I picked up from Hysterical Towers back in December. Fortunately as I was just giving into despair/swearing loudly, I found a random box crammed with ziplock bags of 3D prints and resin models that at the bottom of (as they were bound to be) were the Uhlan masters!

Dear Backers
Unfortunately not a lot of good news to report but nothing catastrophic and I think it is best to try and keep you informed of what is going on, so here goes...
First off the good news is Crusade went pretty well, better than I expected, so thanks to everyone who came and said hello and bought something from the random pile of stock we had. I am still targeting Partizan as our next show.

updates.update_userinfo: Cunning plans and the road to Penarth...
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers
As I was driving back from Atherstone-on-Stour with the last car load of Hysterical bits and pieces on December 21st, my head was cunning plans to sort out lots of Kickstarter things through January and then hit the show scene at the end of the month to start raising money to complete the Kickstarters. Well I will be at Crusade in Penarth this coming Saturday with a stand but that is about all that has gone right this month!

project_data.project_name: Panzerfäuste: Mechanised Warfare in a Mythical Realm

campaign.story:
All pledges must be made in full by November 5 at 7:59 pm CST. We don't use a pledge manager—backers may NOT increase their pledge or add on more items at the KS prices after the campaign ends. Future pre-orders and add-ons can be made on our website.
Designed by Jamey Stegmaier (Viticulture & Euphoria) and based on the art and worldbuilding of Jakub Rozalski, Scythe is a 4x game (explore, expand, exploit, exterminate) set in an alternate-history, 1920s Eastern Europe. Scythe tells the stories of 5 factions competing over an unclaimed patch of land surrounding the mysterious Factory.
During Scythe's 750+ blind playtests, the playtesters consistently said they most enjoyed:
the dual benefits of the upgrade system (increase an action benefit and decrease a cost)
the distinctly different faction and mech abilities
the thematic choices presented by the encounter cards
the asymmetry and variability created by random pairings of faction and player mats
the twist to area control due to all resources being kept on the board
Check out the Scythe rules and playtest print-and-play files to see how Scythe blends an engine-building system inspired by Terra Mystica with a deterministic combat system influenced by Kemet. Renders of the 25 miniatures in Scythe are below the "What's in the Box?" image.
To add items onto your pledge, manually add the $ amount during the project. We don't use a pledge manager, so all pledges must be made in full by November 5. You can mix and match up to 3 total games (any version) and any number of add-ons. On the post-project survey, you will tell us the various items that comprise your pledge.
Each player is represented on the board by a character and their animal companion (1 miniature). Each character miniature has a 25mm base and a height of 36-58mm.
Each faction has 4 mechs in their faction color that can be deployed during the game. Each mech miniature has a 30mm base and a height of 26-36mm.
This is an example of a faction mat (the Rusviet faction). This shows your faction's special ability, starting military strength, mech abilities, and one-time recruit benefits.
                                                                                                                                                        This is an example of a player mat ("Patriotic"). Each player mat is divided into four sections, each with a top-row action and a bottom-row action. Your actions improve as you build your economic engine.
The highly detailed game board for Scythe (full board on left, sample territory on right) depicts the areas near the mysterious Factory. This is a fully-formed world with a specific story, so the board is not modular (see FAQ for more details).
                                             All promo items are included in every Kickstarter game for free and will be available for additional cost post-Kickstarter (there is no Kickstarter-exclusive content). All non-promo stretch goals are in every version of the game.
Find all Scythe media on our website and join discussions about the game on BGG.
"Scythe is a game that’s about contrasts. It is complex in strategies and options, yet the action choices are fairly simple and the game is easy to pick up." — Dave Banks, GeekDad overview and review
"Scythe is so good as to almost defy description." — JR Honeycutt, The Nerds' Table overview and review
Also see Gen Con preview videos filmed by Joel Eddy and TechRaptor, as well as special episodes of Board Gamers Anonymous and Ding & Dent.
In addition to the gameplay video below (or on YouTube for full annotations in the description), here are Scythe's rules and free playtest PnP files.
Our money-back guarantee says that you can return your copy of Scythe (opened or unopened) within 1 month of receiving it for a full pledge refund, no questions asked. We'll even pay for return shipping.
The Factory promo pack contains 6 extra Factory cards for Kickstarter backers. The promo pack will be available for an additional cost to those who discover Scythe after the Kickstarter campaign.
It may not be these exact Factory cards that end up in the promo pack.
The custom metal coins  (80 total) featured in the Premium, Collector's, and Art Connoisseur Edition games were designed specifically for Scythe. The set of coins is available for order by itself on the Stonemaier Games website for $25 (+ shipping) or as an add-on to any copy of the game for $22.
The plastic resource containers (4 total) in the Premium, Collector's, and Art Connoisseur Edition games allow for easy storage, setup, and distribution of the various tokens and coins in Scythe. There's room for exactly 4 of these containers in the Scythe box.
Plastic container with coin prototypes.
The board extension in the Collector's and Art Connoisseur Editions slides next to the back side of the game board, creating a complete board with +50% bigger hexes (the content is the same; see Update 3). All units and resources in Scythe are kept on the board, so the larger hexes provide more space.
The game board is 624x818mm, and it grows to 818x936mm with the extension. It is available as an add-on to any copy of the game for $10 (every game board is double-sided) and will be available to order from our website by itself for $12 (+ shipping) after the project ends.
The realistic resource tokens (made out of resin or zinc) in the Collector's and Art Connoisseur Editions replace the wooden resource tokens (there are no wooden resource tokens in those editions). They include 80 tokens (20 each) for food, metal, oil, and wood. These tokens are available in our treasure chests (one in each chest), as well as in an add-on to any copy of the game for $21.
The individually-numbered boxes in the Collector's and Art Connoisseur Editions are randomly assigned. The limit of these boxes will be determined by the total number of backers at those levels.
The art book included with the Art Connoisseur Edition is a 100-page, full-color, hardback collection of the art featured in Scythe, as well as other pieces in Jakub Rozalski's acclaimed 1920s series. The book will measure approximately 250x290mm. It's available for pre-order by itself on the Stonemaier Games website for $25 (+ shipping) or as an add-on to any copy of the game for $23. The art book will be packed externally from the game box.
The wooden resource tokens aren't in the Collector's and Art Connoisseur Editions, so if you want both one of those games and wooden resources (or if you just want extra resources with any version of Scythe), please add $10 to your pledge. This is for an external pack of 20 food/grain, 20 metal, 20 wood, and 20 oil tokens.
Samples on the left; final colors on the right.
We ship games in bulk to fulfillment centers around the world to reduce customs fees & VAT and to keep shipping prices low (this method is explained here; country codes are here).
Backers are limited to 3 total games per pledge (a mix of any 3 versions of the game is fine; only pay the shipping fee once per pledge, not once per game). To add more games beyond the first (or add-ons), manually enter the $ total when making your pledge or click the blue "Manage" button next to a previously made pledge.
An example of an encounter card. When your character reaches certain parts of the board, they encounter a situation that gives you a choice of one of the three options.
We like to support game stores around the world by offering the special Kickstarter versions of the game to retailers during the campaign. We treat retailer backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before we release regular retail games into distribution.
If you're a retailer, please contact Jamey at stonemaiergames@gmail.com during the campaign for pricing information. After the campaign, you can reserve retail copies of Scythe by contacting our distribution broker: paul@greaterthangames.com
An example of an objective card. Each player receives 2 objectives at the beginning of the game and can complete one of them as a goal.
Jamey Stegmaier is the designer of Scythe, Viticulture, Tuscany, and Euphoria. He's also the co-founder and president of Stonemaier Games, and he's written a book about crowdfunding.
Jakub Rozalski is the artist, worldbuilder, and creative director of Scythe. Art prints of his work are available for purchase from him here.
Morten Monrad Pedersen is Stonemaier's development specialist. He designed the Automa solo variant for Scythe as detailed on his BGG blog.
Carsten Biernat & Jozsef Szollosi of Unique Voodoo Studio are the 3D modelers for Scythe's miniatures. 
Christine Santana is the lead graphic designer for Stonemaier Games.
Chris Matthew is the Panda Game Manufacturing project manager for Scythe.
Scott Wadyko is the the sculptor of the realistic resource tokens found in the collector's edition and in our new treasure chests.
Video: The project video was created by Josh McDowell,  narrated by A.T. Chandler, and features original Scythe music composed by Michał Woźniak. The gif explaining the board extension was designed by Bryce Walter and reduced in size for faster loading times by Bruce Alcorn.
Playtesters: The development process for Scythe featured over 750 blind playtests and 628 individual playtesters. We owe a huge debt of gratitude to all of them, especially to Barry Schmaling (who built the playtester forum) and all of the lead playtesters. They had a lot to say about Scythe, but here are a few of our favorite quotes:
“Farm your little piece of the world, spread out and colonise as much as you can, or rampage with mechs projecting lethal force over your opponents. This game has it all and with so many routes to victory, no two games are the same.” — Stephen ‘Azrael’ Ogden
“Scythe is an excellent blend of resource management and conflict which also manages to leave you with a delightful sense of having told a story." — Andrew Busam
“The Automa is challenging, relentless, and at times unforgiving, but it's also a whole lot of fun. It's a worthy adversary that earns a begrudging respect.” — Jeremiah Power
While we don't offer existing inventory or unrelated products as add-ons through Kickstarter, we offer other Stonemaier products on our website. These items will ship right away and cannot be held until Scythe ships.
Viticulture, Tuscany, Euphoria, Between Two Cities, and our treasure chests are also available from your friendly local game store.
Jamey's book, A Crowdfunder's Strategy Guide: Build a Better Business by Building Community, is available in a number of online and offline locations.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Through Stonemaier Games, Jamey Stegmaier has raised over $1.4 million on Kickstarter and has delivered over 20,000 individual rewards to backers within a few months of the estimated delivery date (most are on time or early). He is an avid backer and gamer, and his book about crowdfunding was published in September 2015: http://stonemaiergames.com/kickstarter/book/

However, Scythe presented three specific new challenges: miniatures, shipping, and balance.

This is our first time working with plastic miniatures. We had heard horror stories about other projects involving miniatures, and we've experienced a few as backers. So we wanted to start early to avoid some of the delays that can occur as the result of miniatures. We started working with Jakub and his 3D modelers in March, using Shapeways to print each version of the sculpts to see how they worked on the game board. We also worked closely with Panda's team throughout the process to make sure the sculpts are feasible and durable. We've created the molds for the miniatures and are ready for production.

We've picked up and dropped fulfillment partners over time, keeping those who pack our games well and excel at communication. Because shipping is particularly important for Scythe—a big game with a box that we want delivered in pristine condition—we tested out two new-to-us fulfillment partners (Funagain in the US and Snakes & Lattes in Canada) on our previous project in preparation for Scythe. We add those two to Ideaspatcher in Europe, Good Games in Australia, and Agility in China, all three of which we've worked on in the past and have had excellent results.

One of the main features of Scythe's gameplay is asymmetry between factions. It's tough to balance an asymmetric game, so after we got Scythe to a good place with local playtesters, we ran 3 different waves of multi-player blind playtesting and 2 waves of solo blind playtesting. The huge amount of anecdotal and quantitative data we collected as a result helped us ensure that Scythe is extremely well balanced (and fun!).

If you would like to know more about what we learned from our Kickstarter experiences and research, go to http://stonemaiergames.com/kickstarter/full-list-chronological/ to see 160+ Kickstarter Lessons to help you create a successful project too.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi! You probably already have the information in this update if you're a member of the Scythe Facebook group or if you subscribe to the Stonemaier Games e-newsletter, but in case not, here's some news! 
Actually, before I dive into the news, I wanted to say thank you for bringing Scythe to life back in November 2015. The Kickstarter printing was for 26,000 English copies. Over 3 years later, there are nearly 300,000 copies of Scythe in circulation in over a dozen languages. I am humbled and grateful for your trust and generosity back when Scythe was being born.

updates.update_userinfo: Iron Harvest, The Rise of Fenris, and Other News
updates.update_content:
Hi! You probably already have the information in this update if you're a member of the Scythe Facebook group, but in case not, here's some news!
Iron Harvest
Iron Harvest launched today on Kickstarter! Here's what you need to know:
This is a video game set in the same 1920+ world (created by Jakub Rozalski) as Scythe. It is a real-time combat game developed by a company called King Art Games.  
Stonemaier Games has absolutely no connection to Iron Harvest (other than the personal connection that we support Jakub).

Hi! If you haven't joined the Scythe Facebook group or subscribed to the Stonemaier Games e-newsletter, you've been out of the loop for the last 6 months. Come join us!
Scythe: The Wind Gambit
Today is the release day for the second Scythe expansion, The Wind Gambit. I've been excited to release this expansion ever since Kai Starck originally introduced the idea, rulebook, and playtest results in the Scythe Facebook group. It was a pleasure to work with Kai to hone the idea of adding a 4th unit type to the game (airships), as well as a new module of resolution tiles that change the end-game triggers. And of course, as always, it's awesome to work with Jakub.

updates.update_userinfo: The Wind Gambit, Legendary Box, and What's Next
updates.update_content:
Hi! If you haven't joined the Scythe Facebook group or subscribed to the Stonemaier Games e-newsletter, you've been out of the loop for the last 6 months. I've missed you!
The Wind Gambit
The second expansion for Scythe is now entering production and should be available from retailers worldwide in early November (some international copies may be at Essen Spiel). You can read all about it here, but the big news I wanted to share today is that I have the final resin tooling master for the airships.

Hi! I hope you're doing well. I've had the pleasure of chatting with many of you on the Scythe Facebook group and on BoardGameGeek, but I understand that some of you prefer to stick with Kickstarter for Scythe-related communication. Today's topic is for you.
Invaders from Afar
The expansion to Scythe, Invaders from Afar, adds 2 new factions to the game that can be used at any player count. It also adds 2 new player mats, enabling play for up to 7 players. More details about the expansion can be found , and it's listed on BGG .

Hi! A month has passed since the previous update, and I'll just say it: I miss you! I had such a good time updating you and hearing your thoughts, ideas, and excitement for so long that it's been very different to move away from the Kickstarter portion of this project. Fortunately I've seen many of you on the various forms of social media I mentioned on the previous update.
I've accumulated a short list of random notes, so I thought it might be a good time to let you know what's happening in the world of Scythe.
MeepleSource and Promos

updates.update_userinfo: Gen Con, the Expansion, and More Animals
updates.update_content:
Hi! I have some fun updates today. After this you'll see updates slow down quite a bit. I'll let you know via project updates about big news--like when we release the expansion to distributors (there's no pre-order)--but for other Scythe-related news, please subscribe to the following:
daily news (reviews, questions, etc): Facebook group and Twitter
daily comments/threads: Scythe on BoardGameGeek
monthly news (new releases, product status, special announcements): e-newsletter

updates.update_userinfo: So Many Scythe Cats, Gen Con, and the Second-to-Last Shipping Update
updates.update_content:
Hi! When I recently asked you to send me photos of your cats and pets with Scythe, I thought I'd get a few photos at most. Much to my surprise, I received over 80 photos! We have some business to discuss first, but if you need a little cuteness in your day, I hope you enjoy the bottom half of this update.
Shipping Update (Europe)

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update, Reviews, and Buying Stuff
updates.update_content:
Hi! It's nearing the end of July 20th, the date by which I said that all backers would receive their tracking number (the final estimated delivery date, July 27, is still a week away). Let's jump right in to see if those estimates hold true.
If you've already received your tracking number or your game, you can skip to the next section of this update.
Shipping Update

updates.update_userinfo: Replacement Parts, a Poll, and Scythe Cats
updates.update_content:
Hi! Only a week has passed since the last update, but I have a lot of stuff to share.
Replacement Parts
If you discover at any point that there is a missing or broken component in Scythe, please read this page and fill out the form there. Our replacement part helpers around the world will send you the missing part within 10 days. In most cases you won't get an e-mail or confirmation--if you fill out the form, we will receive the form.
